original: na ba'i tshad mi phod na'o //
analyzed: na ba'i tshad mi phod na'o //
translated: If he is unable to work because of illness.

original: na na yang yang zar dbang ba'i tshad ni na ste las byed mi phod par na na yang yang zar dbang ngo //
analyzed: na na yang yang zar dbang ba'i tshad ni na ste las byed mi phod par na na yang yang zar dbang ngo //
translated: If he is unable to work because of illness, he may eat as much as he likes.

original: nar ma ni spyan drangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nar ma ni spyan drangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not invited if he is a regular guest.

original: yon bdag gis lo drug gam tshe gcig tu zan sbyar ba ni spyan drangs pa zhes mi bya ste gzhan zhig gis gud du spyan drangs te khas blangs pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: yon bdag gis lo drug gam tshe gcig tu zan sbyar ba ni spyan drangs pa zhes mi bya ste gzhan zhig gis gud du spyan drangs te khas blangs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If a patron provides food for six years or for life, it is not called an invitation. There is no fault if someone else invites him separately and he accepts.

original: yon bdag gis zhal tshus dang gro gnyis kar nar mar sbyar te za na'ang las bya dgos so //
analyzed: yon bdag gis zhal tshus dang gro gnyis kar nar mar sbyar te za na'ang las bya dgos so //
translated: If a patron provides both vegetables and barley flour regularly, he must work.

original: mthong ba tsam yang ngo ;
analyzed: mthong ba tsam yang ngo ;
translated: It is also permissible to eat if he sees it.ğŸ”½If a companion says, â€œI am eating. You should eat,â€ and he eats, it is permissible. If he has already eaten, he should not eat the food of a guest or a regular guest, or food at the residence of a nun and so on.

original: / grogs shig g-yar sus za zhing 'dug pa la bdag zas zos zin te song ba mthong nas bdar te zo zhes zer te zos na'ang rung bdag zan zos zin pa las dge slong ma la sogs pa'i gnas su 'ongs te g-yar sus sam bca' ba mi bzar
analyzed: / grogs shig g-yar sus za zhing 'dug pa la bdag zas zos zin te song ba mthong nas bdar te zo zhes zer te zos na'ang rung bdag zan zos zin pa las dge slong ma la sogs pa'i gnas su 'ongs te g-yar sus sam bca' ba mi bzar
translated: If he is invited to a patronâ€™s house, he should not eat the food of a guest or a regular guest, or food at the residence of a nun and so on.

original: mi rung zhes zer te zos na'ang nyes med do //ğŸ”½med par @139a * //
analyzed: mi rung zhes zer te zos na'ang nyes med do // med par @139a * //
translated: If one says, â€œIt is not suitable,â€ and eats, there is no fault.ğŸ”½If one lies about not having eaten,

original: bslu ba byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: bslu ba byas na yang ngo //
translated: there is also no fault.

original: sngar rtsed mo'ang brdzun du zan la spyan drangs pa las zan med par gyur te phyis gzhan zhig gis bos te zos na'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: sngar rtsed mo'ang brdzun du zan la spyan drangs pa las zan med par gyur te phyis gzhan zhig gis bos te zos na'ang nyes med do //
translated: Previously, when one invited to a meal, there was no food, and later, when invited by another, one ate, there was no fault.

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun yang ngo //ğŸ”½dge slong gcig cig dgos shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun yang ngo // dge slong gcig cig dgos shing /
translated: Therefore, it is the same for the Saá¹…gha.ğŸ”½If one is invited to the Saá¹…gha, one must be invited by a monk.ğŸ”½If one is invited to the Saá¹…gha, one must be invited by a monk.

original: gces pa'i phyir dge 'dun du langs par spyan drangs na dge slong ming gis dgos pa de dag gi gnas su'ang g-yar sus zos la spyan drangs par yang zan zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gces pa'i phyir dge 'dun du langs par spyan drangs na dge slong ming gis dgos pa de dag gi gnas su'ang g-yar sus zos la spyan drangs par yang zan zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one eats the food of invitation in the place of those who are invited by name, and if one eats the food of invitation, there is an offense.ğŸ”½If one eats the food of invitation and the food of the regular series, there is no fault.

original: gzhan ni bdag gis g-yar sus dang nyi rim du zos kyang nyes med de g-yam la song song ba las gzhan du spyan drangs na der song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag gis g-yar sus dang nyi rim du zos kyang nyes med de g-yam la song song ba las gzhan du spyan drangs na der song yang nyes med do //
translated: If one is invited to another place, there is no fault in going there.

original: 'di gzhan lnga po la byin cig / kha du ma zhig tu spyan drangs na kun du 'gro zhing bzar mi dbang ba'i phyir dge slong pha dang dge slong ma dang dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma gag kyang rung bdag gi skyin par btang ba ni
analyzed: 'di gzhan lnga po la byin cig / kha du ma zhig tu spyan drangs na kun du 'gro zhing bzar mi dbang ba'i phyir dge slong pha dang dge slong ma dang dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma gag kyang rung bdag gi skyin par btang ba ni
translated: If one invites many to a meal, it is permissible to give the leftovers to any fully ordained monk or nun, male or female trainee, or novice nun, because they are all able to eat leftovers.

original: nyes med do //
analyzed: nyes med do //
translated: This is not a fault.

original: de ni chos so //ğŸ”½s'u tra ltag ma ltar skyin par btang ba yang nyes med pa ni rab tu rigs pa'i chos yin pas nyes med do //
analyzed: de ni chos so // s'u tra ltag ma ltar skyin par btang ba yang nyes med pa ni rab tu rigs pa'i chos yin pas nyes med do //
translated: This is the Dharma.ğŸ”½Giving leftovers is also not a fault, because it is a well-known practice.

original: gzhan yang longs shig / bdag zan nar mar yon bdag gis zan spyar bzhin du gzhan zhig gis zan bskyal te byin nam rgyu bskyal te byin na dge slong dang dge 'dun la sbyin pa'i phyir blangs kyang nyes med do zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: gzhan yang longs shig / bdag zan nar mar yon bdag gis zan spyar bzhin du gzhan zhig gis zan bskyal te byin nam rgyu bskyal te byin na dge slong dang dge 'dun la sbyin pa'i phyir blangs kyang nyes med do zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: If one is invited to a regular meal by a patron, and another person brings food and gives it to the monk, or if one brings food and gives it to the Saá¹…gha, it is not a fault to accept it for the sake of the Saá¹…gha or the individual monk. This is explained by Vijayasena.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar skyin par btang ba'i dge slong rnam lngas zan blangs shing zos kyang nyes med do zhes bi shudhas bshad /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar skyin par btang ba'i dge slong rnam lngas zan blangs shing zos kyang nyes med do zhes bi shudhas bshad /
translated: The five monks who were repaid in kind like the latter Sutra are innocent if they accept and eat the food.

original: mu ge'i tshe na ci tsam spyan 'dren pa 'grub par bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: mu ge'i tshe na ci tsam spyan 'dren pa 'grub par bdag gir bya'o //
translated: Vishudhana explains that when there is famine, one should accept as much as one can carry.

original: lo nyes pa dang mu ge byung ba'i tshe ni kha du mar spyan drangs shing zan byin pa'i khas blangs shing 'gro'o //
analyzed: lo nyes pa dang mu ge byung ba'i tshe ni kha du mar spyan drangs shing zan byin pa'i khas blangs shing 'gro'o //
translated: When there is a bad harvest and famine, one should accept and give food to many people.

original: zos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zos pa yang ngo //
translated: One should also eat it.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kha du mar spyan drangs shing song ba der zan lan du mar zos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kha du mar spyan drangs shing song ba der zan lan du mar zos kyang nyes med do //
translated: The five monks who accept and go to many places like the latter Sutra are innocent if they eat food many times in return.

original: sbyin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang ngo //
translated: One should also give.

original: mu ge'i tshe kha mang pa zhig tu spyan drangs te bdag gis mi khyab na dge slong rnam lnga las kha du mar spyan drangs shing skyin par bkye ba dang bdag la rgyu lhag pa byin pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mu ge'i tshe kha mang pa zhig tu spyan drangs te bdag gis mi khyab na dge slong rnam lnga las kha du mar spyan drangs shing skyin par bkye ba dang bdag la rgyu lhag pa byin pa ni nyes med do //
translated: When there is famine, if one invites many people and one cannot manage it, it is innocent if one invites many monks and repays them and gives extra to oneself.

original: 'bul ba mi dad par gyur na kham gnyis gsum yan chad zos la khyim bdag dge slong 'di zas kyis phongs kyi rjes su yi rangs shig 'di la sbyin no zhes dad pa skyed cig / mu ge'i tshe kha du mar spyan drangs la bdag gi ltor mi
analyzed: 'bul ba mi dad par gyur na kham gnyis gsum yan chad zos la khyim bdag dge slong 'di zas kyis phongs kyi rjes su yi rangs shig 'di la sbyin no zhes dad pa skyed cig / mu ge'i tshe kha du mar spyan drangs la bdag gi ltor mi
translated: If, during a famine, many people invite the monk to their homes, but he cannot eat in all of them, he should eat in two or three and say to the others, â€œI cannot eat in all your houses.ğŸ”½Rejoice and give to this monk. It is a great merit and a great virtue to give food to a monk who is in need of food.â€

original: shong @139b mi khyab ste grogs rnam lngar skyin par zar bcug pa la skyin bdag mi dga' bar gyur na bdag gis kham gnyis sam gsum zos la dge slong 'di zas kyis phongs pa yin te 'di la zas sbyin pa ni bsod nams che ste yon tan du
analyzed: shong @139b mi khyab ste grogs rnam lngar skyin par zar bcug pa la skyin bdag mi dga' bar gyur na bdag gis kham gnyis sam gsum zos la dge slong 'di zas kyis phongs pa yin te 'di la zas sbyin pa ni bsod nams che ste yon tan du
translated: If the hosts are displeased, the monk should say, â€œI have eaten two or three mouthfuls in your house. This monk is in need of food. It is a great merit and a great virtue to give food to a monk who is in need of food.ğŸ”½Do not be displeased. Rejoice.â€

original: 'gyur gyis mi dga' bar ma byed par rjes su yi rangs par byos shig ces bshad la sbyin bdag dga' bar bya ste bdag gi skyin par dge slong gzhan zas zar bcug la bdag gud du 'gro'o //ğŸ”½yang yang za ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur gyis mi dga' bar ma byed par rjes su yi rangs par byos shig ces bshad la sbyin bdag dga' bar bya ste bdag gi skyin par dge slong gzhan zas zar bcug la bdag gud du 'gro'o // yang yang za ba'o //
translated: He should then go to another house and let another monk eat in his place.ğŸ”½Eating again and again.

original: yang yang za ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall is completed by eating again and again.

original: // /'ba' zhig gi ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'ba' zhig gi ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation of the downfall of the solitary one is as follows.

original: 'di chos pa'i ma yin pa /ğŸ”½sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin pa mur 'dug gi chos byed pa 'khod pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / khyim pa'i bdag po dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'di chos pa'i ma yin pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin pa mur 'dug gi chos byed pa 'khod pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / khyim pa'i bdag po dang bcas pa /
translated: It is not the downfall of a Dharma practitioner.ğŸ”½It is the downfall of a monk who is a nihilist, who is sitting in a place where nihilistic views are practiced.

original: gnas kyi sbyin bdag khyim pa yin la sbyin bdag dang bcas par 'dug pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / mur 'dug thams cad kyi ma yin pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi sbyin bdag khyim pa yin la sbyin bdag dang bcas par 'dug pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / mur 'dug thams cad kyi ma yin pa'i gnas su'o //
translated: It is the downfall of a monk who is sitting in a place where the householder is the master, where the householder is the master of the place.ğŸ”½It is not the downfall of all nihilists.

original: mur 'dug thams cad lam bsdoms kyi mur 'dug ste gcig la bsngos pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mur 'dug thams cad lam bsdoms kyi mur 'dug ste gcig la bsngos pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: It is the downfall of a nihilist who is sitting in a place where all nihilists are gathered, where he is assigned to one place.

original: mi na'am / dge slong na ba'i rkyen ma byung bar 'dug pa las ltung te yan lag gcig / sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs na'o //
analyzed: mi na'am / dge slong na ba'i rkyen ma byung bar 'dug pa las ltung te yan lag gcig / sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs na'o //
translated: It is the downfall of a monk who is sitting in a place where there is no sick monk or condition of sickness.ğŸ”½It is the downfall of a monk who is sitting in a place where the householder has invited him.

original: mur 'dug gi gnas der sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs pa ni ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi spyan ma drangs par song ste 'dug pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / zos nas der zos na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: mur 'dug gi gnas der sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs pa ni ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi spyan ma drangs par song ste 'dug pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / zos nas der zos na rtsa ba'o //
translated: It is not a downfall to go to a place where one is invited to stay for a while, but it is a downfall to stay there without being invited.

original: mur 'dug gi gnas su zan lan gcig zos pas ni ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi zan lan gnyis zos na ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mur 'dug gi gnas su zan lan gcig zos pas ni ltung bar mi 'gyur gyi zan lan gnyis zos na ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is not a downfall to eat at a place where one is invited to stay for a while, but it is a downfall to eat there a second time.

original: yan lag 'di drug dang ldan na ltung ba'o //ğŸ”½gnas nas yang gnas na yang nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag 'di drug dang ldan na ltung ba'o // gnas nas yang gnas na yang nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If one has all six of these factors, it is a downfall.ğŸ”½If one stays in one place for a second night, it is a minor infraction.

original: mur 'dug gi gnas su zan ma zos par yang zhag gcig 'dug pa ni nyes med de zan ma zos par zhag gnyis 'dug pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: mur 'dug gi gnas su zan ma zos par yang zhag gcig 'dug pa ni nyes med de zan ma zos par zhag gnyis 'dug pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: It is not a downfall to stay for one night in a place where one is invited to stay for a while, but it is a downfall to stay for a second night.

original: de las 'das na zhag re nyes byas /ğŸ”½bdag po med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de las 'das na zhag re nyes byas / bdag po med na yang ngo //
translated: If one stays for a second night, it is a minor infraction.ğŸ”½If one stays for a second night in a place where there is no host, it is also a minor infraction.

original: mur 'dug gi gnas de'i sbyin bdag khyim pa med pa zhig tu zan lan gnyis zos pa ni nyes byas lci ba /
analyzed: mur 'dug gi gnas de'i sbyin bdag khyim pa med pa zhig tu zan lan gnyis zos pa ni nyes byas lci ba /
translated: If one eats at a place where one is invited to stay for a while, but where there is no host, it is a serious minor infraction.

original: zan ma zos na zhag gnyis lon pa ni nyes byas yang ba'o //
analyzed: zan ma zos na zhag gnyis lon pa ni nyes byas yang ba'o //
translated: If one does not eat for two days, it is a light offense.

original: 'di rab tu byung bas mur 'dug bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rab tu byung bas mur 'dug bzhin no //
translated: This is for the ordained, not for the householder.

original: dge slong zhig @140a * //
analyzed: dge slong zhig @140a * //
translated: If a monk

original: gis yon bdag byas te mur 'dug gi phyir gnas byas pa'i sar zan lan gnyis zos na'ang nyes byas zan ma zos par zhag gnyis lon na'ang nyes byas yang ba'o //
analyzed: gis yon bdag byas te mur 'dug gi phyir gnas byas pa'i sar zan lan gnyis zos na'ang nyes byas zan ma zos par zhag gnyis lon na'ang nyes byas yang ba'o //
translated: acts as the patron and eats two meals in the place where the householder is staying, it is an offense. If one does not eat for two days, it is a light offense.

original: gnyen gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyen gyi yang ngo //
translated: It is the same for relatives.

original: gnyen khyim pa zhig gis mur 'dug gi gnas byas pa'i sar gnas na'ang s'u tra ltag ma dang 'dra bar nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnyen khyim pa zhig gis mur 'dug gi gnas byas pa'i sar gnas na'ang s'u tra ltag ma dang 'dra bar nyes byas so //
translated: If a lay relative stays in the place where the householder is staying, it is an offense, like the previous sÅ«tra.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the conduct of the solitary.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /ğŸ”½// / sbrus pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / sbrus pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of the solitary is complete.ğŸ”½The downfall of the cooked is explained.

original: spyan drangs pa'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs pa'o //
translated: The invited.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la song song pa las yon bdag dad pas kha zas ci bzhed pa bzhes shig ces dus kyis ma bdar ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig ma bcad /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la song song pa las yon bdag dad pas kha zas ci bzhed pa bzhes shig ces dus kyis ma bdar ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig ma bcad /
translated: A monk who has gone for alms is invited by a faithful patron to eat whatever he wishes. If he eats without being invited in a timely manner, it is a downfall. One part is not cut off.

original: dus kyis ni bdar gyi 'di tsam zhig khyer cig ces thang ma bcad pa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / ci bde zhes ma byas pa /
analyzed: dus kyis ni bdar gyi 'di tsam zhig khyer cig ces thang ma bcad pa las blangs na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / ci bde zhes ma byas pa /
translated: If one takes it without having determined the amount, saying, â€œTake just this much,â€ it is a downfall due to time.ğŸ”½If one does not say, â€œTake what you like,â€ it is a downfall due to time.

original: dus kyis ni bdar na ci 'dod pa khyer cig ces ma byas pa las ltung ste s'u tra ltag ma dang gnyis la yan lag gcig tu brtsi'o //
analyzed: dus kyis ni bdar na ci 'dod pa khyer cig ces ma byas pa las ltung ste s'u tra ltag ma dang gnyis la yan lag gcig tu brtsi'o //
translated: The last two are counted as one branch.

original: khyim bdag gi'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi'o //
translated: If one takes it from a householder who has been determined to be a suitable recipient, it is a downfall.

original: dus kyis bdar ba de khyim bdag kyang yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig /'bras btsos pa yul dbus su gyur 'chad kyi sra sta phyed dang lnga'i tshad kyi sras sta tshod ma dang sngor du bcas grogs po dang lhan cig pa ni skal ba'i
analyzed: dus kyis bdar ba de khyim bdag kyang yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig /'bras btsos pa yul dbus su gyur 'chad kyi sra sta phyed dang lnga'i tshad kyi sras sta tshod ma dang sngor du bcas grogs po dang lhan cig pa ni skal ba'i
translated: If the rice is cooked, if it is in the central region, if the portion is more than half an ara, if the portion is together with vegetables and spices, and if one eats it together with a friend, it is a downfall due to the portion.

original: bsod snyoms so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms so //
translated: The alms are the portion.

original: khyim bdag gis zas khyer cig ces dus kyis bstabs na 'bras btsos pa tshod ma dang sngor ma gtogs par sra sta phyed dang lnga grogs gzhan la yang sbyin zhing lhan cig bza' ba'i phyir blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis zas khyer cig ces dus kyis bstabs na 'bras btsos pa tshod ma dang sngor ma gtogs par sra sta phyed dang lnga grogs gzhan la yang sbyin zhing lhan cig bza' ba'i phyir blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the householder brings food at the proper time, saying, â€œPlease take some food,â€ then it is permissible to take half a measure of cooked rice and vegetables, and to give the other half to a companion in order to eat together.ğŸ”½If one takes more than half a measure of cooked rice, one commits an offense.

original: sra sta phyed dang lnga las lhag par blangs na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / sra sta phyed dang lnga las sra sta do la ni lhung bzed chen po gang sra sta phyed dang do la lhung bzed 'bring po gang /
analyzed: sra sta phyed dang lnga las lhag par blangs na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / sra sta phyed dang lnga las sra sta do la ni lhung bzed chen po gang sra sta phyed dang do la lhung bzed 'bring po gang /
translated: One measure of cooked rice is the amount that fits in a large begging bowl. Half a measure is the amount that fits in a medium begging bowl.

original: sra sta gang la lhung bzed chung du gang ste lhung bzed che chung gsum gyi tshad du ni len du dbang gi de las lhag pa'i lhung bzed chen po'i tshad du gsum len du mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: sra sta gang la lhung bzed chung du gang ste lhung bzed che chung gsum gyi tshad du ni len du dbang gi de las lhag pa'i lhung bzed chen po'i tshad du gsum len du mi dbang ngo //
translated: One-quarter of a measure is the amount that fits in a small begging bowl. One is allowed to take three of these, but not more than that.

original: zos na'o // dus kyis bdar te lhag par blangs pa'i kha zas de zos pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / byung ste'o //
analyzed: zos na'o // dus kyis bdar te lhag par blangs pa'i kha zas de zos pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / byung ste'o //
translated: If he eats it.ğŸ”½If he eats the food that was brought at the proper time, he commits an offense with one part.ğŸ”½If he takes the food that was brought at the proper time to another place, he commits an offense with one part.

original: dus kyis bstabs pa'i kha zas de gnas de nas gud du khyer ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig / yan lag @140b 'di rnams dang ldan na ltung ngo //
analyzed: dus kyis bstabs pa'i kha zas de gnas de nas gud du khyer ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig / yan lag @140b 'di rnams dang ldan na ltung ngo //
translated: If he has all of these parts, he has an offense.

original: der nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: der nyes byas pa'o //
translated: Here, it is a minor offense.

original: dus kyis bdar ba de lhag par blangs nas khyer te 'gro ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: dus kyis bdar ba de lhag par blangs nas khyer te 'gro ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If he takes the food that was brought at the proper time and carries it away, he commits a minor offense.

original: pha rol gyis byas kyang ngo //
analyzed: pha rol gyis byas kyang ngo //
translated: If it was done by another, it is the same.

original: dus kyis bdar ba'i kha zas de gzhan len du bcug ste gnas gzhan du 'ongs nas zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: dus kyis bdar ba'i kha zas de gzhan len du bcug ste gnas gzhan du 'ongs nas zos na nyes byas /
translated: If he has another person take the food that was brought at the proper time and he comes to another place and eats it, he commits a minor offense.

original: gzhan du na nyes med do ;
analyzed: gzhan du na nyes med do ;
translated: If it is otherwise, there is no offense.

original: / dus kyis bdar nas gzhan du ma khyer bar gnas de nyid du zos na ltung bzed du zos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: / dus kyis bdar nas gzhan du ma khyer bar gnas de nyid du zos na ltung bzed du zos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If he eats the food that was brought at the proper time in that very place without taking it elsewhere, he commits no offense, even if he eats it from the alms bowl.

original: 'dus ma byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas na yang ngo //
translated: If it is unconditioned, it is the same.

original: kha zas ma g-yos pa rgyur byin pa ni ci tsam blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: kha zas ma g-yos pa rgyur byin pa ni ci tsam blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If he receives uncooked food as a gift, there is no offense in taking as much as he likes.

original: skabs gzhan du nyes yod de gud nas 'chad do //
analyzed: skabs gzhan du nyes yod de gud nas 'chad do //
translated: Other faults will be explained elsewhere.

original: de ste blangs pa mang na dge slong dang bgo'o //
analyzed: de ste blangs pa mang na dge slong dang bgo'o //
translated: If one has taken a lot, one should share it with the monks.

original: sra sta phyed dang lnga man chad cig blangs pa las bdag gcig pus mi zad de lhag na dge slong gzhan dang bgo zhing bza'o //ğŸ”½lhung bzed gnyis gsum gang ba las lhag par len pa'o //
analyzed: sra sta phyed dang lnga man chad cig blangs pa las bdag gcig pus mi zad de lhag na dge slong gzhan dang bgo zhing bza'o // lhung bzed gnyis gsum gang ba las lhag par len pa'o //
translated: If one has taken less than half a drona and one cannot finish it alone, one should share it with other monks and eat it.ğŸ”½It is to take more than two or three full begging bowls.

original: sbrus pa lhung bzed gnyis gsum las lhag par blangs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sbrus pa lhung bzed gnyis gsum las lhag par blangs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall is completed by taking more than two or three full begging bowls of dough.

original: // / za ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / za ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of eating is explained as follows.

original: nam chog gi bar du bza'/
analyzed: nam chog gi bar du bza'/
translated: One should eat until one is satisfied.

original: zan za ba la stan las mi ldang bar lhan cig cig car 'grangs shing chog par bza'/
analyzed: zan za ba la stan las mi ldang bar lhan cig cig car 'grangs shing chog par bza'/
translated: One should eat until one is satisfied and full, without getting up from oneâ€™s seat.ğŸ”½One should not get up from oneâ€™s seat until one has finished eating.

original: zas brtsams nas ma ldang shig / zan bza' ba'i phyir blangs te bza' bar brtsams pa las zan khar ma zos kyi bar du'ang mi ldang langs na'ang nyes byas /
analyzed: zas brtsams nas ma ldang shig / zan bza' ba'i phyir blangs te bza' bar brtsams pa las zan khar ma zos kyi bar du'ang mi ldang langs na'ang nyes byas /

original: ci tsam du gang de dag gis lan tshva yan chad bza' bar blangs na de'i tshul lo //
analyzed: ci tsam du gang de dag gis lan tshva yan chad bza' bar blangs na de'i tshul lo //
translated: As long as they have taken salt or more, it is the proper conduct.

original: zan bza' bar brtsams shing blangs pa ni bza' ba dang bca' ba ci'ang rung ste lan tshva tsam yan chad bza' ba'i phyir blangs shing brtsams kyang mi ldang ngo //
analyzed: zan bza' bar brtsams shing blangs pa ni bza' ba dang bca' ba ci'ang rung ste lan tshva tsam yan chad bza' ba'i phyir blangs shing brtsams kyang mi ldang ngo //
translated: When one has begun to eat and has taken food, it is any kind of food or drink, even as little as salt, which one has taken and begun to eat, but has not yet risen.

original: langs na nyes byas /
analyzed: langs na nyes byas /
translated: If one rises, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chung zad zos te slar 'dug ste zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chung zad zos te slar 'dug ste zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one eats again after having eaten a little and then risen, it is a downfall.

original: gnas btang nas zos zin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas btang nas zos zin pa'o //
translated: If one eats after having given up oneâ€™s seat, it is a downfall.

original: zan za ba'i 'phro las langs te phyis za bar bsams yang slar 'dug ste zos na yang yang gi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zan za ba'i 'phro las langs te phyis za bar bsams yang slar 'dug ste zos na yang yang gi ltung ba'o //
translated: If one rises from the midst of eating, thinking that one will eat later, and then eats again after returning, it is a downfall of repeated eating.

original: 'grangs sam mi 'dod par bsams te langs pa las phyis kyang zos na lhag ma ma byas pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'grangs sam mi 'dod par bsams te langs pa las phyis kyang zos na lhag ma ma byas pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If one rises, thinking that one is full or that one does not want to eat, and then eats again later, it is a downfall of not making a remainder.

original: bca' ba yang de bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bca' ba yang de bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the same for eating food.

original: 'dug pa las so //
analyzed: 'dug pa las so //
translated: It is from sitting.

original: langs pa ni 'greng bzhin du song ba la mi bya'i sa la 'dug pa las langs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½bca' ba dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i kha zas brtsams pa las so //
analyzed: langs pa ni 'greng bzhin du song ba la mi bya'i sa la 'dug pa las langs na ltung bar 'gyur ro // bca' ba dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i kha zas brtsams pa las so //
translated: â€œStanding upâ€ means that one should not get up while standing, but if one gets up from sitting on the ground, there is a downfall.

original: bza' ba dang @141a * //
analyzed: bza' ba dang @141a * //
translated: â€œHaving begunâ€ means having begun food such as cooked vegetables and so on.ğŸ”½â€œEatingâ€ means eating any food such as the five cooked vegetables and so on.

analyzed: bca' ba lnga la sogs pa kha zas ci bza' yang rung langs pa'i 'og tu lhag ma ma byas par yang zas slar zos na ltung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar ltung bar 'gyur ba ni yang langs shing 'dug nas za ba gzhan gyi mig tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ltung ngo zhes bcas /

translated: â€œNot desiredâ€ means that the root of the downfall is included in the root downfalls, the trunk is included in the trunk downfalls, the branches are included in the branch downfalls, and the flowers are included in the flower downfalls.

analyzed: lo ma lo ma'i nang du gtogs so cog dang / 'bras bu 'bras bu'i nang du gtogs so cog dang / bca' ba dang rtag tu smos pa 'di rnams ni bca' ba zhes bya /
translated: Leaves are all that is included in leaves, fruits are all that is included in fruits, and the term â€œfoodâ€ refers to all the other items.

translated: â€œUnmixed foodâ€

analyzed: kha zas ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las gag kyang rung ste kha zas za ba las mi 'dod ces byas sam /

analyzed: mi 'dod par bsams sam /

original: skyo ma ni sor mo lnga mi mngon na'o //

analyzed: skyo mar chud pa'i tshad ni sor mo'i rjes snang na bza' ba'i nang du gtogs so //

analyzed: mi snang na skyo ma'i nang du gtogs so //
translated: If it is not visible, it is included in the drink.

original: bslu ba ni byin len ma yin no //

translated: If one does not give to someone who is pretending to eat by putting his mouth in his hand for the purpose of playing, and says, â€œI am not hungry,â€ but later accepts and eats what is properly given, there is no offense.

analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi logs dang // lhag ma'i sngags bya ba ni bar du ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis chod na sngags su mi rung ste lhag mar mi chud par du chu dang yur ba dang gad pa la sogs pas chod pa dang / mi 'grub pa'i @142a * //
translated: If the mantra is interrupted by these mentioned in between, it is not suitable as a mantra, and does not count as a remainder. If interrupted by water, a canal, a ravine, etc.,

original: phyogs nas gcig sa la 'dug la gcig nam mkha' la 'dug pa dang pha zad tshu zad du 'dug pa rgyang ring por 'dug ste byas pa dang / mdun du mi 'dug na lhag ma bya ba mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs nas gcig sa la 'dug la gcig nam mkha' la 'dug pa dang pha zad tshu zad du 'dug pa rgyang ring por 'dug ste byas pa dang / mdun du mi 'dug na lhag ma bya ba mi dbang ngo //
translated: if one is on the ground and the other is in the sky, if they are far apart, if they are not facing each other, the remainder is not performed.

original: rgyab dang glor 'dug ste sngags byas pa ni lhag ma byas par mi chud do //
analyzed: rgyab dang glor 'dug ste sngags byas pa ni lhag ma byas par mi chud do //
translated: If one is behind or to the side and recites the mantra, it does not count as the remainder.

original: mdun du drang por 'dug la mtshams kyis kyang ma chod na sngags bya'o //
analyzed: mdun du drang por 'dug la mtshams kyis kyang ma chod na sngags bya'o //
translated: If one sits straight in front, not interrupted by the boundary, one should recite the mantra.

original: bya ba lag na mi 'dug na yang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba lag na mi 'dug na yang ngo //
translated: If one does not have the ritual implements in hand, it is the same.

original: sngags bya ba ni bdag dang sngags byed pa gnyis ka lag pa ya res 'og nas bteg la lag pa ya res steng nas bkab ste sngags ma byas na mi 'chags /
analyzed: sngags bya ba ni bdag dang sngags byed pa gnyis ka lag pa ya res 'og nas bteg la lag pa ya res steng nas bkab ste sngags ma byas na mi 'chags /
translated: The mantra is recited as follows: The monk who is to recite the mantra and the monk who is to receive it should each hold up one hand from below and cover the other hand from above. If the mantra is not recited, the food is not received.

original: ma brtags pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: It is not to be done for one who has not examined the food.

original: kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dang spags pa la ni sngags btab kyang mi 'chags so //
analyzed: kha zas ma brtags pa sgog pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dang spags pa la ni sngags btab kyang mi 'chags so //
translated: If the food has not been examined, it is not received even if the mantra is recited, whether it is garlic or food cooked or prepared by a fully ordained monk.

original: gdab kyang mi gdab po //
analyzed: gdab kyang mi gdab po //
translated: It is not to be done even if the mantra is recited.

original: de dang 'dres pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de dang 'dres pa yang ngo //

original: kha zas brtags pa dang / ma brtags par 'dres pa la yang sngags mi 'chags so //
analyzed: kha zas brtags pa dang / ma brtags par 'dres pa la yang sngags mi 'chags so //
translated: It is not to be done for one who is mixed with examined and unexamined food.

original: gnas ma btang bas bya /
analyzed: gnas ma btang bas bya /
translated: It is to be done by one who has not given up his seat.

original: sngags gdab pa'i dge slong yang zas zos zin te langs pa la mi bya'i ma langs pa zan za zhing 'dug pa'i dge slong cig la bya'o //
analyzed: sngags gdab pa'i dge slong yang zas zos zin te langs pa la mi bya'i ma langs pa zan za zhing 'dug pa'i dge slong cig la bya'o //
translated: The monk who is to recite the mantra should not do it for a monk who has already eaten and gotten up, but for a monk who has not gotten up but is sitting and eating.

analyzed: mi bza' bar brtags pas kyang byas pa bzhin no //
translated: It is to be done as if he were examining food that is not to be eaten.

original: lhag ma bya ba'i dge slong zan zos zin nas mi bza' bar sems thag ni bcad zin gyi rkub ni ma 'phags par 'dug pa la lhag ma bya bar gsol te byas kyang nyes med do //

original: gsol nas so //
analyzed: gsol nas so //
translated: If he is asked, he should say, â€œI have already eaten.â€

original: lhag ma bya ba'i mi des kyang lhag ma byar ci gnang zhes gsol na lhag ma bya'i mi gsol bar tshul gyis shig ces mi bya'o //

original: song khyod kyir gyur to zhes tshig byos shig / lhag ma byed pa'i dge slong gis sngags byas zin nas zas 'di khyod kyir gyur gyis khyer cig ces byas te byin /

translated: It is not a downfall to eat in a group of more than three if the gathering is a great festival, such as the great offering of the autumn harvest, and most people are present, so that it is impossible to eat in a group of three or less.

original: khang pa so sor chod cing zos pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: khang pa so sor chod cing zos pa ni nyes med do //
translated: It is not a downfall to eat in a group of more than three if the gathering is in separate houses, or if the food is eaten in one place and the people are scattered.

analyzed: gzhan 'di'i tshul ma yin pa rab tu 'byung ba'i zan las so //
translated: It is not a downfall to eat in a group of more than three if the food is not the proper food of renunciates, such as meat.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin la lta ba ma yin pa mur 'dug gi rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong gis zan byin te logs shig tu zos pa ni nyes med do //

original: // / dus ma yin pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dus ma yin pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The time for eating is explained as the time for downfalls.

original: bdag gi nyi ma phyed phan chad skya rengs shar gyi bar du dus ma yin /
analyzed: bdag gi nyi ma phyed phan chad skya rengs shar gyi bar du dus ma yin /
translated: The time for me is from noon until dawn.ğŸ”½The time for me is from noon until dawn in the country of the continent, whether it is the eastern, southern, western or northern continent where I live.

original: bdag shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi gling gang na gnas pa'i gling yul de'i nyi ma phyed phan chad skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du dus ma yin pa ste bza' ba rnam lnga dang bca' ba rnam lnga la sogs pa gang zos kyang ltung bar
analyzed: bdag shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi gling gang na gnas pa'i gling yul de'i nyi ma phyed phan chad skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du dus ma yin pa ste bza' ba rnam lnga dang bca' ba rnam lnga la sogs pa gang zos kyang ltung bar
translated: If I eat any of the five foods or five medicines, I will have a downfall.

original: 'gyur ro // skya rengs shar nas nyi ma phyed tshun chad ni dus te zos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // skya rengs shar nas nyi ma phyed tshun chad ni dus te zos kyang nyes med do //
translated: From dawn until noon is the time for eating. If I eat then, there is no fault.

original: shar phyogs kyi gling du dro'i zan zos la lho phyogs su song ste za ba ni shar gyi nyi ma phyed na lho'i nyi ma shar bar gyur te bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi gling du dro'i zan zos la lho phyogs su song ste za ba ni shar gyi nyi ma phyed na lho'i nyi ma shar bar gyur te bzar rung ngo //
translated: If I eat the midday meal in the eastern country and go to the southern country, it is permissible to eat if the sun has risen in the southern country at noon in the eastern country.

original: de bzhin du lho nas nub /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho nas nub /
translated: Similarly, it is permissible to eat if I go from the southern to the western,

original: nub nas byang byang nas shar kyang ngo //
analyzed: nub nas byang byang nas shar kyang ngo //
translated: from the western to the northern, and from the northern to the eastern country.

original: der 'bhrid / dus ma yin zhing dus las 'das par shes bzhin du zos pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'bhrid / dus ma yin zhing dus las 'das par shes bzhin du zos pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats knowingly at the wrong time, one commits an offense.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba za ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba za ba'o //
translated: Food and drink.

original: dus ma yin par bza' ba dang bca' ba zos pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus ma yin par bza' ba dang bca' ba zos pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats food and drink at the wrong time, one commits an offense.

original: dus ma yin pa'i zas so //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i zas so //
translated: Food and drink at the wrong time.

original: dus ma yin pa'i zas zos pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i zas zos pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /
translated: The precept concerning food and drink at the wrong time is finished.

original: // / spags pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /ğŸ”½zan gyi snga rol byin len la zan gyi phyi rol tam der thun 'das na spags pa'o //ğŸ”½bza' ba dang bca' ba las dro kha tshun chad du bza' bar bsams te nang par byin len byas pa las dro kha tshun chad du khyim pa'am dge sbyong zhig gis sa las 'phags par bteg pa ni phyin chad nam yang @144a * //
analyzed: // / spags pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de / zan gyi snga rol byin len la zan gyi phyi rol tam der thun 'das na spags pa'o // bza' ba dang bca' ba las dro kha tshun chad du bza' bar bsams te nang par byin len byas pa las dro kha tshun chad du khyim pa'am dge sbyong zhig gis sa las 'phags par bteg pa ni phyin chad nam yang @144a * //
translated: The precept concerning storing is explained as follows.ğŸ”½If one receives the invitation to eat before the meal and then eats after the meal, or if one eats after the time has passed, it is storing.

original: bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: bzar rung ngo //
translated: If one thinks of eating food and drink before the meal and receives the invitation in the morning, then if a householder or a monk lifts it up from the ground before the meal, it is fit to be eaten from then on.

original: nang par byin len byas pa'i zan de dro khar bza' bar bya ba las dro 'das pa'i 'og tu khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bteg pa ni phyin chad bzar mi rung ste zos na ltung ba'o //ğŸ”½nang par byin len byas pa'i zas dro khar yang ma zos khyim pas kyang ma reg pa dro 'das pa ni spags pa ste bzar mi rung ste ltung ba dang dro 'das na ltung ba bzhin du dro'i 'og tu byin len byas pa phyi dro bza' bar bsams
analyzed: nang par byin len byas pa'i zan de dro khar bza' bar bya ba las dro 'das pa'i 'og tu khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bteg pa ni phyin chad bzar mi rung ste zos na ltung ba'o // nang par byin len byas pa'i zas dro khar yang ma zos khyim pas kyang ma reg pa dro 'das pa ni spags pa ste bzar mi rung ste ltung ba dang dro 'das na ltung ba bzhin du dro'i 'og tu byin len byas pa phyi dro bza' bar bsams
translated: The food that has been accepted in the morning should be eaten in the morning. If it is eaten after the morning is past, it is not to be eaten again, even if it is picked up by a layperson or a monk. If one eats it, there is a downfall.ğŸ”½The food that has been accepted in the morning, if it is not eaten in the morning and is not touched by a layperson, is to be discarded after the morning is past. It is not to be eaten. If one eats it, there is a downfall.

original: pa las nyi ma nub ste dmar thag chad pa las 'das pa yang spags pa'o //
analyzed: pa las nyi ma nub ste dmar thag chad pa las 'das pa yang spags pa'o //
translated: Just as there is a downfall if one eats after the morning is past, there is also a downfall if one eats after the red glow in the east has disappeared, even though one has the intention of eating in the afternoon, having accepted the food after the morning is past.

original: der ro // kha zas bdag gis byin len byas la dro dang phyi dro thun 'das par shes bzhin du zos pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ro // kha zas bdag gis byin len byas la dro dang phyi dro thun 'das par shes bzhin du zos pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats food that one has accepted oneself, knowing that the morning or afternoon has passed, there is a downfall.

original: bteg pa mi mid /
analyzed: bteg pa mi mid /
translated: One should not swallow what has been picked up.

original: snga dro byin len byas pa dro khar bza' bar bsams la de khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bteg cing reg na yang phyi dro za yang rung slar byin len ma byas par za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: snga dro byin len byas pa dro khar bza' bar bsams la de khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bteg cing reg na yang phyi dro za yang rung slar byin len ma byas par za na nyes byas so //
translated: If one thinks that one has received the morning meal and eats it in the evening, or if a layperson or a novice monk lifts it or touches it, and one eats it in the evening, it is a fault if one does not re-receive it.

original: mtshams kyi nang du bzhag pa dang btsos pa ma yin //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du bzhag pa dang btsos pa ma yin //
translated: It is not cooked and is placed within the boundary.

original: dge slong gis ma reg cing byin len ma byas pa'i zas mtshams gcig gi nang du zhag lon pa dang mtshams kyi nang du khyim pas btsos shing g-yos byas pa zos pa yang nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis ma reg cing byin len ma byas pa'i zas mtshams gcig gi nang du zhag lon pa dang mtshams kyi nang du khyim pas btsos shing g-yos byas pa zos pa yang nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If a monk does not touch it and does not re-receive it, and eats food that has been left overnight within one boundary, or if a layperson cooks and prepares it within the boundary, it is a fault.

original: mtshams kyi nang du btsos kyang dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsngos pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du btsos kyang dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis bsngos pa ni nyes med do //
translated: Even if it is cooked within the boundary, if it is dedicated by the Sangha through the rite of proposal and proclamation, there is no fault.

original: gsol bas bsngo ba yang rnam gsum ste thog ma rmang gding ba na tshang mang du bsngos pa dang khang pa rnying pa dge 'dun thams cad mtshams gcig gi phyir rol du zhag gcig gnas la de nas gdod tshang mar du bsngor rung ste 'di gsum gyi skabs
analyzed: gsol bas bsngo ba yang rnam gsum ste thog ma rmang gding ba na tshang mang du bsngos pa dang khang pa rnying pa dge 'dun thams cad mtshams gcig gi phyir rol du zhag gcig gnas la de nas gdod tshang mar du bsngor rung ste 'di gsum gyi skabs
translated: The request for the dedication is also of three types: it is suitable to dedicate the food to the kitchen when laying the foundation, to the old house when the entire saá¹…gha stays outside for one day for the sake of a boundary, and to the kitchen when the saá¹…gha stays outside for one day for the sake of a boundary.

original: lta bur gsol ba byas pa ni bsngor rung ngo //
analyzed: lta bur gsol ba byas pa ni bsngor rung ngo //
translated: The request for dedication at these three times is suitable.

original: dge slong gis btsos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis btsos pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if a fully ordained monk cooks it.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dge slong gis btsos pa yang nyes byas /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dge slong gis btsos pa yang nyes byas /
translated: If a fully ordained monk cooks it outside the boundary, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rjen pa las na de btsos pa'o //
analyzed: rjen pa las na de btsos pa'o //
translated: Since it is raw, it is cooked.

original: s'u tra ltag ma gnyis kyis btsos pa ni btsos zin pa la slar bsros pa la nyes med kyis ma bcos shing rjen pa las btsos pa yang btsos pa las zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma gnyis kyis btsos pa ni btsos zin pa la slar bsros pa la nyes med kyis ma bcos shing rjen pa las btsos pa yang btsos pa las zos na nyes byas /
translated: The latter two sÅ«tras state that it is permissible to reheat what has already been cooked. If it is raw and cooked, it is cooked. If it is eaten, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sum cha bcos la mi 'jam pa tshun chad der ro //
analyzed: sum cha bcos la mi 'jam pa tshun chad der ro //
translated: Up to one-third cooked and not tender, it is the same.

original: btsos pa'i tshad du chud pa ni nas dang 'bras dang sran ma la sogs pa sra ba gsum gnyis tshos shing 'jam bo mul mul mor gyur pa ni btsos pa'i tshad du chud do //
analyzed: btsos pa'i tshad du chud pa ni nas dang 'bras dang sran ma la sogs pa sra ba gsum gnyis tshos shing 'jam bo mul mul mor gyur pa ni btsos pa'i tshad du chud do //
translated: When it has reached the measure of cooking, the three kinds of hard food, barley, rice, and beans, etc., are cooked and become soft and tender.

original: sum cha tshos shing 'jam por ma gyur pa ni ma btsos pa'o //
analyzed: sum cha tshos shing 'jam por ma gyur pa ni ma btsos pa'o //
translated: When two-thirds are cooked and have not become soft, it is not cooked.

original: kha dog 'gyur la 'jam @144b na'o //ğŸ”½tshod ma dang ga gon lta bu ni kha dog 'gyur zhing 'jam por gyur na btsos pa'o //ğŸ”½khu ba na lhag gnyis na'o //
analyzed: kha dog 'gyur la 'jam @144b na'o // tshod ma dang ga gon lta bu ni kha dog 'gyur zhing 'jam por gyur na btsos pa'o // khu ba na lhag gnyis na'o //
translated: When the color changes and it becomes soft,ğŸ”½it is cooked, like vegetables and eggplant.ğŸ”½When the liquid is boiled down to two-thirds,

original: 'o ma lta bu 'tshod pa ni lhag gnyis btsos pas btsos par chud do //
analyzed: 'o ma lta bu 'tshod pa ni lhag gnyis btsos pas btsos par chud do //
translated: it is cooked, like milk.

original: mes brtags pa byas pa 'ang ma btsos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mes brtags pa byas pa 'ang ma btsos pa ma yin no //
translated: When it is cooked by the heat of the sun, it is not uncooked.

original: brtag pa rnam bdun bya ba la mes brtags pa yang btsos par chud de dge slong gis mes brtags na dge slong de nyid la sems bshig pa'i ltung ba yang yod dge slong gis brtags pa de zos na dge slong gis btsos pa zos pa'i nyes byas par
analyzed: brtag pa rnam bdun bya ba la mes brtags pa yang btsos par chud de dge slong gis mes brtags na dge slong de nyid la sems bshig pa'i ltung ba yang yod dge slong gis brtags pa de zos na dge slong gis btsos pa zos pa'i nyes byas par
translated: Also, if a monk examines with fire, he commits the offense of destroying the mind of a monk. If a monk eats what he has examined, he commits the offense of eating what a monk has cooked.

original: yang 'gyur gzhan gyis mes brtags pa zhig btsos na yang btsos pa'i nyes byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'gyur gzhan gyis mes brtags pa zhig btsos na yang btsos pa'i nyes byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If another person examines with fire and cooks it, it is not cooked by the monk.

original: tshes bzung ba las sprul pa gnas pa'ang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshes bzung ba las sprul pa gnas pa'ang gnas pa'o //
translated: If it is kept by a magical emanation, it is also kept.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang na bza' shing skyes pa'i shing tog blags te zos na yang mtshams gcig gi nang du zhag lon pa'i kha zas su chud de nyes byas so //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang na bza' shing skyes pa'i shing tog blags te zos na yang mtshams gcig gi nang du zhag lon pa'i kha zas su chud de nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk eats fruit from a tree that grows within the boundary, he commits the offense of eating food that has been kept within the same boundary.

original: de bzhin du mtshams kyi nang du ra lug dang ba btags pa'i zho 'thungs na'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshams kyi nang du ra lug dang ba btags pa'i zho 'thungs na'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if he drinks yogurt made from goats, sheep, or cows that are tethered within the boundary, he commits an offense.

original: phyogs su snod gnas na yang de sar tshos pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs su snod gnas na yang de sar tshos pa'o //
translated: If a vessel is placed in a direction, it is cooked in that place.

original: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams su gtogs pa dang ma gtogs pa'i tshad du lcags sgyed dam sgyed pu lta bu btsugs te rtsa ba gnyis mtshams kyi phyi rol du zug la rtsa ba gcig mtshams kyi nang du zug pa yang mchis kyi nang du btsos par chud do
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams su gtogs pa dang ma gtogs pa'i tshad du lcags sgyed dam sgyed pu lta bu btsugs te rtsa ba gnyis mtshams kyi phyi rol du zug la rtsa ba gcig mtshams kyi nang du zug pa yang mchis kyi nang du btsos par chud do
translated: The measure of the boundary of the monastery is this: a metal ring or a stone is placed at the boundary. Two roots are outside the boundary, and one root is inside the boundary.

original: // btsos pa der gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // btsos pa der gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: If the pot is placed on the two roots outside the boundary, it is not considered cooked inside the boundary.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol na zan 'dug la mtshams kyi nang na mi 'dug ste skya ba 'am gzar bus dkrugs shing 'tshed pa ni mtshams su btsos par mi chud do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol na zan 'dug la mtshams kyi nang na mi 'dug ste skya ba 'am gzar bus dkrugs shing 'tshed pa ni mtshams su btsos par mi chud do //
translated: If the food is outside the boundary and the person inside the boundary stirs the food with a ladle or spoon, it is not considered cooked inside the boundary.

original: mdag ma yang snod ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdag ma yang snod ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Embers are not considered a non-receptacle.

original: mtshams kyi nang du mdag ma blangs te bsregs pa dang me mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'dug la rlung gis btab pa'i me lce mtshams kyi nang du 'ongs pa la bsregs pa'ang mtshams kyi nang du bsregs par chud do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du mdag ma blangs te bsregs pa dang me mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'dug la rlung gis btab pa'i me lce mtshams kyi nang du 'ongs pa la bsregs pa'ang mtshams kyi nang du bsregs par chud do //
translated: If embers are brought inside the boundary and burned, or if the fire is outside the boundary and the flame enters the boundary due to the wind, it is considered burned inside the boundary.

analyzed: de las phyung ngam ma phyung na der ma yin no //

original: dge slong gi gnas la gzhan kha drag po zhig gis dbang byas te dge slong khang bu mig gcig tu gzhag nas gzhan du khyim bdag de 'dug na khyim bdag 'dug par btsos pa dang khyim pas btsos pa ni mtshams gcig tu btsos par mi chud do //
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas la gzhan kha drag po zhig gis dbang byas te dge slong khang bu mig gcig tu gzhag nas gzhan du khyim bdag de 'dug na khyim bdag 'dug par btsos pa dang khyim pas btsos pa ni mtshams gcig tu btsos par mi chud do //
translated: If a monk is under the control of another, such as a powerful person, and is placed in a cell, and if the householder is present in another place, then cooking for the householder is not considered cooking within the same boundary.

original: nam 'tsho'i bar du ba ni bteg pa pa dang nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa de'i bags pa la ma gnas te dus so //
analyzed: nam 'tsho'i bar du ba ni bteg pa pa dang nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa de'i bags pa la ma gnas te dus so //
translated: As long as one lives, one should not rely on what is carried, what is cooked inside, or what is cooked by a monk.

original: kha zas dge slong bteg pa dang mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa bzar mi gnang zhes bshad pa la tshe gcig tu bcang ba dang zhag bdun pa'i sman ni sngags kyis btab na bteg pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa spyad cing bza' ba la sogs pa nyes med do //
analyzed: kha zas dge slong bteg pa dang mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa bzar mi gnang zhes bshad pa la tshe gcig tu bcang ba dang zhag bdun pa'i sman ni sngags kyis btab na bteg pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa spyad cing bza' ba la sogs pa nyes med do //
translated: It is explained that one should not eat food carried by a monk, cooked inside the boundary, or cooked by a monk. However, if the medicine to be kept for life or for seven days is consecrated with a mantra, it is permissible to use what is carried, cooked, etc., and to eat it, etc., without fault.

original: btso ba ni na ba'i phyir btsos na ni nyes med kyi min bar ni dge slong gis btsos pa dang mtshams gcig tu btsos pa ni mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: btso ba ni na ba'i phyir btsos na ni nyes med kyi min bar ni dge slong gis btsos pa dang mtshams gcig tu btsos pa ni mi gnang ngo //
translated: But a monk should not cook for himself, nor should he cook in one place while the others eat elsewhere.

original: 'bags pa ni zas kyi phyed do //
analyzed: 'bags pa ni zas kyi phyed do //
translated: â€œSoiledâ€ means half eaten.

original: lhung bzed dang gzhong pa dang lag pa la sogs pa la kha zas chags bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang gzhong pa dang lag pa la sogs pa la kha zas chags bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
translated: If one eats while food is sticking to oneâ€™s lips, oneâ€™s bowl, or oneâ€™s hands, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha'i dri ma dang bza' btung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: kha'i dri ma dang bza' btung ba yang ngo //
translated: One should also clean oneâ€™s teeth and rinse oneâ€™s mouth after eating and drinking.

original: kha'i dri ma dang kha zas kyi tshigs mkha'i gseb tu chags pa yang ma dag bzhin du kha zas zos shing 'thungs na nyes byas te thun 'das na spags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha'i dri ma dang kha zas kyi tshigs mkha'i gseb tu chags pa yang ma dag bzhin du kha zas zos shing 'thungs na nyes byas te thun 'das na spags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one eats or drinks without first cleaning oneâ€™s teeth and rinsing oneâ€™s mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di'i phyi rol lci ba'am sas phyis te chus bshal la bkru'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyi rol lci ba'am sas phyis te chus bshal la bkru'o //
translated: One should clean the outside of oneâ€™s bowl with earth or ashes and rinse it with water.

original: kha dag par bya ba'i phyir kha'i phyi rol lci ba'am sas bskus la chus dag par bshal zhing bkru'o //ğŸ”½nang chus lan @145b gnyis sam gsum gyis la mkhur chu dor ro //
analyzed: kha dag par bya ba'i phyir kha'i phyi rol lci ba'am sas bskus la chus dag par bshal zhing bkru'o //ğŸ”½nang chus lan @145b gnyis sam gsum gyis la mkhur chu dor ro //
translated: In order to clean oneâ€™s mouth, one should rub the outside of oneâ€™s lips with earth or ashes and rinse oneâ€™s mouth with water.ğŸ”½One should spit out the water from oneâ€™s mouth by turning oneâ€™s face toward oneâ€™s left shoulder.

original: kha'i nang ni nang par dang dro zos pa'i 'og tu so shing zos la lan gsum chus dag par bkru'o //
analyzed: kha'i nang ni nang par dang dro zos pa'i 'og tu so shing zos la lan gsum chus dag par bkru'o //
translated: In the morning, after eating and drinking, one should chew a tooth stick and rinse oneâ€™s mouth three times.

original: phyi dro skom 'thungs na'ang lan gsum du chus dag par bkru'o //
analyzed: phyi dro skom 'thungs na'ang lan gsum du chus dag par bkru'o //
translated: In the evening, after drinking, one should rinse oneâ€™s mouth three times.

original: lhung bzed lan gnyis gsum bzlas te gus par bkrus na sgra ma byung yang ngo ;
analyzed: lhung bzed lan gnyis gsum bzlas te gus par bkrus na sgra ma byung yang ngo ;
translated: If one washes the begging bowl twice or thrice, respectfully, without making a sound, it is clean.

original: / zan za ba'i sngon logs su lhung bzed bkru ba yang snga de nyin dag par bkrus su zin kyang lci ba'am rtsa brdungs pa'i khu ba'am sa 'jam po spra tshil 'dra bas lan gsum du bkrus te dag par byas la krig krig zer ba'i sgra'am brdabs pa'i
analyzed: / zan za ba'i sngon logs su lhung bzed bkru ba yang snga de nyin dag par bkrus su zin kyang lci ba'am rtsa brdungs pa'i khu ba'am sa 'jam po spra tshil 'dra bas lan gsum du bkrus te dag par byas la krig krig zer ba'i sgra'am brdabs pa'i
translated: Even if one has washed the begging bowl the day before, if it is heavy, or if there is a smell of the previous food, or if it is stained, one should wash it three times with a solution of powdered bean pod or with soft clay, as if it were beeswax.

original: sgra dang zhes zer ba ni dag pa'i tshad du chud do ;
analyzed: sgra dang zhes zer ba ni dag pa'i tshad du chud do ;
translated: If it makes a sound, or if it is wiped with a cloth, it is considered clean.

original: / lan gsum du bzlas te bkrus nas sgra mi zer yang des chog par brtsi'o //
analyzed: / lan gsum du bzlas te bkrus nas sgra mi zer yang des chog par brtsi'o //
translated: Even if it does not make a sound, if one washes it three times, it is considered clean.

original: nyes med pa ni langs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni langs pa'o //
translated: If it is clean, one should get up.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar lan gsum du bzlas te dag par bkrus pa las snum dang rtsi la sogs pa kha zas kyis langs par yang nyes med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar lan gsum du bzlas te dag par bkrus pa las snum dang rtsi la sogs pa kha zas kyis langs par yang nyes med do //
translated: As in the case of the second sutra, if one washes three times, there is no fault in the oil, grease, etc. rising up from the food.

original: mi 'bags pa la reg pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mi 'bags pa la reg pa yang ngo //
translated: There is no fault in touching what is not defiled.

original: kha phyis dang snod spyad la sogs pa kha zas chags shing ma bkrus pa zhig la reg na nyes byas so //
analyzed: kha phyis dang snod spyad la sogs pa kha zas chags shing ma bkrus pa zhig la reg na nyes byas so //
translated: If one touches a napkin, a dish, etc., which is stuck with food and has not been washed, there is an offense.

original: bul tog dang lci ba dang sa gang yang rung bas lan gsum du bkrus na snum yang ngo //
analyzed: bul tog dang lci ba dang sa gang yang rung bas lan gsum du bkrus na snum yang ngo //
translated: If one washes three times with any of the three, ashes, cow dung, or earth, there is no fault in the oil rising up.

original: gos dang snod spyad dang lhung bzed la sogs pa bul tog dang lci ba dang sa la sogs pas lan gsum du dag par bzlas te bkrus na ma dag cing snum yang nyes med do //
analyzed: gos dang snod spyad dang lhung bzed la sogs pa bul tog dang lci ba dang sa la sogs pas lan gsum du dag par bzlas te bkrus na ma dag cing snum yang nyes med do //
translated: If one washes three times with ashes, cow dung, earth, etc., there is no fault in the oil rising up from the cloth, dish, begging bowl, etc., and not being removed.

original: langs pa gsal /
analyzed: langs pa gsal /
translated: The rising up is clear.

original: lhung bzed lan gsum du dag par bkrus pa las /
analyzed: lhung bzed lan gsum du dag par bkrus pa las /
translated: If one washes the begging bowl three times,

original: kha zas tshan po zhig blugs te lhan pa'i gseb nas rtsi'am snum langs te mngon par gyur na de nyid bsal te dor ro //
analyzed: kha zas tshan po zhig blugs te lhan pa'i gseb nas rtsi'am snum langs te mngon par gyur na de nyid bsal te dor ro //
translated: if a piece of food is put in, and the oil or grease rises up from the cracks, that should be removed and discarded.

original: 'bags pa de'i phyogs su bkru / lhung bzed dang snod spyad la sogs pa snum mam zas kyis reg na gar reg par dag par bkrus la gos ni gzhan mi bkru'o //
analyzed: 'bags pa de'i phyogs su bkru / lhung bzed dang snod spyad la sogs pa snum mam zas kyis reg na gar reg par dag par bkrus la gos ni gzhan mi bkru'o //
translated: If the bowl or the wooden article is stained by oil or food, wash it clean where it is stained. Do not wash the robe.

original: snod spyad pa ni gzhan bshal bas chog go //
analyzed: snod spyad pa ni gzhan bshal bas chog go //
translated: It is enough to wash the wooden article with water.

original: mi snum pa'i phyir snum pa'i rdza ma la sogs pa rdzing du'i chu zab mor gzhug /
analyzed: mi snum pa'i phyir snum pa'i rdza ma la sogs pa rdzing du'i chu zab mor gzhug /
translated: If the oil-pot, etc. are not stained, put them in a deep pond.ğŸ”½If the wooden article, such as a pot, is used as a container for oil, and is not clean, put it in a pond.

original: rdza ma la sogs snod spyad mar gyi snod byed byed de snum mi 'dag na rdzing bu'i nang du gzhug / nya dang rus sbal dang sbal pa dang sbal pa dkar po dang srin bu au lug kas ma bldag kyi bar du bzhag / s'u tra ltag ma
analyzed: rdza ma la sogs snod spyad mar gyi snod byed byed de snum mi 'dag na rdzing bu'i nang du gzhug / nya dang rus sbal dang sbal pa dang sbal pa dkar po dang srin bu au lug kas ma bldag kyi bar du bzhag / s'u tra ltag ma
translated: Leave it there until it is eaten by fish, turtles, frogs, white frogs, and water leeches.ğŸ”½As it says in the sÅ«tra,

original: ltar rdzing bu'i nang du gzhug pa ni ming gis smos pa'i srin bu 'di rnams kyis @146a * //
analyzed: ltar rdzing bu'i nang du gzhug pa ni ming gis smos pa'i srin bu 'di rnams kyis @146a * //
translated: if it is eaten by these water creatures mentioned by name,

original: bldags na snum med cing dag par 'gyur te nam bldags shing dag gi bar du zhag gnyis gsum du gzhag go //
analyzed: bldags na snum med cing dag par 'gyur te nam bldags shing dag gi bar du zhag gnyis gsum du gzhag go //
translated: it will be free of oil and clean. Leave it there for two or three days until it is eaten.

original: bsregs te yang snum med par grub na'o //
analyzed: bsregs te yang snum med par grub na'o //
translated: and then, when it is established that it is without oil, it is to be washed.

original: rdza ma snum med par bya ba'i phyir mes bsregs na yang snum med cing dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdza ma snum med par bya ba'i phyir mes bsregs na yang snum med cing dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When a pot is heated by fire in order to make it without oil, it becomes without oil and clean.

original: snum med nas kyang dge slong de go 'dun nam lci bas dag bar bkru //
analyzed: snum med nas kyang dge slong de go 'dun nam lci bas dag bar bkru //
translated: And when it is without oil, that monk is to wash it with ashes or with clay.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar me'am rdzing bur bkrus pa'i snod spyad de phyi nas kyang go 'dun nam lci bas kyang lan gcig dag par bkru'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar me'am rdzing bur bkrus pa'i snod spyad de phyi nas kyang go 'dun nam lci bas kyang lan gcig dag par bkru'o //
translated: Like the latter part of the sÅ«tra, the vessel that is washed in fire or in a pond is to be washed once again with ashes or with clay.

original: lan tshva dang ba tsha dang rnyog ma can gyi chu lan tshva la sogs pa phyed do //
analyzed: lan tshva dang ba tsha dang rnyog ma can gyi chu lan tshva la sogs pa phyed do //
translated: Salt, alkaline, and turbid water are to be divided into salt, etc.

original: lan tshva can gyi chu dang ba tshva can gyi chu dang rnyog ma can gyi chu snga dro byin len ma byas par 'thungs na nyes byas phyi dro ni byin len byas te 'thungs kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: lan tshva can gyi chu dang ba tshva can gyi chu dang rnyog ma can gyi chu snga dro byin len ma byas par 'thungs na nyes byas phyi dro ni byin len byas te 'thungs kyang nyes byas so //
translated: If one drinks water that is salty, alkaline, or turbid, without having accepted it in the morning, it is a fault. If one drinks it in the evening, having accepted it, it is a fault.

original: brtags pa ste dus ma yin pa dang thams cad du'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ste dus ma yin pa dang thams cad du'o //
translated: It is to be examined, not at the proper time, but at all times.

original: lan tshva can dang ba tsha can gyi chu ni btsags pa'am dangs par byas te brtags na dus ma yin pa dang byin len ma byas par btud du rung ste nad pa dang dge slong min pa thams cad 'thung du dbang ste nyes med do //
analyzed: lan tshva can dang ba tsha can gyi chu ni btsags pa'am dangs par byas te brtags na dus ma yin pa dang byin len ma byas par btud du rung ste nad pa dang dge slong min pa thams cad 'thung du dbang ste nyes med do //
translated: Water that is salty or sour is suitable to be drunk immediately after straining or clarifying it. It is permissible for all sick people and non-monks to drink it without a fault.

original: bdag gis dgos par byed pa mi byed pa lan tshva dang ba tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis dgos par byed pa mi byed pa lan tshva dang ba tsha med pa'o //
translated: It is not salty or sour if it is not made salty or sour by oneself.

original: lan tshva'i chu'i tshad du chud pa ni chu de nyid kyi nang du tshod ma 'am thug pa btsos te lan tshva gud nas gdab mi dgos na lan tsha can gyi chur brtsi'o //
analyzed: lan tshva'i chu'i tshad du chud pa ni chu de nyid kyi nang du tshod ma 'am thug pa btsos te lan tshva gud nas gdab mi dgos na lan tsha can gyi chur brtsi'o //
translated: If vegetables or rice are cooked in that water, and no salt is added, it is considered to be salty water.

original: ba tshva can gyi chu ni gos kyi snum la sogs pa bkrus na dag par nus pa ni pa tsha can gyi chur brtsi ste /
analyzed: ba tshva can gyi chu ni gos kyi snum la sogs pa bkrus na dag par nus pa ni pa tsha can gyi chur brtsi ste /
translated: Water that is sour is considered to be sour water if it is able to clean the oiliness of clothes and so forth.

original: tshad 'dir ma phyin pa phyi dro dang snga dro byin len ma byas par 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: tshad 'dir ma phyin pa phyi dro dang snga dro byin len ma byas par 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If it does not reach this measure, it is permissible to drink it in the afternoon or morning without a fault.

original: gzugs brnyan skyes na phyi ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan skyes na phyi ma'o //
translated: If a reflection appears, it is the latter.

original: chu rnyog ma can ni btsags sam dangs te nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang na rnyog ma can ma yin pa'i tshad du brtsi ste phyi dro btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: chu rnyog ma can ni btsags sam dangs te nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang na rnyog ma can ma yin pa'i tshad du brtsi ste phyi dro btung du rung ngo //
translated: When the water is clear, that is, when the reflection of the face appears clearly in the water, then the water is considered to be clear and one can drink it in the afternoon.

original: shing tog ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu dang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing tog ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu dang par 'gyur ro //
translated: Water becomes clear by means of the fruit of the kataka tree.

original: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du shing tog ka ta ka zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bcug na rnyog ma zhabs su rnyigs te dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du shing tog ka ta ka zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bcug na rnyog ma zhabs su rnyigs te dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one throws into muddy water the fruit of the kataka tree, the mud settles down and the water becomes clear.

original: ba yang gi chu dang par ba ba'i phyir shing lo bcug pa lta bu /
analyzed: ba yang gi chu dang par ba ba'i phyir shing lo bcug pa lta bu /
translated: Like the leaf of the banyan tree, which is used to purify water.

original: thal ba 'am zan bcangs pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: thal ba 'am zan bcangs pas kyang ngo //
translated: Or by means of ashes or flour.

original: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du thal ba btab bam zan gyi chang pa bcug na'ang rnyog ma dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu rnyog ma can gyi nang du thal ba btab bam zan gyi chang pa bcug na'ang rnyog ma dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one throws ashes or flour into muddy water, the mud settles down and the water becomes clear.

original: mi gyes pa'i phyir snum mo //
analyzed: mi gyes pa'i phyir snum mo //
translated: It is oily because it does not separate.

original: zan gyi chang ba chur bcug pa de mi gyes par bya ba'i phyir @146b snum gyi phye mar du bya'o //
analyzed: zan gyi chang ba chur bcug pa de mi gyes par bya ba'i phyir @146b snum gyi phye mar du bya'o //
translated: The flour of sesame seeds is put into the flour of parched rice in order to prevent the latter from separating.

original: chu'i 'byung gnas su zhugs nas mi mngon na yod pa'i mi grangs so //
analyzed: chu'i 'byung gnas su zhugs nas mi mngon na yod pa'i mi grangs so //
translated: If there is no sign of a person in the water, then the number of people in the water is counted.

original: rdzing bu'am khron pa'i nang na kha zas yod la chu la kha zas kyi bag chags yod par mi mngon na chu dangs ba'i nang du brtsi ste nyes med do //
analyzed: rdzing bu'am khron pa'i nang na kha zas yod la chu la kha zas kyi bag chags yod par mi mngon na chu dangs ba'i nang du brtsi ste nyes med do //
translated: If there is food in a pond or a well, but there is no sign of food in the water, then the clear water is taken and there is no fault.

original: reg pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe bsal /
analyzed: reg pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe bsal /
translated: That part of the contact is temporarily removed.

original: snod kyi nang gi snum langs te kha zhag gis chod dam rdzing bu'am khron pa'i chu la kha zas dang zhag gi spris mas yog cing 'dug na nyi tshe gud du bsal te bor ram phan tshun bshugs te dangs pa las bcus pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: snod kyi nang gi snum langs te kha zhag gis chod dam rdzing bu'am khron pa'i chu la kha zas dang zhag gi spris mas yog cing 'dug na nyi tshe gud du bsal te bor ram phan tshun bshugs te dangs pa las bcus pa ni nyes med /
translated: If the oil in the vessel rises and covers the mouth, or if the water in the pond or well is covered with food and oil scum, then the temporary excess is removed and discarded, or rubbed away from each other, and the clear part is taken and there is no fault.

original: bya rog gi mchus reg na than khor kyang ngo //
analyzed: bya rog gi mchus reg na than khor kyang ngo //
translated: If it is touched by a crow's beak, it is also spoiled.

original: bdag gi zas la bya rog gi mchus reg na gar reg pa nyi tshe bcad de dor /
analyzed: bdag gi zas la bya rog gi mchus reg na gar reg pa nyi tshe bcad de dor /
translated: If my food is touched by a crow's beak, then the touched part is temporarily cut off and discarded.

original: byin len byas zin pa zhig na'ang gdod byin len byas te bza'o //
analyzed: byin len byas zin pa zhig na'ang gdod byin len byas te bza'o //
translated: If it has already been consecrated, then it is consecrated again and eaten.

original: de dang ldan pa'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni ma reg pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni ma reg pa'o //
translated: The contact with the stream that possesses that is not contact.

original: kun de'i nang nas chu tor ra 'ong ba rgyun ma chad pas kha zas dang mi gtsang ba la reg pa ni kun de'i nang na 'dug pa reg pa ma yin te mi gtsang pa med par mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: kun de'i nang nas chu tor ra 'ong ba rgyun ma chad pas kha zas dang mi gtsang ba la reg pa ni kun de'i nang na 'dug pa reg pa ma yin te mi gtsang pa med par mi brtsi'o //
translated: But if the water is flowing continuously from that vessel, and one touches the food or impure substance, it is not the case that one touches everything in that vessel. It is not considered impure.

original: nor tam dran pa nyams te na ma yin /
analyzed: nor tam dran pa nyams te na ma yin /
translated: If one is confused or has lost mindfulness, it is not a fault.

original: rdzas gzhan zhig bzung ba'i phyir nor tam brjed kyang rung ste kha zas yod pa'i snod la bzung zhing reg pa ni spags par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan zhig bzung ba'i phyir nor tam brjed kyang rung ste kha zas yod pa'i snod la bzung zhing reg pa ni spags par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
translated: If one holds another substance, whether one is confused or has lost mindfulness, and touches the vessel containing food, it is not considered touched. There is no fault.

original: de dag gis bskyong nas gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis bskyong nas gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they are protected and then left.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kha zas kyi snod la nor te bzung ba de bteg cing gud du spos te gnas bskyed kyang spags pa ma yin te nyes med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kha zas kyi snod la nor te bzung ba de bteg cing gud du spos te gnas bskyed kyang spags pa ma yin te nyes med do //
translated: If one is confused and holds the vessel containing food, and then lifts it up and moves it to another place, it is not considered touched. There is no fault.

original: rab tu chung du'i gnas su bskyal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu chung du'i gnas su bskyal ba'o //
translated: It is carried to a very small place.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar nor tam gnas bsnor nas khyer khyer ba las lam du tshor na thal byung dor ba ma yin gyi gnas gang nye ba cig tu skyal na'ang spags pa ma yin te nyes med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar nor tam gnas bsnor nas khyer khyer ba las lam du tshor na thal byung dor ba ma yin gyi gnas gang nye ba cig tu skyal na'ang spags pa ma yin te nyes med do //
translated: If one carries it, having changed the place or having changed the location, as in the case of the second Satra, it is not a case of throwing it away, but if one carries it to a place which is nearer, it is not a case of hoarding.

original: lhod pas bteg pa'am byin len byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lhod pas bteg pa'am byin len byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a case of taking up again, if one takes it up carelessly or if one has taken it up again.

original: dge slong phas pham pa ma byung du zin kyang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang ltung ba la sogs pa la lhong cing mi bsrung bas ni byin len byas kyang bzar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa ma byung du zin kyang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang ltung ba la sogs pa la lhong cing mi bsrung bas ni byin len byas kyang bzar mi rung ngo //
translated: Even though one has taken it up again, it is not fit to be eaten, if a Bhiká¹£u, although he has not committed a PÄrÄjika, has committed a SamghÄvaÅ›eá¹£a, a PÄyantika, etc., and does not guard himself against further transgressions.

original: bteg pa dang btsos pa yang ma brtags pa ma yin te bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: bteg pa dang btsos pa yang ma brtags pa ma yin te bzar rung ngo //
translated: It is not a case of not examining what has been taken up again or what has been cooked, and it is fit to be eaten.

original: des zas byin pa blangs na'ang byin len du chud do //ğŸ”½byin len du rigs pa'i gtogs pa med par ma gyur na blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des zas byin pa blangs na'ang byin len du chud do // byin len du rigs pa'i gtogs pa med par ma gyur na blangs pa ma yin no //

original: kha zas 'dri ma zhing 'ongs ba la bdag gi lag pas tshus bsus te sngar blangs pa ni byin len du mi chud do //
