original: dge sbyong dang khyim pa zas kyi snod la 'dzin pa bzhin du dge slong @147a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang khyim pa zas kyi snod la 'dzin pa bzhin du dge slong @147a * //
translated: Monks and householders hold the vessel of food.ğŸ”½

original: gis reg pa ni spags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gis reg pa ni spags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks do not become defiled by touching the food vessel of a layperson or a renunciate, just as they are not defiled by touching a vessel containing food that is not to be kept.

original: gtogs pa de dag thag bu la sogs pas sprel ba'o //ğŸ”½zas dang tshod ma la sogs pa phyi dro rtog cing sel na khyim pa'am dge sbyong gis thag bu'i thog ma nas bzung la dge slong gis thog ma gcig las bzung ste kha zas thag bu gnyis so sor ma bral zhing reg bzhin du bsal cing brtags pa
analyzed: gtogs pa de dag thag bu la sogs pas sprel ba'o // zas dang tshod ma la sogs pa phyi dro rtog cing sel na khyim pa'am dge sbyong gis thag bu'i thog ma nas bzung la dge slong gis thog ma gcig las bzung ste kha zas thag bu gnyis so sor ma bral zhing reg bzhin du bsal cing brtags pa
translated: The food and vegetables are connected by a string, etc.ğŸ”½If a layperson or a renunciate examines and removes the food and vegetables in the evening, the monk should hold the end of the string and the layperson should hold the other end.

original: ni spags par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
analyzed: ni spags par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
translated: If the food is not separated and the two ends of the string are held together, the monk does not become defiled by the examination and removal of the food.

original: sdom pa mtshungs lta ba tha mi dad na spags pa dang blangs pa dang byin len du gcig go //
analyzed: sdom pa mtshungs lta ba tha mi dad na spags pa dang blangs pa dang byin len du gcig go //
translated: If the vows are the same and the views are not different, the defiling, accepting, and receiving are the same.

original: dge slong du mtshungs shing sangs rgyas kyi chos la lta pa 'dra na dge slong gis spags kyang rung bzar mi rung /
analyzed: dge slong du mtshungs shing sangs rgyas kyi chos la lta pa 'dra na dge slong gis spags kyang rung bzar mi rung /
translated: If the monks are the same and the view of the Buddhaâ€™s teaching is the same, it is not necessary for the monk to accept the food.

original: byin len ma byas par thug thub tu byin te blangs pa dang byin len du mi chud de bzar mi rung /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par thug thub tu byin te blangs pa dang byin len du mi chud de bzar mi rung /
translated: If one receives food without having performed the formal accepting of it, it is not considered to have been accepted and is not to be eaten.

original: gcig gis zan la byin len byas na kun gyis bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig gis zan la byin len byas na kun gyis bzar rung ngo //
translated: If one monk has performed the formal accepting of food, it is suitable for all to eat it.

original: dam pa yis dam pa ma yin pa'i 'o //
analyzed: dam pa yis dam pa ma yin pa'i 'o //
translated: If a holy person has accepted the food of an un-holy person,

original: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas bshad pa rnam gsum dge slong mas byas pa ni dge slong mas kyang bsrungs te spags pa dang blangs pa'ang bzar mi rung byin len byas pa yang gdod byin len bya mi dgos te bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas bshad pa rnam gsum dge slong mas byas pa ni dge slong mas kyang bsrungs te spags pa dang blangs pa'ang bzar mi rung byin len byas pa yang gdod byin len bya mi dgos te bzar rung ngo //
translated: the three kinds of food mentioned in the Sutra of the Final Utterances, if prepared and received by a nun, are not to be eaten, even if protected by a nun. If they have been formally accepted, they need not be formally accepted again and are suitable to be eaten.

original: 'di gsum dge slob mas byas pa ni dge slong mas mi bsrung ngo //
analyzed: 'di gsum dge slob mas byas pa ni dge slong mas mi bsrung ngo //
translated: If these three have been prepared by a probationary nun, they are not to be protected by a nun.

original: khyim pa bzhin du bud med dang skyes pa phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: khyim pa bzhin du bud med dang skyes pa phan tshun du'o //
translated: Like householders, women and men may do so for each other.

original: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas smos pa'i rnam gsum la btag pa dang blangs pa dang byin len dge slong mas dge slong pha la byas na byin len du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas smos pa'i rnam gsum la btag pa dang blangs pa dang byin len dge slong mas dge slong pha la byas na byin len du 'gyur ro //
translated: The three kinds of food mentioned in the Sutra of the Final Utterances, if prepared and received by a nun, and if the formal accepting of them has been performed by a monk for a nun, the formal accepting is valid.

original: blang ba dang bteg pa dang dge slong pas bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: blang ba dang bteg pa dang dge slong pas bzar rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable for a monk to receive, lift up, and eat.

original: dge slong phas byas pa'am dge slong ma la rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong phas byas pa'am dge slong ma la rung ngo //
translated: If a monk has made it, or if a nun has made it, it is suitable.

original: dge sbyong gi sba ba tshun chad la'ang reg pa'ang de bzhin du nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi sba ba tshun chad la'ang reg pa'ang de bzhin du nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If he touches even the food of a novice monk, it is a fault in the same way.

original: dge sbyong gis dge sbyong dang dge slong gi zas la reg pa la nyes med pa bzhin du dge slong gis dge sbyong gi zas la reg pa'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis dge sbyong dang dge slong gi zas la reg pa la nyes med pa bzhin du dge slong gis dge sbyong gi zas la reg pa'ang nyes med do //
translated: Just as it is not a fault for a monk to touch the food of a monk or nun, it is not a fault for a monk to touch the food of a novice monk.

original: dge slong gis dge slong nyid kyi zas la reg pa ni nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong nyid kyi zas la reg pa ni nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if a monk touches the food of another monk, it is a fault.

original: re ba yod pas byin pa ni btang ba yin no //
analyzed: re ba yod pas byin pa ni btang ba yin no //
translated: If it is given with the expectation that it will be given back, it is not a gift.

original: khyim pa kha zas la chags bzhin du byin te chags par shes bzhin du zos na ltung ba ste bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: khyim pa kha zas la chags bzhin du byin te chags par shes bzhin du zos na ltung ba ste bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: If a householder gives food out of attachment to food, and the monk eats it knowing that the householder is attached, it is a downfall. This is explained by Vijaya Varma.

original: bdag gis spags pa'i kha zas de la chags bzhin du gzhan zhig byin te slar bdag byin te zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis spags pa'i kha zas de la chags bzhin du gzhan zhig byin te slar bdag byin te zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If the monk gives back to himself food that he himself has prepared, and then eats it, it is a downfall.

original: me re bar btang nas re bar gyur na phyed do //
analyzed: me re bar btang nas re bar gyur na phyed do //
translated: If it is half burnt, it is half defiled.

original: khyim pas sngar ni chags pa'i @147b sems med la phyis chags pa'i sems byung ba'i zan cig byin te de ltar shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: khyim pas sngar ni chags pa'i @147b sems med la phyis chags pa'i sems byung ba'i zan cig byin te de ltar shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Vijaya-varman explains that if a layperson gives food without a mind of attachment at first, but later a mind of attachment arises, and if one eats it knowing that, it is a misdeed.

original: bdag gis spags par 'gyur ba'i kha zas chags pa'i sems med par gzhan zhig byin la phyis chags shing 'dod de thabs cig gis sbyin du bcug nas zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: bdag gis spags par 'gyur ba'i kha zas chags pa'i sems med par gzhan zhig byin la phyis chags shing 'dod de thabs cig gis sbyin du bcug nas zos na nyes byas /
translated: If one gives food to be defiled by oneself to another without a mind of attachment, and later gives it to be defiled by oneself with a mind of attachment and desire, and eats it, it is a misdeed.

original: de bas na de la mi bslang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na de la mi bslang ngo //
translated: Therefore, one should not request it.

original: khyim pa zan la chags te byin par shes bzhin du zas rims shig zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bslang ngo zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: khyim pa zan la chags te byin par shes bzhin du zas rims shig zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bslang ngo zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Vijaya-varman explains that if a layperson gives food with attachment, one should not request it, saying, â€œI have a cold,â€ and so on, knowing that it is defiled.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar spags pa'i kha zas gzhan byin bslar zos na nyes bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mi bslang ngo ;
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar spags pa'i kha zas gzhan byin bslar zos na nyes bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mi bslang ngo ;
translated: According to the latter sÅ«tra, one should not request it because if one eats food to be defiled by oneself that was given by another, it becomes defiled.

original: / shes nas mi blang /
analyzed: / shes nas mi blang /
translated: One should not request it knowingly.

original: khyim pa zan la chags bzhin du byin par shes pa zos na ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi blang ngo zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: khyim pa zan la chags bzhin du byin par shes pa zos na ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi blang ngo zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.ğŸ”½One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.ğŸ”½One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.ğŸ”½One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.

analyzed: bdag gis spags par gyur pa'i zas gzhan byin pa slar byin te ngo shes na mi blang ngo // ma brtags pa ma yin pa'i skal ba bskur bar reg pa dang khyer ba gzhug pa dang de lta bu'i rkyen cig na'o //

original: kha zas la reg kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun gyi zhing shas su btang ba'i skal ba bskur ba dang nas kyi skal ba shas su btang ba'i mis bskyal te nang du 'jug pa'am snod du ldugs sum btu pa ste song ba ni khyim pa dang dge
analyzed: kha zas la reg kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun gyi zhing shas su btang ba'i skal ba bskur ba dang nas kyi skal ba shas su btang ba'i mis bskyal te nang du 'jug pa'am snod du ldugs sum btu pa ste song ba ni khyim pa dang dge
translated: One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.ğŸ”½One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.ğŸ”½One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.

original: sbyor me la reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen byung na bskyab dang gzhug pa'i phyir reg pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: sbyor me la reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen byung na bskyab dang gzhug pa'i phyir reg pa ni nyes med do //
translated: One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who is attached to his food, because one would then commit a downfall.

original: shing rta 'dren pa'i stan ma gtogs te'o //
analyzed: shing rta 'dren pa'i stan ma gtogs te'o //
translated: One should not accept food that one knows was given by a layperson who

original: zas shig shing rta'i nang du bskyed na rkyen cig gis shing rta la rag dgos na'ang shing rta'i kha lo sgyur ba 'dug pa'i sa lam reg na gzhan la reg pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: zas shig shing rta'i nang du bskyed na rkyen cig gis shing rta la rag dgos na'ang shing rta'i kha lo sgyur ba 'dug pa'i sa lam reg na gzhan la reg pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one places food in a cart, if one needs to touch the cart for some reason, if the driver is present, there is no fault in touching the place where he is.

original: gad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gad pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one is a sweeper.

original: shing rta'i nang du kha zas dgang pa'i tshe rkyen cig byung na kha lo bsgyur ba 'dug pa'i sa la ma reg par bdag gis bkang yang nyes med /
analyzed: shing rta'i nang du kha zas dgang pa'i tshe rkyen cig byung na kha lo bsgyur ba 'dug pa'i sa la ma reg par bdag gis bkang yang nyes med /
translated: If one is placing food in a cart, if some condition arises such that one must fill it without touching the place where the driver is, there is no fault.

original: slar dbyung ba'i tshe 'ang de bzhin bya'o zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: slar dbyung ba'i tshe 'ang de bzhin bya'o zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Also, when removing it, one should act in the same way. This is explained by VÄ«ryasiá¹ƒha.

original: shing rta na kha zas 'dug pa'i tshe gang pa nyid du mi bya'i dge slong mi reg par 'dug pa'i sa tsam bzhag la kha zas gzhug go //
analyzed: shing rta na kha zas 'dug pa'i tshe gang pa nyid du mi bya'i dge slong mi reg par 'dug pa'i sa tsam bzhag la kha zas gzhug go //
translated: When food is in a cart, one should not make it full to the brim. One should place it so that the monks do not touch it, and then place the food.

original: nad pa zhon pa yang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa zhon pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one is riding on it as a sick person.

original: kha zas bcug pa'i shing rta'i nang du dge slong nad pa zhig 'dug pa na yang nad pa des shing rta'i kha lo sgyur pa 'dug pa'i sa la mi reg par bya'o zhes pi dza ya bar mas bshad /ğŸ”½kha zas bcug pa'i shing rta la nad pa @148a * //
analyzed: kha zas bcug pa'i shing rta'i nang du dge slong nad pa zhig 'dug pa na yang nad pa des shing rta'i kha lo sgyur pa 'dug pa'i sa la mi reg par bya'o zhes pi dza ya bar mas bshad / kha zas bcug pa'i shing rta la nad pa @148a * //
translated: If a sick person must be placed in a cart carrying food, he should be placed there in such a way that he does not touch the food.

original: zhig bzhag dgos na'ang nad pas kha zas la mi reg pa tsam gyis bzhag / gru'i dngo na'o //
analyzed: zhig bzhag dgos na'ang nad pas kha zas la mi reg pa tsam gyis bzhag / gru'i dngo na'o //
translated: If a sick person must be placed on the deck of a boat, he should be placed there in such a way that he does not touch the food.

original: gru'i nang du kha zas bcug ste 'gro na'ang dngor 'dzin 'dug pa'i sar reg na'ang ltung ba zhes bi ja ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: gru'i nang du kha zas bcug ste 'gro na'ang dngor 'dzin 'dug pa'i sar reg na'ang ltung ba zhes bi ja ya bar mas bshad /
translated: If a boat carrying food travels, if he touches the ground where the person holding the boat is standing, he commits an offense.

original: nas dang nad pa lta bu gru'i nang du bskyed nas skam pa'i phyir dngor bzhag go //
analyzed: nas dang nad pa lta bu gru'i nang du bskyed nas skam pa'i phyir dngor bzhag go //
translated: If a sick person is carried in a boat, he should be placed on the deck in order to dry him.

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir stan yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir stan yang ngo //
translated: If he is carried in a boat, he should sit on a seat in order to hold him.

original: nad pa'i nang na'ang dngor 'dzin 'dug pa'i sa la ma reg par 'dug go zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: nad pa'i nang na'ang dngor 'dzin 'dug pa'i sa la ma reg par 'dug go zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: If a sick person is in a boat, he should sit in such a way that he does not touch the ground where the person holding the boat is standing.

original: kha zas dang dge slong nad pa la sogs pa grur zhugs na'ang dngor 'dzin dang skya ba 'debs pa'i sa bzhag / dge 'dun gyi dang sman ldud pa g-yogs pa dbog pa dang gzar bu'i las kun dang dbyung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: kha zas dang dge slong nad pa la sogs pa grur zhugs na'ang dngor 'dzin dang skya ba 'debs pa'i sa bzhag / dge 'dun gyi dang sman ldud pa g-yogs pa dbog pa dang gzar bu'i las kun dang dbyung ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, when a monk who is sick and so on boards a boat, he should put down the food and the oar.

original: dge 'dun gyi kha zas dang sman 'ched cing g-yos byed pa la khyim pa dang dge sbyong la sogs pa med na lud pa la dge slong gi gzar bu dang skya bas dkrugs pa dang / dbyung zhing dbog pa'i phyir reg pa nyes pa med do//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kha zas dang sman 'ched cing g-yos byed pa la khyim pa dang dge sbyong la sogs pa med na lud pa la dge slong gi gzar bu dang skya bas dkrugs pa dang / dbyung zhing dbog pa'i phyir reg pa nyes pa med do//
translated: If there are no laymen or ascetics to prepare the food and medicine of the Saá¹…gha, then it is not wrong for a monk to stir the food with his ladle or oar in order to cool it and distribute it.

original: dge slong gang zag gis kha zas dang sman btso ba la lud pa la sogs pa'i rkyen byung na de bzhin kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gang zag gis kha zas dang sman btso ba la lud pa la sogs pa'i rkyen byung na de bzhin kyang rung ngo //
translated: If a monk individually prepares food and medicine, and the conditions of the food, such as the scum, arise, then it is also suitable.

original: shing dbyung me bsad pa gos kyi grva la sogs pas rlung brlab pas kyang thog mar nan tan bya /
analyzed: shing dbyung me bsad pa gos kyi grva la sogs pas rlung brlab pas kyang thog mar nan tan bya /
translated: If one removes wood, extinguishes fire, or fans wind with the corner of oneâ€™s robe and so on, one should first make an effort.

original: kha zas dang sman 'tshed pa lud pa la thog mar shing phri shing dbyung me gsad gos kyi grvas rlung brlab chus dgab pa la sogs pa sdud pa zhi ba'i thabs 'di rnams kyi thabs kyis bya ste ma nus na gdod s'u tra ltag ma ltar bya /
analyzed: kha zas dang sman 'tshed pa lud pa la thog mar shing phri shing dbyung me gsad gos kyi grvas rlung brlab chus dgab pa la sogs pa sdud pa zhi ba'i thabs 'di rnams kyi thabs kyis bya ste ma nus na gdod s'u tra ltag ma ltar bya /
translated: When cooking food and medicine, first remove the wood, extinguish the fire, cover the pot with a cloth, and so on. If you are unable to do this, then act as in the latter part of the sÅ«tra.

original: rtag par cho ge mi 'grub na chu bo las bsgral ba'i phyir khyer bslebs pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rtag par cho ge mi 'grub na chu bo las bsgral ba'i phyir khyer bslebs pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: If you are unable to perform the rite every day, then do it in order to cross a river, or in order to carry something.

original: chu brgal zhing grur 'jug pa la kha zas grur skyel ba'i mi med de gru spags te song du nye ste mi slebs na kha zas bdag gis gru'i nang du bskyas pa'ang nyes med do zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: chu brgal zhing grur 'jug pa la kha zas grur skyel ba'i mi med de gru spags te song du nye ste mi slebs na kha zas bdag gis gru'i nang du bskyas pa'ang nyes med do zhes bi dza ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Vijayasena explains that if you are crossing a river and there is no one to carry your food to the boat, and the boat is about to leave without you, it is permissible to carry your food to the boat yourself.

original: dge slong gis rgyags khur tsa cig la bskur te chu rgal ba las chu che ste khur tsas mi nus na khur tsa dang gnyis thag bus sbrel la bdag gis rgyags khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: dge slong gis rgyags khur tsa cig la bskur te chu rgal ba las chu che ste khur tsas mi nus na khur tsa dang gnyis thag bus sbrel la bdag gis rgyags khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If a monk is crossing a river carrying a load of provisions and the river is too deep for the load, it is permissible for him to carry the provisions if he ties them to himself with a rope.

original: thag bus sbrel ma nus na yang chu brgal gyi bar du bdag gis khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: thag bus sbrel ma nus na yang chu brgal gyi bar du bdag gis khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If the rope cannot be carried, it is not a fault to carry it until the river is crossed.

original: chu brgal ba la khur tsa sngon du song ste rgyags phyi na lus na khur tsa nam slebs pa'i phyir khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: chu brgal ba la khur tsa sngon du song ste rgyags phyi na lus na khur tsa nam slebs pa'i phyir khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If the provisions are carried in front of the one who carries the rope, and the rope is left behind, it is not a fault to carry the rope until the one who carries the provisions arrives.

original: gzhan med na blangs pa'ang rgyags su'o //
analyzed: gzhan med na blangs pa'ang rgyags su'o //
translated: If there is no one else, it is also permitted to carry the rope as provisions.

original: s'u tra ltag ma'i ltag ma ltar rgyags bdag gis khyer @148b ba'i rnams g-yog gam khyim pa gzhan la yang bskur du med la rgyags gzhan yang med na bdag gis khyer zhing byed na yang nyes med /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma'i ltag ma ltar rgyags bdag gis khyer @148b ba'i rnams g-yog gam khyim pa gzhan la yang bskur du med la rgyags gzhan yang med na bdag gis khyer zhing byed na yang nyes med /
translated: If, like the last of the last, the provisions are carried by the one who carries the rope, and it is not possible to give them to another servant or layperson, and there are no other provisions, it is not a fault to carry them and use them.

original: khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag la dad pa bya /
analyzed: khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag la dad pa bya /
translated: If there is no one to carry the rope, one should have faith in the benefactor.

original: lam du zhugs te 'gro ba la rgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa med na lam 'grogs pa la bdag gi khur tsa yang med zas la yang reg tu mi rung na khyod kyis bskur du ci gnang zhes gsol /
analyzed: lam du zhugs te 'gro ba la rgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa med na lam 'grogs pa la bdag gi khur tsa yang med zas la yang reg tu mi rung na khyod kyis bskur du ci gnang zhes gsol /
translated: If one has set out on the road and is going, and there is no one to carry the provisions, if one says to the companions on the road, â€œI also have no provisions to carry. If it is not suitable to touch the food, what can you give me?â€

original: ma grub na bdag gis bskur /
analyzed: ma grub na bdag gis bskur /
translated: If it is not accomplished, one should give it oneself.

original: ltag ma ltar gsol te'ang ma gnang bdag 'gro ba'i don sde snod gsum thos par 'gyur ba lta bu zhig ste mi 'gror mi rung na bdag gi rgyags bdag nyid kyis khyer yang nyes med do //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar gsol te'ang ma gnang bdag 'gro ba'i don sde snod gsum thos par 'gyur ba lta bu zhig ste mi 'gror mi rung na bdag gi rgyags bdag nyid kyis khyer yang nyes med do //
translated: If it is not possible to do this, then it is permissible to take the food that one has carried oneself, thinking that it is for the sake of others.

original: de nyid byin la brje zhing blang par bsgrub /
analyzed: de nyid byin la brje zhing blang par bsgrub /
translated: One should exchange it and take it by means of the ritual of giving and taking.

original: bdag nyid khyer ba'i zas de bzar mi rung ba'i phyir 'gron po gzhan la zas nyi rim gyis kyang brjes te bza'/
analyzed: bdag nyid khyer ba'i zas de bzar mi rung ba'i phyir 'gron po gzhan la zas nyi rim gyis kyang brjes te bza'/
translated: Because it is not suitable to eat the food that one has carried oneself, one should exchange it with another traveler, and then eat it.

original: de ma grub na de bza'/
analyzed: de ma grub na de bza'/
translated: If that is not possible, then one should eat it.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar nyi rim gyis brjes kyang ma grub na bdag nyid kyis khyer ba'i zan bza'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar nyi rim gyis brjes kyang ma grub na bdag nyid kyis khyer ba'i zan bza'o //
translated: If it is not possible to exchange it with another traveler, then one should eat the food that one has carried oneself, as in the case of the sutra of the traveler.

original: byin len byed pa med na byin len ma byas par gzhan gyi'am bdag gi'o //
analyzed: byin len byed pa med na byin len ma byas par gzhan gyi'am bdag gi'o //
translated: If there is no one to perform the ritual of giving and taking, then one should eat one's own food or the food of another, without performing the ritual of giving and taking.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bdag nyid kyi zan za ba la byin len byed pa'i mi med na 'du shes byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi bdag po med par bsams la bzar rung ste 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bdag nyid kyi zan za ba la byin len byed pa'i mi med na 'du shes byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi bdag po med par bsams la bzar rung ste 'og nas 'chad /
translated: If there is no one to perform the ritual of giving and taking for the food that one is going to eat, as in the case of the sutra of the traveler, then one should think that one is the lord of the northern continent of Kuru, who does not have the concept of giving and taking, and it is suitable to eat. This will be explained below.

original: zas bcad pa byas te'o //
analyzed: zas bcad pa byas te'o //
translated: If one has fasted, one may eat it.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bzar rung pa yang zas brje ba dang byin len byed pa'i mi med na zhag gcig gi bar du ni zan mi bza'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bzar rung pa yang zas brje ba dang byin len byed pa'i mi med na zhag gcig gi bar du ni zan mi bza'o //
translated: If one has not obtained a substitute or a ritual for the food, one may not eat for one day.

original: thog ma'i nyi ma stag gi spar ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i nyi ma stag gi spar ba'o //
translated: The first day is the tiger's leap.

original: phyi de nyid kyang zan brje ba dang byin len byed pa med na stag gi spar ba ste bdag gis lag gi ya btsums gang bza'o //
analyzed: phyi de nyid kyang zan brje ba dang byin len byed pa med na stag gi spar ba ste bdag gis lag gi ya btsums gang bza'o //
translated: If one has not obtained a substitute or a ritual for the food on the following day, one may eat whatever one has in one's hand, which is called the tiger's leap.

original: gnyis la gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis la gnyis so //
translated: On the second day, one may eat whatever one has obtained.

original: de'i phyir de nyin par kyang zas brje ba dang byin len byed pa ma rnyed na stag gi spar ba do bza'o //ğŸ”½gsum la ci chog tu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyin par kyang zas brje ba dang byin len byed pa ma rnyed na stag gi spar ba do bza'o // gsum la ci chog tu'o //
translated: Therefore, if one has not obtained a substitute or a ritual for the food on that day, one may eat whatever one has in one's hand.ğŸ”½On the third day, one may eat as much as one likes.

original: nyi ma gsum phan chad ni ci chog tu 'grangs 'grangs su bzar dbang ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum phan chad ni ci chog tu 'grangs 'grangs su bzar dbang ngo //
translated: For more than three days, one may eat as much as one likes.

original: 'bras bu dus ma yin par brtag pa ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas par blangs pa'ang bza'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dus ma yin par brtag pa ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas par blangs pa'ang bza'o //
translated: One may also eat fruits that have not been examined for unripe ones and that have not been ritually taken.

original: bdag gi zas zad dam med dam sbyin bdag gis ma sbyar la bslab du ma snyed na 'bras bu la sogs pa ma brtags pa dang byin len ma byas pa bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi zas zad dam med dam sbyin bdag gis ma sbyar la bslab du ma snyed na 'bras bu la sogs pa ma brtags pa dang byin len ma byas pa bzar rung ngo //
translated: If my food is exhausted or non-existent, if the benefactor has not prepared it, if I have not received the training, then it is suitable to eat uninspected grains, etc., without the ritual of giving and taking.

original: phyi dro bzar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: phyi dro bzar yang rung ngo //
translated: It is also suitable to eat in the evening.

original: zas med pas so //
analyzed: zas med pas so //
translated: Because there is no food.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bzar rung pa yang zas med cing phongs na bza'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar bzar rung pa yang zas med cing phongs na bza'o //
translated: It is also suitable to eat like the sutra-holder, if one is destitute and eats when there is no food.

original: bkres te mi bzod @149a * //
analyzed: bkres te mi bzod @149a * //
translated: If one is unable to endure hunger.

original: na'o // s'u tra ltag ma ltar phongs te bza' ba yang mi bkres shing bzod na mi bza'i bkres te mi bzod na bza'o //
analyzed: na'o // s'u tra ltag ma ltar phongs te bza' ba yang mi bkres shing bzod na mi bza'i bkres te mi bzod na bza'o //
translated: If one is unable to endure hunger, it is suitable to eat like the sutra-holder. If one is not hungry and can endure it, it is not suitable.

original: rtsa ba yang ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba yang ngo //
translated: The roots are also.

original: bkres te mi bzod na gro ma la sogs pa'i rtsa ba brko mi dgos par 'dug pa yang bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: bkres te mi bzod na gro ma la sogs pa'i rtsa ba brko mi dgos par 'dug pa yang bzar rung ngo //
translated: If one is unable to endure hunger, it is also suitable to eat the roots of grass, etc., which are not dug up, but stand there.

original: bdag gis phrags shing phyung nas btsos te'o //
analyzed: bdag gis phrags shing phyung nas btsos te'o //
translated: After I have pulled them up and cooked them.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rtsa ba brko mi dgos pa dang shing tog blangs zin pa ma rnyed na shing tog blags shing rtsa ba brkos te bzar yang dbang ngo //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rtsa ba brko mi dgos pa dang shing tog blangs zin pa ma rnyed na shing tog blags shing rtsa ba brkos te bzar yang dbang ngo //
translated: Like the latter Sutra, it is not necessary to dig up the roots. If you do not find the fruit you have taken, you may dig up the roots of the fruit you have taken and eat it.

original: btsor yang dbang ngo //
analyzed: btsor yang dbang ngo //
translated: You may also cook it.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi grags pa thams cad du byin len ma byas par za ba la sogs pa rtsam par 'dod pa yid la bya'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi grags pa thams cad du byin len ma byas par za ba la sogs pa rtsam par 'dod pa yid la bya'o //
translated: In all the regions of Uttarakuru, you may eat without performing the rite of receiving the food, and so forth.

original: s'u tra ltag ma rnams ltar bza' ba yang byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi kha zas bdag po med pa yin par bsams la byin len byed pa med pa'i phyir ba dang yul chos kyis btsog pa'i phyir gcig la gcig reg tu mi rung bas bdag nyid kyis
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma rnams ltar bza' ba yang byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi kha zas bdag po med pa yin par bsams la byin len byed pa med pa'i phyir ba dang yul chos kyis btsog pa'i phyir gcig la gcig reg tu mi rung bas bdag nyid kyis
translated: Like the latter Sutra, you should think that the food is the food of Uttarakuru, which is not owned by anyone, and that since there is no rite of receiving the food and since it is not suitable for you to touch each other's food because of the local customs, you should take it yourself.

original: blangs te bza'o snyam du bsams la bza'o//
analyzed: blangs te bza'o snyam du bsams la bza'o//
translated: Thinking in this way, you should eat.

original: snod kyi nang nas kha blugs mi bya /
analyzed: snod kyi nang nas kha blugs mi bya /
translated: Do not put food in your mouth from a container.

original: chu dang skom la sogs pa 'thungs pa'i tshe kha blugs mi bya /
analyzed: chu dang skom la sogs pa 'thungs pa'i tshe kha blugs mi bya /
translated: When you drink water, beverages, and so forth, do not put your mouth on the container.

original: yod na lag pa bkrus pa'am lo mar ro //
analyzed: yod na lag pa bkrus pa'am lo mar ro //
translated: If you do, wash your hands or use a leaf.

original: chu 'am skom 'thungs dgos te snod gzhan med na lag pa'am lo ma bkrus la de'i nang du btung ngo //
analyzed: chu 'am skom 'thungs dgos te snod gzhan med na lag pa'am lo ma bkrus la de'i nang du btung ngo //
translated: If you need to drink water or a beverage, and you have no other container, wash your hands or a leaf and drink from them.

original: ma grub na dben par ro //
analyzed: ma grub na dben par ro //
translated: If you cannot do that, do it in private.

original: chu dkon te lo ma'am lag pa bkrur mi chog na mi gzhan gyis ma mthong bar dben par kha blugs mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu dkon te lo ma'am lag pa bkrur mi chog na mi gzhan gyis ma mthong bar dben par kha blugs mi bya'o //
translated: If water is scarce and you cannot wash a leaf or your hands, you should not pour the beverage into your mouth in public.

original: chu dang bcas pa 'di la dgab pa med par mi spyad /
analyzed: chu dang bcas pa 'di la dgab pa med par mi spyad /
translated: You should not use a vessel that is not covered.

original: kun de dang chu snod la sogs pa kha gab kyis ma bkab par gzhag pa'am spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun de dang chu snod la sogs pa kha gab kyis ma bkab par gzhag pa'am spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not use or keep vessels such as water containers without covers.

original: dgab pa ni rnam pa gsum ste shing gi dang rdo'i dang sa'i 'o //
analyzed: dgab pa ni rnam pa gsum ste shing gi dang rdo'i dang sa'i 'o //
translated: There are three kinds of covers: wooden, stone, and earthen.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar snod kyi kha dgab bya ba'i rgyu ni sa dang rdo dang shing las bya'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar snod kyi kha dgab bya ba'i rgyu ni sa dang rdo dang shing las bya'o //
translated: The cause for covering the mouth of a vessel, as in the second sÅ«tra, is wood, stone, or earth.

original: lcags dang zangs dang ra gan dang khar ba la sogs pa rang chas 'dug pa'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: lcags dang zangs dang ra gan dang khar ba la sogs pa rang chas 'dug pa'ang nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault if the vessel is naturally covered with iron, copper, brass, or porcelain.

original: snod kyi gzhi bcangs te shing la'am rdo la'o //
analyzed: snod kyi gzhi bcangs te shing la'am rdo la'o //
translated: The base of the vessel should be placed on wood or stone.

original: snod kyi gzhi shing dang rdo la sogs pa la bzhag kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: snod kyi gzhi shing dang rdo la sogs pa la bzhag kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one takes the leaves of a tree or a plant, etc., which are the basis of a vessel, there is no fault.

original: ma bzhag kyang nyes med do //ğŸ”½nyes med pa ni snod kyi dgos par lo ma ma byin par blangs kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma bzhag kyang nyes med do // nyes med pa ni snod kyi dgos par lo ma ma byin par blangs kyang ngo //
translated: If one does not take them, there is no fault.ğŸ”½There is no fault if one takes the leaves of a tree or a plant, etc., which are the basis of a vessel, without asking permission, for the purpose of making a vessel.

original: snod spyad med pa'i phyir zan za ba'i phyir gzhir rtsi shing gi lo ma byin len ma byas par blangs te byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: snod spyad med pa'i phyir zan za ba'i phyir gzhir rtsi shing gi lo ma byin len ma byas par blangs te byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one eats food on a leaf of a tree or a plant, etc., which is the basis of a vessel, because one has no vessel, there is no fault if one takes it without asking permission.

original: de btang ba dang ma btang ba bye brag med do //
analyzed: de btang ba dang ma btang ba bye brag med do //
translated: There is no difference between what is given and what is not given.

original: zan @149b za ba'i gzhi lo mas bya ba snga na chad cing bral zin pa la yang rung rtsa ba las ma chad cing chags bzhin pa'i lo ma'i steng du zos kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: zan @149b za ba'i gzhi lo mas bya ba snga na chad cing bral zin pa la yang rung rtsa ba las ma chad cing chags bzhin pa'i lo ma'i steng du zos kyang rung ngo //
translated: If one eats food on a leaf of a tree or a plant, etc., which is the basis of a vessel, it is permissible if the leaf has already been cut off and separated from the root, or if one eats on a leaf that is not yet cut off and still attached to the root.

original: dgos par gzhan med na ma btang ba la'o //
analyzed: dgos par gzhan med na ma btang ba la'o //
translated: If there is no other purpose, it is permissible to use what is not given.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rtsa ba las ma chad pa'i lo ma'i steng du zan za ba ni rtsa ba dang so sor bral ba'i lo ma med na gdod bza' ste lo ma de la snod cing chung zad ral ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rtsa ba las ma chad pa'i lo ma'i steng du zan za ba ni rtsa ba dang so sor bral ba'i lo ma med na gdod bza' ste lo ma de la snod cing chung zad ral ba ni nyes med do //
translated: As in the case of the second sutra, one should eat one's food on leaves that are not torn from their stalks. If there are no leaves that are not torn from their stalks, one should eat on leaves that are torn from their stalks. There is no fault if the leaves are slightly torn.

original: spags pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: spags pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is without embellishment.

original: spags pa'i zas zos pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /
analyzed: spags pa'i zas zos pa'i ltung ba ste rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall is accrued when one eats the food.

original: // / kha nas mid pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / kha nas mid pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of eating food that has been put in one's mouth is explained as follows.

original: sbyin bdag gis sems kyis btang ba la gzhan dang byin len byed pa med na blangs te bza'/
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis sems kyis btang ba la gzhan dang byin len byed pa med na blangs te bza'/
translated: If the benefactor has mentally given the food, and if there is no one else to receive the food, one may eat it.

original: sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs shing kha zas byin te mngon par 'dug la sbyin bdag chu'am me la sogs pa'i rkyen byung ste mi khom nas kha zas 'dri ma pa'i mi med la gdugs tshod kyis kyang mi thub na kha zas mngon par byin pa de byin len
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis spyan drangs shing kha zas byin te mngon par 'dug la sbyin bdag chu'am me la sogs pa'i rkyen byung ste mi khom nas kha zas 'dri ma pa'i mi med la gdugs tshod kyis kyang mi thub na kha zas mngon par byin pa de byin len
translated: If the benefactor has invited one to eat and has given one food, and if one is sitting down to eat, but if the benefactor is unable to eat because of an emergency such as the presence of water or fire, and if there is no one else to receive the food, and if one is unable to wait until noon, one may eat the food that has been given.

original: ma byas par brims te zos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: ma byas par brims te zos kyang nyes med do //
translated: There is no fault if one eats the food after having distributed it without having received it.

original: mngon sum du ;
analyzed: mngon sum du ;
translated: In the presence of the benefactor.

original: dge slong kha zas byin pa'i mi thad kar mngon sum du 'dug la byin len bya ba dang / mtshams kyi nang du /
analyzed: dge slong kha zas byin pa'i mi thad kar mngon sum du 'dug la byin len bya ba dang / mtshams kyi nang du /
translated: The monk should sit directly in front of the person who is giving the food and receive it there.

original: bar du chu dang rtsig pa mthon pos ma chod pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i phyogs su 'dug ste /ğŸ”½rgyab bam zur nas ma yin gyi mdun du phan tshun drang por byas te nam mkha' 'am rtsig pa'am shing gi kha lta bu na gcig 'dug pa lta bu ma yin pa dang / gan rkyal gyi lag pa lus kyis sam bdag gi lus kyi lag pa khas sbub tu mi bya bar bkan te blang ba dang /
analyzed: bar du chu dang rtsig pa mthon pos ma chod pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i phyogs su 'dug ste / rgyab bam zur nas ma yin gyi mdun du phan tshun drang por byas te nam mkha' 'am rtsig pa'am shing gi kha lta bu na gcig 'dug pa lta bu ma yin pa dang / gan rkyal gyi lag pa lus kyis sam bdag gi lus kyi lag pa khas sbub tu mi bya bar bkan te blang ba dang /
translated: He should sit within the boundary of the ritual action,ğŸ”½not separated from the giver by a high wall or the like.ğŸ”½He should sit facing the giver, not from the side or behind. He should not be like someone sitting in the sky, or on a wall or tree, or like someone lying on his back with his hand under his body.

original: de la gtogs pa dang / lhung bzed dam gzhong pa la sogs pa man ci steng du 'dug pa la 'og nas lag pas bkan te bzung la snod kyi nang du kha zas blugs pa yang rung /
analyzed: de la gtogs pa dang / lhung bzed dam gzhong pa la sogs pa man ci steng du 'dug pa la 'og nas lag pas bkan te bzung la snod kyi nang du kha zas blugs pa yang rung /
translated: He should not be like someone with his hand turned face down, but should hold his hand up and receive the food.

original: theg nus pa /
analyzed: theg nus pa /
translated: He should be able to carry the food.

original: 'drim pa'i mi nad pa dang rgan po dang byis pa lta bu kha zas mi thegs pa dang / sbyin mi nus pa ma yin pa dang / rab tu ma rdzogs pa /
analyzed: 'drim pa'i mi nad pa dang rgan po dang byis pa lta bu kha zas mi thegs pa dang / sbyin mi nus pa ma yin pa dang / rab tu ma rdzogs pa /
translated: The giver is not a sick person, an old person, a child, or someone who cannot manage food, or someone who cannot give.

original: dge slong khrims rdzogs pa ma yin par dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge sbyong pho mo dang khyim pa yang yin pas brims pa dang / mi ma yin pas kyang bal glang dang rta dang spre'u la sogs pa zhig gis sbyin par bsams te byin pa 'ang rung /
analyzed: dge slong khrims rdzogs pa ma yin par dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge sbyong pho mo dang khyim pa yang yin pas brims pa dang / mi ma yin pas kyang bal glang dang rta dang spre'u la sogs pa zhig gis sbyin par bsams te byin pa 'ang rung /
translated: The giver is not someone who is not fully ordained, for it is also permissible for a fully ordained monk to give to a fully ordained nun, a female novice, a male or female novice, or a layperson. It is also permissible for a nonhuman being to give, such as an elephant, a horse, a monkey, and so on, who intends to give.

original: yan lag gis sam /
analyzed: yan lag gis sam /
translated: The gift is given with a limb.

original: 'drim zhing byin pa'i lus kyi yan lag lag pa'am sna'am sos bzung ste byin pa dang / de la gtogs @150a pas /
analyzed: 'drim zhing byin pa'i lus kyi yan lag lag pa'am sna'am sos bzung ste byin pa dang / de la gtogs @150a pas /
translated: It is also permissible to give by holding the limb of the body of the giver with a hand, a nose, or a tooth, or by giving with a limb of the giver.ğŸ”½It is also permissible to give with a limb of the giverâ€™s attendant,

original: 'dri ma pa'i lag pa na gzar bu'am snod spyad kyis brims kyang rung ngo //ğŸ”½'dod cing btang la /
analyzed: 'dri ma pa'i lag pa na gzar bu'am snod spyad kyis brims kyang rung ngo // 'dod cing btang la /
translated: such as a water vessel or a utensil in the hand of the attendant.ğŸ”½The gift is given with desire and let go of.

original: 'drim pa'i mi des kyang bdag la byin par sems shing byin pa dang / blangs na byin len no //
analyzed: 'drim pa'i mi des kyang bdag la byin par sems shing byin pa dang / blangs na byin len no //
translated: It is also permissible to give when the giver thinks, â€œI give to him,â€ and the receiver thinks, â€œI receive from him.â€

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnam ltar byin len byas pa 'di rnams su chud do //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnam ltar byin len byas pa 'di rnams su chud do //
translated: The Blessed One said, These are the ones who have received the gift.

original: bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: bzar rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to eat.

original: smod pa'i yul na dkyil 'khor la zhog shig ces bstan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: smod pa'i yul na dkyil 'khor la zhog shig ces bstan pa yang ngo //
translated: In a place of contempt, place it on the maá¹‡á¸ala.

original: yul la la zhig na yul chos kyis gcig la gcig btsog bar 'dzin cing reg tu mi 'dod de byin len byed du mi btub pa ni 'drim pas mandal gyi steng du spungs te bzhag pa la phyin len ltag ma ltar byas par zos kyang nyes med do
analyzed: yul la la zhig na yul chos kyis gcig la gcig btsog bar 'dzin cing reg tu mi 'dod de byin len byed du mi btub pa ni 'drim pas mandal gyi steng du spungs te bzhag pa la phyin len ltag ma ltar byas par zos kyang nyes med do
translated: In some places, due to local customs, they consider each other unclean and do not want to touch each other, so they are unable to receive the gift. In that case, the server should pile it on the maá¹‡á¸ala and place it there. If one eats it, thinking I have received the gift, there is no fault.

original: // lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi yang gcig go //
analyzed: // lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi yang gcig go //
translated: The alms bowl and its base are one.

original: lhung bzed kyi gzhi rtsi shing gi lo ma'am gzhong pa lta bus bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gzhi rtsi shing gi lo ma'am gzhong pa lta bus bya ste /
translated: The base of the alms bowl should be made of a tree leaf or a plate.

original: de'i 'og nas lag pas bzung na kha zas lhung bzed kyi nang du blugs kyang rung gzhi'i steng du blugs kyang rung byin len rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og nas lag pas bzung na kha zas lhung bzed kyi nang du blugs kyang rung gzhi'i steng du blugs kyang rung byin len rung ngo //
translated: If one holds it with one's hand from below, it is suitable to receive the gift whether one pours the food into the alms bowl or onto the base.

original: yal ga ni spre'u'i yul te de las de nas mi 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yal ga ni spre'u'i yul te de las de nas mi 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The branch is the domain of the monkeys, but it is not impossible to obtain from there.

original: spre'us shing tog lta bu byin na drung du 'ong du ni 'jigs kyi shing gi kha nas sbyin pa'i phyir bor ba la bdag gi snod dam lag pa bzed de blangs pa'ang byin len du chud de rung ngo //
analyzed: spre'us shing tog lta bu byin na drung du 'ong du ni 'jigs kyi shing gi kha nas sbyin pa'i phyir bor ba la bdag gi snod dam lag pa bzed de blangs pa'ang byin len du chud de rung ngo //
translated: If a monkey, for example, gives fruit, it is not right to approach it out of fear. But if one throws down a vessel or one's hand, and the monkey puts the fruit in it, that is proper acceptance.

original: 'bras bu khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhis byin len bzed na mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhis byin len bzed na mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one accepts fruit in a basket, a tray, a bag, or a begging bowl, that is not improper.

original: 'bras bu dang tshod ma rtog cing sel ba lta bu la khri'u dang khri dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi shing gi lo ma 'am gzhong ba lta bu'i 'og nas bzung ste byin len du byas pa'ang /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang tshod ma rtog cing sel ba lta bu la khri'u dang khri dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi shing gi lo ma 'am gzhong ba lta bu'i 'og nas bzung ste byin len du byas pa'ang /
translated: If one is offered fruit or vegetables, and one picks them up with a tray, a basket, a bag, or a begging bowl, and one accepts them under a leaf or in a dish,

original: byin len du chud de rung ngo //
analyzed: byin len du chud de rung ngo //
translated: that is proper acceptance.

original: gnas pas de la brtag pa na mi smra bas na'o //
analyzed: gnas pas de la brtag pa na mi smra bas na'o //
translated: If one is in a place where there are no people, and one does not speak, one should examine the situation.

original: gnas bca' ba'i dge slong gzhon nu rnams kyis kha zas dang tshod ma rtog cing sel ba'i tshe mchil ma'i zer mas mi reg pa dang sems mi 'phyar cing gcig tu bsdu ba'i phyir gtam la sogs pa mi bya bar las bya'o //ğŸ”½snyoms par rims shig ces 'drim pa la bsgo//
analyzed: gnas bca' ba'i dge slong gzhon nu rnams kyis kha zas dang tshod ma rtog cing sel ba'i tshe mchil ma'i zer mas mi reg pa dang sems mi 'phyar cing gcig tu bsdu ba'i phyir gtam la sogs pa mi bya bar las bya'o // snyoms par rims shig ces 'drim pa la bsgo//
translated: When the food is being served, one should not say, Serve more to me, or Serve less to him.ğŸ”½ When the food is being served, one should not say, Serve more to me, or Serve less to him.ğŸ”½ When the food is being served, one should not say, Serve more to me, or Serve less to him.ğŸ”½ When the food is being served, one should not say, Serve more to me, or Serve less to him.

original: kha zas 'drim pa'i tshe kun la che chung ma khyer zhing mnyam par thob bar bya ba'i phyir gral dbon dang tho ngan gyis 'drim pa la snyoms bar brims shig ces bsgo //ğŸ”½dge slong gis byin blangs te blims na rigs so //
analyzed: kha zas 'drim pa'i tshe kun la che chung ma khyer zhing mnyam par thob bar bya ba'i phyir gral dbon dang tho ngan gyis 'drim pa la snyoms bar brims shig ces bsgo // dge slong gis byin blangs te blims na rigs so //

original: dge slong gis zan 'drim na yang dge slong 'dri ma ba de nyid kyis tshal bzhin @150b du byin len byas te brims na dge slong kun gyis byin len bya mi dgos kyi des byin len byas pas chog ste brim du rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis zan 'drim na yang dge slong 'dri ma ba de nyid kyis tshal bzhin @150b du byin len byas te brims na dge slong kun gyis byin len bya mi dgos kyi des byin len byas pas chog ste brim du rung ngo //
translated: When the food is being served, one should not say, Serve more to me, or Serve less to him.ğŸ”½ When the food is being served

original: mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram rdza mar 'drim na rtsa dang 'dab ma la stsogs pas gos bca' ba'i phyir glan /
analyzed: mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram rdza mar 'drim na rtsa dang 'dab ma la stsogs pas gos bca' ba'i phyir glan /
translated: If butter, mustard seed oil, honey and molasses are distributed in earthenware jars, they should be covered with stalks, leaves and so forth in order to protect the robes.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig dge slong gis byin len byas te brim na kha zas kyi zer ma dang snod spyad gos la mi reg par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi gos la phyar ba'am lo ma la sogs pas gzan bya ba'am snod kyi zhabs
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig dge slong gis byin len byas te brim na kha zas kyi zer ma dang snod spyad gos la mi reg par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi gos la phyar ba'am lo ma la sogs pas gzan bya ba'am snod kyi zhabs
translated: If a monk distributes these mentioned by name, he should cover his own robes with stalks, leaves and so forth in order to protect the robes from the dregs of food and from contact with vessels and so on.

original: la lo mas gzan bya ste brim mo //
analyzed: la lo mas gzan bya ste brim mo //
translated: Or he should cover the base of the vessel with leaves and distribute the food.

original: 'drim na thu bo dang tha chungs so sor bya ste'o //
analyzed: 'drim na thu bo dang tha chungs so sor bya ste'o //
translated: If he distributes the food, he should do so separately to the eldest and youngest.

original: shing tog la sogs pa zhim pa dang che chung zhig 'dres par 'drim na snyoms par bya pa'i phyir che chung so sor phye la chen pos bzang po las kyang mnyam par brim chung du dang ngan pa las kyang mnyam par brim mo //
analyzed: shing tog la sogs pa zhim pa dang che chung zhig 'dres par 'drim na snyoms par bya pa'i phyir che chung so sor phye la chen pos bzang po las kyang mnyam par brim chung du dang ngan pa las kyang mnyam par brim mo //
translated: If delicious fruits and so on are distributed mixed with large and small fruits, he should separate the large and small fruits in order to make them equal and distribute the good fruits equally from the large and the bad fruits equally from the small.

original: skyur rtsi zhim po so sor byas te brim /
analyzed: skyur rtsi zhim po so sor byas te brim /
translated: He should distribute the delicious sour fruits separately.

original: skyur rtsi lta bu la zhim po yod na so sor phye ste zhim po las kyang mnyam par brim /
analyzed: skyur rtsi lta bu la zhim po yod na so sor phye ste zhim po las kyang mnyam par brim /
translated: If there is something tasty, such as a sour fruit, distribute it equally, even from the tasty.

original: mi zhim pa las kyang mnyam par brin /
analyzed: mi zhim pa las kyang mnyam par brin /
translated: Also distribute it equally, even from the unappetizing.

original: de bzhin du kha zas zhim pa 'drim pa'i kun la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha zas zhim pa 'drim pa'i kun la bya'o //
translated: In the same way, do it for all who distribute tasty food.ğŸ”½The preceptor and the master of ceremonies should take it.

original: 'drim pa'i slob dpon dang mkhan pos longs shig / dge 'dun la kha zas 'dri ma ba'i dge slong de'i zan skal mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis byin len byas te mnod do //
analyzed: 'drim pa'i slob dpon dang mkhan pos longs shig / dge 'dun la kha zas 'dri ma ba'i dge slong de'i zan skal mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis byin len byas te mnod do //
translated: The preceptor or the master of ceremonies should take the share of food of the monk who is distributing food to the Saá¹…gha and give it to him.

original: mi 'thob pa thob pa de ma thag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa thob pa de ma thag pa'i gnas so //
translated: The place immediately after obtaining what was not obtained.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon med dam gral mthon dman khyer te blang du mi bden 'drim pa'i gral gar bab pa'i ltag 'og na dge slong su 'dug pas byin len byas te zan mnod do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mkhan po dang slob dpon med dam gral mthon dman khyer te blang du mi bden 'drim pa'i gral gar bab pa'i ltag 'og na dge slong su 'dug pas byin len byas te zan mnod do //
translated: Like the last verse, if there is no preceptor or master of ceremonies, or if it is uncomfortable to take it carrying the high and low rows, the monk who is in the row of distribution, whether above or below, should take it after taking the vow.

original: du ma'i ci tsam stan ma btang bar len nus pa'o //
analyzed: du ma'i ci tsam stan ma btang bar len nus pa'o //
translated: As much as one is able to take without moving the seat.

original: bdag gi gral ltag 'og nas dge slong ma'i zhig zan 'drim du dong ngam ma tshang ste zan skal nod na stan las ldang mi dgos shing ci tsam nus pa'i zan skal mnod do //
analyzed: bdag gi gral ltag 'og nas dge slong ma'i zhig zan 'drim du dong ngam ma tshang ste zan skal nod na stan las ldang mi dgos shing ci tsam nus pa'i zan skal mnod do //
translated: If a nun is serving food from the top or bottom of the row, or if she is distributing food portions, you do not need to get up. You may take as much food as you can.

original: bdag gis mnod par lag gis mi khyab pa ni ma mnos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: bdag gis mnod par lag gis mi khyab pa ni ma mnos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If you are unable to take food with your hands, you do not need to take any, and there is no offense.

original: 'dril ba gnas ma btang bar rang gis blang nus na byin len mi zhig go //
analyzed: 'dril ba gnas ma btang bar rang gis blang nus na byin len mi zhig go //
translated: If you are able to take the food yourself, without using a bowl or a plate, you do not need to do the ritual of receiving food.

original: kha zas shig brims te /
analyzed: kha zas shig brims te /
translated: If food is being distributed,

original: bdag gi lag tu 'ongs te shog ba'am snod kyi steng nas 'dril ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gi lag tu 'ongs te shog ba'am snod kyi steng nas 'dril ba ni /
translated: and it comes into your hands, or if it is on a plate or a bowl,

original: bdag stan las 'phags mi dgos par lag gis slebs tshun chad du song ste blangs nas zos pa ni byin len mi zhig go //
analyzed: bdag stan las 'phags mi dgos par lag gis slebs tshun chad du song ste blangs nas zos pa ni byin len mi zhig go //
translated: you do not need to get up from your seat. You may go and take as much as you can reach with your hands. You do not need to do the ritual of receiving food.

original: stan las 'phags te blangs pa zhig zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: stan las 'phags te blangs pa zhig zos na nyes byas so //
translated: If you get up from your seat and eat the food, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbrang ma dang grog sbur @151a * //
analyzed: sbrang ma dang grog sbur @151a * //
translated: If it is touched by flies or ants,

original: gyis reg na yang ngo //
analyzed: gyis reg na yang ngo //
translated: it is the same.

original: bdag gi kha zas byin len byas zin pa las grog sbur gyis reg pa'ang byin len zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi kha zas byin len byas zin pa las grog sbur gyis reg pa'ang byin len zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If an ant touches food that has already been received, it is not necessary to receive it again.

original: dge slong gis ma btang bar gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis ma btang bar gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
translated: If a monk does not give it away, it is the same.

original: bdag gi kha zas byin len bya ba zin nas lag pas bzung zhing 'dug pa la gzhan gyis reg na'ang byin len zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi kha zas byin len bya ba zin nas lag pas bzung zhing 'dug pa la gzhan gyis reg na'ang byin len zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If another person touches food that has been received and is being held in the hand, it is not necessary to receive it again.

original: byi bas na zhig par byed /
analyzed: byi bas na zhig par byed /
translated: If a mouse chews on it, the food is spoiled.

original: byin len byas zin pa'i zas la bdag gis kyang ma bzung la /
analyzed: byin len byas zin pa'i zas la bdag gis kyang ma bzung la /
translated: If one does not hold food that has been received,

original: sems can byi ba tsam yan chad kyis reg na byin len zhig go //
analyzed: sems can byi ba tsam yan chad kyis reg na byin len zhig go //
translated: and an animal such as a mouse touches it, the food is spoiled.

original: de las zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: de las zos na nyes byas /
translated: If one eats it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byin blangs nas byin blangs pa'ang rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: byin blangs nas byin blangs pa'ang rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: It is not right to receive again that which has already been received.

original: / byin len byas zin pa las stan las 'phags sam /
analyzed: / byin len byas zin pa las stan las 'phags sam /
translated: If one gets up from the seat where one has received food,

original: gzhan gyis reg gam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis reg gam /
translated: or if another person touches it,

original: byin len byas sam ma byas the tshom za ba slar gdod yang /
analyzed: byin len byas sam ma byas the tshom za ba slar gdod yang /
translated: or if one doubts whether or not it has been received,

original: byin len byas te zos pa'ang byin len byed du chud do //
analyzed: byin len byas te zos pa'ang byin len byed du chud do //
translated: one should receive it again.

original: 'bhrid / zas byin len ma byas par shes bzhin du zos pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig ma blangs pa las so //
analyzed: 'bhrid / zas byin len ma byas par shes bzhin du zos pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig ma blangs pa las so //
translated: If one eats knowingly food that has not been given to one, one commits an offense, except in the case of one condition.

original: zas byin len ma byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa te bza' ba'o //
analyzed: zas byin len ma byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa te bza' ba'o //
translated: If one eats food that has not been given to one, one commits an offense, except in the case of one condition: water and tooth cleaners.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te bza' ba rnam lnga dang / bca' ba rnam lnga la sogs pa kha zas ci yang rung zas las ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te bza' ba rnam lnga dang / bca' ba rnam lnga la sogs pa kha zas ci yang rung zas las ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Except for water and tooth cleaners, one commits an offense for any food that is eaten, whether it is the five kinds of food that are chewed and consumed, the five kinds of food that are chewed but not consumed, and so on.

original: yan lag gcig khar bza' ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag gcig khar bza' ba'o //
translated: One commits an offense for eating one morsel.

original: lus la byug pa dang snar blugs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lus la byug pa dang snar blugs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that one commits an offense for anointing the body or for using a nasal medication.

original: khar bza' ba las ltung ste /
analyzed: khar bza' ba las ltung ste /
translated: One commits an offense for eating food.

original: yan lag gcig byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gcig byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ma yin no //
translated: One commits an offense for eating one morsel, except in Kuru.

original: pa'o // byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi zas ni bdag gi dang 'dra bas byin lan bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: pa'o // byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi zas ni bdag gi dang 'dra bas byin lan bya mi dgos te /
translated: In Kuru, one does not commit an offense for eating food that has not been given to one, because the food there belongs to everyone.

original: byang gi smra mi snyan gyi zas kyang ma yin pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: byang gi smra mi snyan gyi zas kyang ma yin pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one has all these limbs, there is a downfall.ğŸ”½If a patient is not fully recovered, he should be fed.

original: nad pa rab tu ma rdzogs pas bsnyod na long shig / nad pa byin len byed mi bod pa ni khyim pa dang dge sbyong lta bus zan bsnyod de /
analyzed: nad pa rab tu ma rdzogs pas bsnyod na long shig / nad pa byin len byed mi bod pa ni khyim pa dang dge sbyong lta bus zan bsnyod de /
translated: If a patient is not able to do the receiving, a layperson or a renunciate should feed him.

original: zos pa ni nyes par mi 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: zos pa ni nyes par mi 'gyur gyis /
translated: If he eats, there is no offense.

original: yong shig rab tu rdzogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: yong shig rab tu rdzogs pa med na'o //
translated: If he is not fully recovered, he should be fed.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bsnyod pa nyes med pa ni dge slong med pa na blangs te zos kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar khyim pa dang dge sbyong gis bsnyod pa nyes med pa ni dge slong med pa na blangs te zos kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If there are no monks, a renunciate may feed a patient.ğŸ”½If he is not fully recovered, he should be fed.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pas kyang bsnyod cig / nad pa la zan bsnyod pa dge slong med na dge sbyong gis kyang stobs shig bsnyod cig nyes med do //ğŸ”½byin pa ma blangs pa @151b zos pa'i 'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pas kyang bsnyod cig / nad pa la zan bsnyod pa dge slong med na dge sbyong gis kyang stobs shig bsnyod cig nyes med do // byin pa ma blangs pa @151b zos pa'i 'o //
translated: If there are no monks, a renunciate may feed a patient.

original: byin len ma byas par zos pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par zos pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of eating without receiving is complete.

original: // / bzang po'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bzang po'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The Bhadanta explains that it is a downfall to eat good food.

original: 'o ma zho mar gsar pa nya sha sha skam 'di dag ni zas bsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma zho mar gsar pa nya sha sha skam 'di dag ni zas bsod pa'o //
translated: Milk, yogurt, fresh butter, fish, and meat are good foods.

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa dang // nya la sogs pa chu'i nang na gnas pa bzar rung ngo cog dang 'di rnams ni zas so cog gi nang du bsod cing bza' ba'i mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa dang // nya la sogs pa chu'i nang na gnas pa bzar rung ngo cog dang 'di rnams ni zas so cog gi nang du bsod cing bza' ba'i mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Milk, yogurt, fresh butter, fish, and so on, which are suitable to be eaten in the water, are the best of all suitable foods.

original: de las byed do //
analyzed: de las byed do //
translated: It is a downfall to eat them.ğŸ”½From among the good foods mentioned in the sutras,

original: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang na smos pa'i kha zas bzang po de rnams las gag kyang rung /ğŸ”½bslangs pa las ltung ste /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang na smos pa'i kha zas bzang po de rnams las gag kyang rung / bslangs pa las ltung ste /
translated: it is a downfall to eat any that you have requested.

original: yan lag gcig gnyen ma yin pa dang // khyim pa sbyin bdag na'o //

analyzed: rdzing bu dang mtshe'u'i nang na sems can yod bzhin du @153a * //
