analyzed: sbyin pa zag snod kyi steng nam mkha' la gnas pa btsags pa'i chu gtor ba'i snod tshags sbyar ba'i phyir ltar ltang po gsum la lcags kyi gzer bu bde ltar gsungs so //
translated: The strainer for the water offering is like a wooden trough with three holes in which iron pegs are inserted.

original: shing spyi sprod kyi chags ni chu snod 'og tu bzhag la de'i steng nam mkha' la chu tshags dpyongs te chu tshags kha las srad bus btags te srad bu'i thog ma shing ltang ltang po gsum gyi rked pa tsam du yang mig byas la yang mig las gdags
analyzed: shing spyi sprod kyi chags ni chu snod 'og tu bzhag la de'i steng nam mkha' la chu tshags dpyongs te chu tshags kha las srad bus btags te srad bu'i thog ma shing ltang ltang po gsum gyi rked pa tsam du yang mig byas la yang mig las gdags
translated: The wooden strainer is placed under the water vessel. The strainer is suspended in the air above it. The end of the strainer is tied to the wooden trough with a rope. The rope is tied to the wooden trough at the level of the three holes.

original: shing ltang ltang po gsum spyi sprod du byas te lcags sgyeng ltar btsugs la chu btsag go //
analyzed: shing ltang ltang po gsum spyi sprod du byas te lcags sgyeng ltar btsugs la chu btsag go //
translated: The three wooden troughs are placed together and are fixed like iron pegs. The water is strained.

original: chu tshags la chu gnas pa'i phyir gding ba bya /
analyzed: chu tshags la chu gnas pa'i phyir gding ba bya /
translated: The strainer is made firm so that the water remains in it.

original: chu tshags kyi zhabs su chu 'chags shing sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir nang du mig tshags blugs /
analyzed: chu tshags kyi zhabs su chu 'chags shing sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir nang du mig tshags blugs /
translated: At the bottom of the water strainer, a piece of cloth is to be placed in order to prevent the death of small animals.

original: bye ma'am lci bas so //
analyzed: bye ma'am lci bas so //
translated: It is filled with sand or ashes.

original: chu tshags kyi nang du blugs pa ni bye ma'am lci ba phur te blugs /
analyzed: chu tshags kyi nang du blugs pa ni bye ma'am lci ba phur te blugs /
translated: It is filled with sand or ashes, having first made a hole in the bottom of the water strainer.

original: 'dzin pa'i lhung bzed kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i lhung bzed kyis kyang ngo //
translated: Or with a water strainer that is held.

original: sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir chu tshags kyi zhabs su chu tshags par bya ba'i phyir chu chags kyi zhabs snod gcig gi nang du gzhug tu 'ang rung ngo //ğŸ”½kham pa'am zangs gag kyang rung bas so //
analyzed: sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir chu tshags kyi zhabs su chu tshags par bya ba'i phyir chu chags kyi zhabs snod gcig gi nang du gzhug tu 'ang rung ngo // kham pa'am zangs gag kyang rung bas so //
translated: Or it is filled with a vessel placed at the bottom of the water strainer, in order to prevent the death of small animals.ğŸ”½With a vessel of clay or copper.

original: snod ni kham la'am zangs gag kyang rung pas so //
analyzed: snod ni kham la'am zangs gag kyang rung pas so //
translated: With a vessel of clay or copper.

original: las byas te chu tshags kyi zhabs de nang du gzhug go //
analyzed: las byas te chu tshags kyi zhabs de nang du gzhug go //
translated: Having made a hole in the bottom of the water strainer, it is placed inside.

original: ltang ltang po gsum gyi yul de bcings /
analyzed: ltang ltang po gsum gyi yul de bcings /
translated: The country of the three baskets is bound.

original: chu tshags kyi zhabs gzhug pa'i snod de yang shing spyi sprod gsum gyi rked pa la btags te @153b chu tshags kyi zhabs de'i nang du bcug la 'chang du gzhug / bu gu las bzung /
analyzed: chu tshags kyi zhabs gzhug pa'i snod de yang shing spyi sprod gsum gyi rked pa la btags te @153b chu tshags kyi zhabs de'i nang du bcug la 'chang du gzhug / bu gu las bzung /
translated: The base of the water strainer is attached to the middle of the three sticks used for carrying it, and the base of the water strainer is inserted into that.

original: snod 'phyang du gzhug pa de kha la bu gu phug ste bu gu las gdags so //
analyzed: snod 'phyang du gzhug pa de kha la bu gu phug ste bu gu las gdags so //
translated: The opening of the container that hangs down is pierced with a hole and is attached to the base.

original: snga ma na skud pas so / snod de kham pa las byas na bu gu las gdags pa thag bu las bya /
analyzed: snga ma na skud pas so / snod de kham pa las byas na bu gu las gdags pa thag bu las bya /
translated: In the former case, it is attached with a string. If the container is made of clay, the attachment to the hole is made of string.

original: phyi ma nas lcags thag phra mos so ;
analyzed: phyi ma nas lcags thag phra mos so ;
translated: In the latter case, it is made of a thin iron chain.

original: / snod de zangs la byas na bu gu las gdags pa lcags thag phre'us bya'o //
analyzed: / snod de zangs la byas na bu gu las gdags pa lcags thag phre'us bya'o //
translated: If the container is made of copper, the attachment to the hole is made of a thin iron chain.

original: de bcang / kham pa dang zangs las byas pa'i snod de bcangs kyang nyes med de /
analyzed: de bcang / kham pa dang zangs las byas pa'i snod de bcangs kyang nyes med de /
translated: If you carry that container, there is no fault.

original: chu mi ster na leb leb pos yang yang du'o //
analyzed: chu mi ster na leb leb pos yang yang du'o //
translated: If the water does not flow, it is done again and again with a flat stone.

original: chu tshags thags bzang ste chu yong du mi btub na shing leb leb pos chu ma thor ba tsam du mi drag par ngos la brdab /
analyzed: chu tshags thags bzang ste chu yong du mi btub na shing leb leb pos chu ma thor ba tsam du mi drag par ngos la brdab /
translated: If the water strainer is not good at filtering the water, the water is not poured forcefully onto the cloth, but is poured onto the side of the cloth with a flat stone, just enough to prevent the water from flowing.

original: chu tshags la brdeg / gong ma ltar chu tshags zag tu ma btub na tshags kyi kha la'ang brdeg cing bsig / gce tshags na gron chung ngo //
analyzed: chu tshags la brdeg / gong ma ltar chu tshags zag tu ma btub na tshags kyi kha la'ang brdeg cing bsig / gce tshags na gron chung ngo //
translated: If the water strainer is not able to filter water in the way described above, then it is also permissible to filter it through the mouth of the strainer.

original: chu btsags pa'i phyir zangs kyi zhabs bu gu seng seng por 'dug pa byas shing bcangs na las chung zhing gron chung ste sla'o //
analyzed: chu btsags pa'i phyir zangs kyi zhabs bu gu seng seng por 'dug pa byas shing bcangs na las chung zhing gron chung ste sla'o //
translated: If you make the base of a copper pot with a hole in it, and use it to filter water, it will be less work and less expensive.

original: de bcang chu btsags pa'i tshags zangs gce tshags bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: de bcang chu btsags pa'i tshags zangs gce tshags bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If you use a copper pot with a hole in the base to filter water, there is no problem.

original: kham pa'ang zangs las so //
analyzed: kham pa'ang zangs las so //
translated: A copper pot is also suitable.

original: gce tshags zhes byas pa ni kham pa'am zangs gag las byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: gce tshags zhes byas pa ni kham pa'am zangs gag las byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: A copper pot with a hole in the base is called a â€œcopper pot with a hole.â€ It can be made of clay or copper.ğŸ”½It is like a pot with a base that has a hole in it.

original: de rdza ma 'dra ba'i zhabs su sdu bu can nang du pad mo 'dra /
analyzed: de rdza ma 'dra ba'i zhabs su sdu bu can nang du pad mo 'dra /
translated: It has a hole in the base that is like a lotus.

original: bu gu can no //
analyzed: bu gu can no //
translated: It has a hole.

original: gce tshags bya ba ni rdza ma'am zangs 'dra bar byas la zhabs kyi nang du 'bur 'bur po pad mo'i snying po 'dra bar byas la de'i 'og gi nang khong stong spu bu can bya ste de la sbu bu seng seng por byas la gdod /
analyzed: gce tshags bya ba ni rdza ma'am zangs 'dra bar byas la zhabs kyi nang du 'bur 'bur po pad mo'i snying po 'dra bar byas la de'i 'og gi nang khong stong spu bu can bya ste de la sbu bu seng seng por byas la gdod /
translated: The so-called â€œstrainerâ€ is made like a pot or a copper pot. Make the bottom of it with holes like the heart of a lotus. Make the inside of it hollow with holes. Make the holes in it with a hole-maker.

original: ras mas de dag go //
analyzed: ras mas de dag go //
translated: Cover them with cloth.

original: 'bur 'bur por bu gu gdod pa de la ras mas g-yogs te 'bur 'bur po'i drung sra mor thag bus bcings la snod de'i nang du chu blugs la btsags na sems can mi shor /
analyzed: 'bur 'bur por bu gu gdod pa de la ras mas g-yogs te 'bur 'bur po'i drung sra mor thag bus bcings la snod de'i nang du chu blugs la btsags na sems can mi shor /
translated: Cover the holes with cloth. Tie the cloth tightly to the holes with a rope. If you pour water into that container and strain it, the sentient beings will not escape.ğŸ”½â€œKeep the water strainer.â€

original: chu tshags zhog shig / ltag tu chu tshags rnams gnyis smos pa ma gtogs par chu tshags gzhan bcangs kyang nyes med de 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: chu tshags zhog shig / ltag tu chu tshags rnams gnyis smos pa ma gtogs par chu tshags gzhan bcangs kyang nyes med de 'og nas 'chad /
translated: Except for the two mentioned above, it is also faultless to carry other strainers, as will be explained below.

original: tshags sam / chu chags tha mal pa drug pa dang chos kyi snod pa'am /
analyzed: tshags sam / chu chags tha mal pa drug pa dang chos kyi snod pa'am /
translated: â€œStrainerâ€ or â€œwater strainerâ€ is a common word for a Dharma container.

original: kun de dang 'dra ba la khar yang bu gu gdod zhabs su yang cher gdod de zhabs kyi bu gu chen por chu tshags kyis glan pa dang / gtang ba'i leb leb po /
analyzed: kun de dang 'dra ba la khar yang bu gu gdod zhabs su yang cher gdod de zhabs kyi bu gu chen por chu tshags kyis glan pa dang / gtang ba'i leb leb po /
translated: The mouth of the water strainer should be as wide as the opening of the begging bowl, and the base should be as wide as the palm of the hand.ğŸ”½The strainer should be made of two layers of thin cloth, and the edges should be sewn together.

original: ras leb leb po chu'i nang du bcug ste bkram la slar bsdus te @154a * //
analyzed: ras leb leb po chu'i nang du bcug ste bkram la slar bsdus te @154a * //
translated: When the strainer is put into the water, it should be spread out and then gathered up.ğŸ”½If it is pressed with the hand, it will not harm living beings.

original: snod kyi nang du btsir na yang sems can mi chags ste 'di gsum gang bcangs kyang rung /ğŸ”½brtags pa chu khyer ram 'grub bam snod dang spyi lugs de dag tu'o //
analyzed: snod kyi nang du btsir na yang sems can mi chags ste 'di gsum gang bcangs kyang rung / brtags pa chu khyer ram 'grub bam snod dang spyi lugs de dag tu'o //
translated: It is sufficient to carry any of these three strainers.ğŸ”½If one does not have a water strainer, it is permissible to carry water in a container that has been examined, or in a water-tight bag or a water-tight vessel.ğŸ”½If one does not have a water strainer, it is permissible to carry water in a container that has been examined, or in a water-tight bag or a water-tight vessel.

original: gud du 'gro ste chu tshags med kyang sla ba ni chu btsags shing brtags zin pa ril ba'am snod du blugs te khyer bas lcogs pa tsam gyi tshod na nyes med /
analyzed: gud du 'gro ste chu tshags med kyang sla ba ni chu btsags shing brtags zin pa ril ba'am snod du blugs te khyer bas lcogs pa tsam gyi tshod na nyes med /
translated: If one does not have a water strainer, it is permissible to carry water in a container that has been examined, or in a water-tight bag or a water-tight vessel.

original: de dag med par yul rgyu bar mi spyad /
analyzed: de dag med par yul rgyu bar mi spyad /
translated: One should not travel with an enemy.ğŸ”½One should not travel without a water strainer.

original: chu tshags dang kun de med par yul rgyu bar mi spyad /ğŸ”½'khon pa dang lhan cig tu ma yin /
analyzed: chu tshags dang kun de med par yul rgyu bar mi spyad /ğŸ”½'khon pa dang lhan cig tu ma yin /
translated: One should not travel without a water strainer.

original: bdag la chu tshags med la 'khon yod pa la chu tshags yod na lhan cig tu yul rgyu bar mi spyad de brnyar mi ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chu tshags med la 'khon yod pa la chu tshags yod na lhan cig tu yul rgyu bar mi spyad de brnyar mi ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If I have no water strainer and the other has one, I will not travel with him, for I will not be able to endure his contempt.

original: 'on te de 'dra ba'i rkyen gcig na bzod nas so //
analyzed: 'on te de 'dra ba'i rkyen gcig na bzod nas so //
translated: But if I can endure such contempt, I will travel with him.

original: 'khon yod pa dang mi 'grogs su mi rung ba'i rkyen gcig yod na bzod par gsol te chu tshags la sogs pa brnya bar snga nas dam bcas la 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'khon yod pa dang mi 'grogs su mi rung ba'i rkyen gcig yod na bzod par gsol te chu tshags la sogs pa brnya bar snga nas dam bcas la 'gro'o //
translated: If there is a reason for not traveling with one who has contempt, I will ask his forgiveness, and if he has a water strainer, I will promise to borrow it.

original: bya bar yod na yod pa'o //ğŸ”½bdag la chu tshags yod pa ni gud na yod pa la mi bya'i lag na spyad du yod pa dang bdag nyid kyi lag na spyad du med kyang brnyas sam /
analyzed: bya bar yod na yod pa'o // bdag la chu tshags yod pa ni gud na yod pa la mi bya'i lag na spyad du yod pa dang bdag nyid kyi lag na spyad du med kyang brnyas sam /
translated: If I have a water strainer, I will travel with him.ğŸ”½If I have no water strainer, I will travel with him if he has one, but not if he has none.

original: thun mong du spyad du yod na bdag la yod pa dang 'dra ste nyes med /
analyzed: thun mong du spyad du yod na bdag la yod pa dang 'dra ste nyes med /
translated: If I have no water strainer, but he has one, I will travel with him if he is willing to share it, but not if he is not.

original: de bas na gzhan gyis sbyin par khas blangs na de bzhin /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyis sbyin par khas blangs na de bzhin /
translated: Therefore, if he promises to give it to me, I will travel with him.

original: gud du 'gro ste grogs chu chags yod pa la lam na thun mong du spyad cing brnya bar thams te sbyin par khas blangs na bdag la yod pa dang 'dra ste nyes med /
analyzed: gud du 'gro ste grogs chu chags yod pa la lam na thun mong du spyad cing brnya bar thams te sbyin par khas blangs na bdag la yod pa dang 'dra ste nyes med /
translated: If one promises to give to a companion who has a water-carrier and who is going elsewhere, and who is using the water in common, and who is carrying it, then there is no fault, as if it were one's own.

original: 'bral te sbyin par khas ma blangs na yul rgyur spyad cing mi brten /
analyzed: 'bral te sbyin par khas ma blangs na yul rgyur spyad cing mi brten /
translated: If one does not promise to give to a companion who is going elsewhere, one should not use the water or carry it.

original: gud du 'gro ba'i grogs chu tshags yod pa de lam nas so sor bral lam brnyar mi ster na chu tshags med pa yin te song na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gud du 'gro ba'i grogs chu tshags yod pa de lam nas so sor bral lam brnyar mi ster na chu tshags med pa yin te song na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not give the water to a companion who has a water-carrier and who is going elsewhere, and who is separated from it or who is not carrying it, then there is no fault if one has no water-carrier. If one goes, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi 'phags par byed cing rab tu spyod pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phags par byed cing rab tu spyod pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: To make it not noble and to use it is to use it.

original: gud du 'gro ste pha rol gyi gnas su phyin tshun chad chu spyad mi dgos par 'gro ba'i lam du song ba ni chu tshags med kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gud du 'gro ste pha rol gyi gnas su phyin tshun chad chu spyad mi dgos par 'gro ba'i lam du song ba ni chu tshags med kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one goes to a place where one can go without using water, then there is no fault even if one has no water-carrier.

original: rgyang grags lngar ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyang grags lngar ni de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for five kroÅ›as.

original: rgyang grags lnga'i bar du chu spyad mi dgos na yang chu tshags med par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: rgyang grags lnga'i bar du chu spyad mi dgos na yang chu tshags med par song yang nyes med do //
translated: If one can go without using water for five kroÅ›as, then there is no fault even if one goes without a water-carrier.

original: bzhag ste gnas su song pa la der de med na rang nyams ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bzhag ste gnas su song pa la der de med na rang nyams ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is not there, it is not a personal loss.

original: gud du 'gro ste pha rol gyi gnas su chu tshags rnyed pa'i gdeng med par bzhag ste song ba ni nyams rangs dang le lo yin te nyes byas so //
analyzed: gud du 'gro ste pha rol gyi gnas su chu tshags rnyed pa'i gdeng med par bzhag ste song ba ni nyams rangs dang le lo yin te nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes elsewhere, to the dwelling of another, and leaves the water strainer there without the confidence that it will be found, it is a personal loss and laziness, and is a minor offense.

original: @154b gnas der chu tshags brnyar rnyed dam yon tan dang ldan pa dag gcig ste chu btsags shing rtog pa zhig ste chu tshags bskur mi dgos pa'i gded yod na ma khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: @154b gnas der chu tshags brnyar rnyed dam yon tan dang ldan pa dag gcig ste chu btsags shing rtog pa zhig ste chu tshags bskur mi dgos pa'i gded yod na ma khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If one finds the water strainer in that place, or if there is someone there who has good qualities, who searches for the water strainer, and who has the confidence that it will be found, and one does not take it, there is no offense.

original: gcig cig gi du ma la de bzhin du 'grub ste dge 'dun gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: gcig cig gi du ma la de bzhin du 'grub ste dge 'dun gyi bar du'o //
translated: If there is one person who has a water strainer, it is established that way up to the Sangha.

original: gud du 'dong ste gcig la chu tshags yod de brnyar rnyed cing kun gyis spyad du yod na ni dge 'dun langs shing mi du yod kyang rung gzhan ma khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: gud du 'dong ste gcig la chu tshags yod de brnyar rnyed cing kun gyis spyad du yod na ni dge 'dun langs shing mi du yod kyang rung gzhan ma khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If one goes elsewhere, and if there is one person there who has a water strainer and who uses it for everyone, then even if one does not take it, there is no offense, no matter how many people are in the Sangha.

original: rgyun mgyogs pa ni mi 'phangs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mgyogs pa ni mi 'phangs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: A fast current does not make one lose it.

original: phu chu drag por 'bab pa la srin bu med ces te chu tshags bzhag pa'am med par bya ba ma yin gyi bskur dgos so //
analyzed: phu chu drag por 'bab pa la srin bu med ces te chu tshags bzhag pa'am med par bya ba ma yin gyi bskur dgos so //
translated: It is not that there are no insects in the water of a mountain stream that is flowing rapidly. One should not leave the water strainer behind or discard it, but carry it with one.

original: brtags pa de dang 'bab rgyun du lhag cig tu 'grogs na rgyang grags kyi bar du 'jug par gyis shig / chu bang ba mgyogs bul bdag dang mnyam na gang du bcus ste chu brtags pa der rtsi shing ngam gcig bor te mtshan ma btsugs la rgyang grags
analyzed: brtags pa de dang 'bab rgyun du lhag cig tu 'grogs na rgyang grags kyi bar du 'jug par gyis shig / chu bang ba mgyogs bul bdag dang mnyam na gang du bcus ste chu brtags pa der rtsi shing ngam gcig bor te mtshan ma btsugs la rgyang grags
translated: If the water is mixed with the examined water and flows together with the stream, one should let it flow for the distance of a krosa. If the water in the reservoir is flowing faster or slower than one's own pace, one should examine the water at the place where one fills the water.

original: gcig tshun chad du mtshan ma de'i 'khor du bcus pa ni brtags mi dgos te spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig tshun chad du mtshan ma de'i 'khor du bcus pa ni brtags mi dgos te spyad du rung ngo //
translated: If one fills the water in the vicinity of the sign of a plant or a stone that was set up as a landmark, one does not need to examine it for a krosa, but it is suitable to use it.

original: chu de'i bar du 'dres na de tshun chad do //
analyzed: chu de'i bar du 'dres na de tshun chad do //
translated: If the water is mixed with that water, it is suitable to use it up to that point.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mtshan ma btsugs te rgyang grags gcig tshun chad du brtags mi dgos pa kun nas chu gzhan zhig byung ste 'dres na rgyang grags gcig gi tshad du mi bya'i /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar mtshan ma btsugs te rgyang grags gcig tshun chad du brtags mi dgos pa kun nas chu gzhan zhig byung ste 'dres na rgyang grags gcig gi tshad du mi bya'i /
translated: If another water source appears and mixes with it, one should not take the measure of a krosa, but examine it for a krosa.

original: gang du 'dres pa de tshun chad brtags mi dgos so //
analyzed: gang du 'dres pa de tshun chad brtags mi dgos so //
translated: When it is mixed, it is no longer necessary to examine it.

original: 'dom gang gi 'khor brtags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dom gang gi 'khor brtags pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the examination of a fathom.

original: khron pa dang mtshe'u la gang nas bcus te brtags pa'i 'dom gang tshun chod brtags mi dgos so //
analyzed: khron pa dang mtshe'u la gang nas bcus te brtags pa'i 'dom gang tshun chod brtags mi dgos so //
translated: When one examines a well or a pond, it is not necessary to examine the water beyond the fathom.

original: mig gis dag na chu'ang dag go //
analyzed: mig gis dag na chu'ang dag go //
translated: If the water is clear, the living beings are clear.

original: mig gis bltas te sems can ma mthong zhing mi snang na sems can gzugs phra mo bltar mi snang ba mi brtsi'i chu de sems can med cing dag pa'i tshad du brtsi'o //
analyzed: mig gis bltas te sems can ma mthong zhing mi snang na sems can gzugs phra mo bltar mi snang ba mi brtsi'i chu de sems can med cing dag pa'i tshad du brtsi'o //
translated: If, when one looks at the water with the eye, one does not see or perceive any living beings, one should not think that there are no living beings in the water, but that they are subtle and invisible.

original: tha mal pas so //
analyzed: tha mal pas so //
translated: By an ordinary person.

original: mig dag pa ni 'phrul gyi mig can la mi bya'i tha mal pa sha'i mig can no //
analyzed: mig dag pa ni 'phrul gyi mig can la mi bya'i tha mal pa sha'i mig can no //
translated: The eye that is clear is not the eye of the magician, but the ordinary eye of flesh.

original: dag pa'i tshad du brtsi ste dgra bcom pa dang 'phrul can gyi chu yang sha'i mig gis brtags pa'i tshad du brtsi ste spyad do //ğŸ”½mi g-yo rdul med par brtags //
analyzed: dag pa'i tshad du brtsi ste dgra bcom pa dang 'phrul can gyi chu yang sha'i mig gis brtags pa'i tshad du brtsi ste spyad do // mi g-yo rdul med par brtags //
translated: The measure of clarity is considered by the ordinary person. The water of the Arhat and the magician is also considered by the measure of the eye of flesh.ğŸ”½One examines it without agitation and without stirring up the mud.

original: chu blta ba ni rdul med cing mi g-yo bar 'dug pa la blta /
analyzed: chu blta ba ni rdul med cing mi g-yo bar 'dug pa la blta /
translated: When one looks at the water, one looks at it without stirring up the mud.

original: rdza ma gang ba yang ngo //
analyzed: rdza ma gang ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, the pot is full.ğŸ”½If the pot is full, it is all right to examine it all at once.

original: rdza ma gang zhig 'dug pa la ril gyis brtags kyang rung snod chung ngus logs shig @155a * //
analyzed: rdza ma gang zhig 'dug pa la ril gyis brtags kyang rung snod chung ngus logs shig @155a * //
translated: If it is a small container, then take out some of the contents and examine it.

original: tu bcus te brtags la de nas sems can med na kun brtags par chud /
analyzed: tu bcus te brtags la de nas sems can med na kun brtags par chud /
translated: If there are no living beings, then you should understand that it is empty.

original: 'das par bya bar gtogs pa 'dir spyad par mi bya /
analyzed: 'das par bya bar gtogs pa 'dir spyad par mi bya /
translated: You should not use what is to be examined here.ğŸ”½The measure of examining the water is as follows: Place a cart drawn by six oxen on a flat surface and turn it upside down.

original: chu blta ba'i tshad ni shing rta ba lang drug gis drangs pa gcig 'jug mal gcig na bzhag ste mgo bskor la thog ma bskor ba'i sar slar 'khod pa tsam gyi yun gyi srid du blta /
analyzed: chu blta ba'i tshad ni shing rta ba lang drug gis drangs pa gcig 'jug mal gcig na bzhag ste mgo bskor la thog ma bskor ba'i sar slar 'khod pa tsam gyi yun gyi srid du blta /
translated: The length of time is the time it takes to return to the starting point.

original: srog chags 'phro ba rtsvas bde bar bstan /
analyzed: srog chags 'phro ba rtsvas bde bar bstan /
translated: The movement of living beings is shown to be comfortable with grass.ğŸ”½Since the presence of worms in the water is not recognized by the dust, it is stirred up with the best grass and examined.

original: chu'i nang na srin bu yod pa rdul dang ngo mi shes pa'i phyir rtsva mchog gis bskul zhing brtag / gzhan la yang rtsva mchog gis bstan /
analyzed: chu'i nang na srin bu yod pa rdul dang ngo mi shes pa'i phyir rtsva mchog gis bskul zhing brtag / gzhan la yang rtsva mchog gis bstan /
translated: The best grass is also shown to others.

original: de dag myos pa'i lam du mi dor /
analyzed: de dag myos pa'i lam du mi dor /
translated: Those should not be thrown into a place of intoxication.

original: chu'i nang na sems can yod de slar bskyal ba'i tshe chu drag tu dbo ba la sogs pas sdangs pa dang snad pa dang myos par mi bya bar dal gyis dor /
analyzed: chu'i nang na sems can yod de slar bskyal ba'i tshe chu drag tu dbo ba la sogs pas sdangs pa dang snad pa dang myos par mi bya bar dal gyis dor /
translated: If there are living beings in the water, do not frighten or injure them or make them confused when you return and let the water out.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin /
translated: Do not do that to others.

original: shig dang 'ji ba la sogs pa sems can ci dor yang spangs shing snad par mi bya bar dal gyis dor /
analyzed: shig dang 'ji ba la sogs pa sems can ci dor yang spangs shing snad par mi bya bar dal gyis dor /
translated: Do not throw out living beings such as lice or clay, etc.

original: de ste me mar byed pa'i der srog chags ltung na de g-yogs /
analyzed: de ste me mar byed pa'i der srog chags ltung na de g-yogs /
translated: If a living being falls into a lamp, rescue it.

original: me mar gyi nang du sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir gyo mo la sogs pa leb leb po dbus su bu gu phug la de dgab /
analyzed: me mar gyi nang du sems can mi 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir gyo mo la sogs pa leb leb po dbus su bu gu phug la de dgab /
translated: In order to prevent the death of a living being in a lamp, make a hole in the middle of a flat piece of wood, etc. and cover it.

original: smyig ma'i tshal bu'i dra ba la ges dkar po'am lhang tsher gyis dkri bar de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal bu'i dra ba la ges dkar po'am lhang tsher gyis dkri bar de ltar gsungs so //
translated: It is said that you should wrap it with a white cloth or a piece of felt.

original: me mar dgab ba smyig ma'i tshal ba dra ba 'dra bar bres la ras phran nam shog shog gam lhang tsher gyis g-yogs pa'i khang bu phub kyang rung /
analyzed: me mar dgab ba smyig ma'i tshal ba dra ba 'dra bar bres la ras phran nam shog shog gam lhang tsher gyis g-yogs pa'i khang bu phub kyang rung /
translated: You can also cover the lamp with a piece of cloth, or make a small house with a piece of cloth, paper, or felt.

original: mig brgya pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mig brgya pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also said that you should make a hundred eyes.

original: me mar gyi steng du g-yogs pa kham pa la mig mang du gtsags pa'i khang bu phub kyang rung /
analyzed: me mar gyi steng du g-yogs pa kham pa la mig mang du gtsags pa'i khang bu phub kyang rung /
translated: It is suitable to build a hut with many windows in a clay pot covered on top of a butter lamp.

original: thog ma nas byas pa'am rdza ma la sogs pa'i gyo mo bu gu can no //
analyzed: thog ma nas byas pa'am rdza ma la sogs pa'i gyo mo bu gu can no //
translated: It is a clay pot with a hole, either made from the beginning or a broken clay pot, etc.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kham pa'i khang bu bya ba ni thog ma nas ched kar byas pa'ang rung phyis bu la 'phral du byas pa'ang rung /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar kham pa'i khang bu bya ba ni thog ma nas ched kar byas pa'ang rung phyis bu la 'phral du byas pa'ang rung /
translated: The so-called clay pot like the upper part of a sÅ«tra is either made from the beginning for that purpose or later made for a child.

original: skra'i zhags pas sprul mi bcing /
analyzed: skra'i zhags pas sprul mi bcing /
translated: Do not bind a snake with a rope of hair.

original: bdag gis gnas na sprul gdug pa 'dug na rtsva dang rtsid pa'i zhags pas bcings shing mi dor /
analyzed: bdag gis gnas na sprul gdug pa 'dug na rtsva dang rtsid pa'i zhags pas bcings shing mi dor /
translated: If a poisonous snake is in the place where one is staying, do not release it, but bind it with a rope of grass or wool.

original: se gol gyi sgra byas la bzang po'i bzhin mi snang ba'i lam du 'dug shig ces bya /
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra byas la bzang po'i bzhin mi snang ba'i lam du 'dug shig ces bya /
translated: Make the sound of snapping one's fingers and say, Good-looking one, stay in a place where I cannot see you.

original: sbrul gnas sam lam ka na 'dug na se gol brdab ste bzhin bzang mi snang bar gud du song zhes bya /
analyzed: sbrul gnas sam lam ka na 'dug na se gol brdab ste bzhin bzang mi snang bar gud du song zhes bya /
translated: If a snake is in one's dwelling or on the path, snap one's fingers and say, Good-looking one, go elsewhere without showing yourself.

original: mi 'dug na ra rkang gi dbyig pas dal gyis bum pa'am rdza ma'i nang du bcug la bu gu byas te kha @155b bcad la dbyung /
analyzed: mi 'dug na ra rkang gi dbyig pas dal gyis bum pa'am rdza ma'i nang du bcug la bu gu byas te kha @155b bcad la dbyung /
translated: If it does not stay there, then slowly insert it into a pot or a clay vessel with the stick of a goat's leg, make a hole, cover the opening, and remove it.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar byas te ma btub na dbyug pa'i mgo kha brag tu 'dug pas gnya' bar ma snang bar mnan la rdza ma'i nang du mi sub par bya ba'i phyir rdza ma'i kha khab la bu gu gtod de sbrul ga la 'dug pa'i gnas su
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar byas te ma btub na dbyug pa'i mgo kha brag tu 'dug pas gnya' bar ma snang bar mnan la rdza ma'i nang du mi sub par bya ba'i phyir rdza ma'i kha khab la bu gu gtod de sbrul ga la 'dug pa'i gnas su
translated: If one is unable to do it like the back of a sutra, then since the head of the stick is in a cleft, press it down so that it does not appear in the neck, and in order that it not be inserted into the clay vessel, make a hole in the mouth of the clay vessel with a needle and carry it to the place where the snake is.

original: bskyal / mi 'grub na rgya cang ngam lcag bod dam dra ba'am thag pa'i zhags par das dkris pas mgrin par bcing /
analyzed: bskyal / mi 'grub na rgya cang ngam lcag bod dam dra ba'am thag pa'i zhags par das dkris pas mgrin par bcing /
translated: If one is not successful, then tie it around the neck with a rope of cloth, leather, wool, or a net.

original: de dag gis gzhug par bsgo //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhug par bsgo //
translated: Meditate on inserting it with those.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rdza mar gzhug ma nus na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la ra da 'jam pos dkris te btang sla bar bya ba'i phyir 'grol mig tu mgrin par ma snad par btags la sprul gyi gnas su bal gyis dkri zhing btang ngo //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar rdza mar gzhug ma nus na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la ra da 'jam pos dkris te btang sla bar bya ba'i phyir 'grol mig tu mgrin par ma snad par btags la sprul gyi gnas su bal gyis dkri zhing btang ngo //
translated: If one is unable to insert it into the clay vessel like the back of a sutra, then in order to loosen it and make it easy to remove, tie it around the neck with a soft rope, and carry it to the place of the snake, wrapping it in wool.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi mgrin par bcings la rdza ma'i nang du gzhug cing bskyal du yang rung ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi mgrin par bcings la rdza ma'i nang du gzhug cing bskyal du yang rung ngo //
translated: It is also suitable to tie these mentioned by name around the neck and put them in a clay pot.

original: span spun ni mi dor /
analyzed: span spun ni mi dor /
translated: Do not discard the eggs.

original: sbrul bskyal ba yang gnas ma yin pa dang sban sbun sprul la gnod pa'i sar mi gzhag / tshang du zhugs kyi bar du bsdad /
analyzed: sbrul bskyal ba yang gnas ma yin pa dang sban sbun sprul la gnod pa'i sar mi gzhag / tshang du zhugs kyi bar du bsdad /
translated: Also, do not leave the eggs in an unsuitable place or in a place that will harm the eggs. Stay until the young hatch.

original: sbrul tshang du bskyal nas kyang sems can gzhan zhig gis mi zos par bya ba'i phyir tshang du song gi bar du bsdad /
analyzed: sbrul tshang du bskyal nas kyang sems can gzhan zhig gis mi zos par bya ba'i phyir tshang du song gi bar du bsdad /
translated: Even after taking the eggs to the nest, stay until the young have left the nest in order to prevent other animals from eating them.

original: shig ra da'i nang du gzhug / shig thang la bab col du mi dor bar ra da'i nang du gzhug / de'i gseb tu'o //
analyzed: shig ra da'i nang du gzhug / shig thang la bab col du mi dor bar ra da'i nang du gzhug / de'i gseb tu'o //
translated: Put the lice in a lice-box. Do not discard lice on the ground thoughtlessly, but put them in a lice-box.

original: shig bcug pa'i ra da yang bab col du mi dor bar rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug srin bu mang ku la sngon po la dor /
analyzed: shig bcug pa'i ra da yang bab col du mi dor bar rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug srin bu mang ku la sngon po la dor /
translated: Also, do not discard the lice-box thoughtlessly, but put it in a crack in a wall. Throw the bluebottle flies into a bluebottle fly trap.

original: srin bu mang ku na mi la za ba zhig yod de de yang bab col du mi dor bar rtsva sngon po'i nang du dor ro //
analyzed: srin bu mang ku na mi la za ba zhig yod de de yang bab col du mi dor bar rtsva sngon po'i nang du dor ro //
translated: Bluebottle flies are known to bite people, so do not discard them thoughtlessly, but throw them into a bluebottle fly trap.

original: grang mo la yang ngo //
analyzed: grang mo la yang ngo //
translated: It is the same for cold water.

original: srin bu mang kun tsha zhing dro ba'i gnas su mi gzhag gi grang zhing bsil ba dang grib mar gzhag go /ğŸ”½btang ba'i bum bu snga ma rnams dbab pa'i phyir bcang /
analyzed: srin bu mang kun tsha zhing dro ba'i gnas su mi gzhag gi grang zhing bsil ba dang grib mar gzhag go / btang ba'i bum bu snga ma rnams dbab pa'i phyir bcang /
translated: Do not place many insects in a warm place. Place them in a cool, shaded place.ğŸ”½Carry a container for releasing them in order to release the insects that have been poured out earlier.

original: chu btsags pa'i srin bu slar chu'i nang du gtang ba'i phyir btang ba'i snod bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: chu btsags pa'i srin bu slar chu'i nang du gtang ba'i phyir btang ba'i snod bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: Carry a container for releasing them in order to release the insects that have been filtered out of the water.

original: kha nas kyang thag bus gdags su rung /
analyzed: kha nas kyang thag bus gdags su rung /
translated: It is also permissible to tie a string to their mouths.

original: zhabs su yang thag bus gdags su rung bar byas la thur du btang ba'i tshe kha'i thag bu thang par byas la slar dbyung ba'i tshe zhabs kyi thag bu la gzeng ste drang ngo //
analyzed: zhabs su yang thag bus gdags su rung bar byas la thur du btang ba'i tshe kha'i thag bu thang par byas la slar dbyung ba'i tshe zhabs kyi thag bu la gzeng ste drang ngo //
translated: It is also permissible to tie a string to their feet. When you pour them out, make the string of the mouth taut and, when you put them back, make the string of the feet taut and straight.

original: chu tshags de nyid kyis kyang dbab /
analyzed: chu tshags de nyid kyis kyang dbab /
translated: You can also pour them out with that very same water filter.

original: chu chags kyis kyang slar sems can btang du rung ste zhabs nas kyang thag bus btags kha nas kyang thag @156a * //
analyzed: chu chags kyis kyang slar sems can btang du rung ste zhabs nas kyang thag bus btags kha nas kyang thag @156a * //
translated: It is also permissible to release the sentient beings back into the water. It is also permissible to tie a string to their mouths and to their feet.

original: bus btags / sa la btang ba'i tshe zhabs kyi thag bus drangs te btang ngo //
analyzed: bus btags / sa la btang ba'i tshe zhabs kyi thag bus drangs te btang ngo //
translated: The boy tied it. When he let it go, he let it go by pulling on the rope at the foot.

original: tshags bshal bas srog chags chags pa dbog pa'i thabs /
analyzed: tshags bshal bas srog chags chags pa dbog pa'i thabs /
translated: The method of releasing the creatures when the water strainer is cleaned.

original: chu tshags la srin bu chags pa bsal zhing med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i nang du mi drag par bshal zhing bkru'o //
analyzed: chu tshags la srin bu chags pa bsal zhing med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i nang du mi drag par bshal zhing bkru'o //
translated: In order to remove and get rid of the creatures that have attached themselves to the water strainer, one should clean it by rinsing it in the water without force.

original: dri ma bkru /
analyzed: dri ma bkru /
translated: Wash the dirt.

original: skabs skabs su chu tshags kyi dri ma yang dag par bkru /
analyzed: skabs skabs su chu tshags kyi dri ma yang dag par bkru /
translated: From time to time, one should also properly wash the dirt from the water strainer.

original: rul ba med par bskam /
analyzed: rul ba med par bskam /
translated: Dry it without letting it rot.

original: chu tshags mi rul bar bya ba'i phyir bskam /
analyzed: chu tshags mi rul bar bya ba'i phyir bskam /
translated: In order to prevent the water strainer from rotting, one should dry it.

original: de btsir na gnyis ka la yang phan no //
analyzed: de btsir na gnyis ka la yang phan no //
translated: If one presses it, it is beneficial for both.

original: chu tshags btsir na dri ma dag pa dang bskam pa la phan te gcu zhing ni mi btsir /
analyzed: chu tshags btsir na dri ma dag pa dang bskam pa la phan te gcu zhing ni mi btsir /
translated: If one presses the water strainer, it is beneficial for the purification of dirt and drying. One should wring it out, but not press it down.

original: kha na mtho ba'i yid ces pa rnyed par dge 'dun nam gang zag gam chu tshags dang zad pa yin ces pa la zhugs na yang ngo //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba'i yid ces pa rnyed par dge 'dun nam gang zag gam chu tshags dang zad pa yin ces pa la zhugs na yang ngo //
translated: The one with a guilty mind means that if one uses the water strainer of the Saá¹…gha or an individual, or if one uses it while engaged in the act of ending it, it is also so.

original: chu bdag gis ma brtags par spyad kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun nam gang zag gam tshul khrims dang ldan te rtag tu chu 'tshag cing rtog pa dang gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa rtag tu chu 'tshag cing rtog pa dang gsang chu sa'i 'og nas
analyzed: chu bdag gis ma brtags par spyad kyang nyes med pa ni dge 'dun nam gang zag gam tshul khrims dang ldan te rtag tu chu 'tshag cing rtog pa dang gang zag tshul khrims dang ldan pa rtag tu chu 'tshag cing rtog pa dang gsang chu sa'i 'og nas
translated: There is no fault in using water without examining it if it is in the presence of the saá¹…gha, if it is in the presence of a monk who is always examining and filtering the water, if the water is from a spring that is underground,

original: 'ong ba sngon chad srin bu yod med de ma byung ste sems can med par yid ches pa dang chu chags bzang po srin bu yod mi 'chor zhing sngon chad kyang srin bu byung ma myong ba dang 'di rnams ni rkyen cig byung nas ma brtags shing mtshan
analyzed: 'ong ba sngon chad srin bu yod med de ma byung ste sems can med par yid ches pa dang chu chags bzang po srin bu yod mi 'chor zhing sngon chad kyang srin bu byung ma myong ba dang 'di rnams ni rkyen cig byung nas ma brtags shing mtshan
translated: if one is confident that there are no living beings in the water, if the water is good and does not contain living beings and has not previously contained them, or if one is certain that the water is free of living beings because of a special circumstance.

original: mo 'thungs shing spyad kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mo 'thungs shing spyad kyang nyes med /
translated: If one drinks and uses water at night without examining it, there is no fault.

original: nyi ma shar gyi bar du blangs pa'i dang khron pa brtags pa bzhin du zhugs shing /
analyzed: nyi ma shar gyi bar du blangs pa'i dang khron pa brtags pa bzhin du zhugs shing /
translated: If one drinks and uses water without examining it, there is no fault if one has taken it before sunrise and if one has examined the well.

original: chu bcus nas brtags te snod kyi nang du bzhag pa dang khron pa srin yod dam med brtags te bzhag pa ni di ring nyi ma shar nas sang nyi ma shar gyi bar du nyin zhag gcig tu brtag mi dgos te phan chad ni brtags so //
analyzed: chu bcus nas brtags te snod kyi nang du bzhag pa dang khron pa srin yod dam med brtags te bzhag pa ni di ring nyi ma shar nas sang nyi ma shar gyi bar du nyin zhag gcig tu brtag mi dgos te phan chad ni brtags so //
translated: Having filled the water pot, it is examined and placed inside the vessel. The well is examined to see if there are any insects and then it is placed there. This is not examined for a single day from sunrise to sunrise, but it is examined beyond that.

original: rkang pa bkrus pa phos te stong par dgang /ğŸ”½bshang gci'i sar rkang pa dang phyi rol bkru ba'i chu tshags byas la srin bu mi 'thug pa'i phyir snga ma pho zhing stong par mi bzhag par phyi ma chu sar pas dgang /
analyzed: rkang pa bkrus pa phos te stong par dgang / bshang gci'i sar rkang pa dang phyi rol bkru ba'i chu tshags byas la srin bu mi 'thug pa'i phyir snga ma pho zhing stong par mi bzhag par phyi ma chu sar pas dgang /
translated: Having washed the feet, it is emptied and cleaned.

original: zhog shig chu snod dang gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: zhog shig chu snod dang gzhan yang ngo //
translated: Having made a water strainer for washing the feet and the outer body in the place for defecating and urinating, the previous one is emptied and cleaned so that insects do not enter it. It is not left empty, but the next one is placed in the water place.ğŸ”½Leave it there.

original: chu snod gzhan dang snod spyad la sogs pa yang kha zas dri mas 'bags pa la sogs pa bkru bshal bya ste bzhag / chu snod ni chus dgang zhing bzhag rub ma pa la der gtogs pa dge 'dun gyi na de la gtogs /
analyzed: chu snod gzhan dang snod spyad la sogs pa yang kha zas dri mas 'bags pa la sogs pa bkru bshal bya ste bzhag / chu snod ni chus dgang zhing bzhag rub ma pa la der gtogs pa dge 'dun gyi na de la gtogs /
translated: The water vessel and other things are also washed and cleaned of the stains of food and so forth. The water vessel is filled with water and left there.

original: bshang sar bzhag pa'i chu snod dang @156b snod spyad la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi rub ma pa su byed pa'i las su gtogs te rub ma pas bsrungs shing zhal ta bya /
analyzed: bshang sar bzhag pa'i chu snod dang @156b snod spyad la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi rub ma pa su byed pa'i las su gtogs te rub ma pas bsrungs shing zhal ta bya /
translated: The water vessels and utensils placed in the toilet belong to the Sangha. They are the responsibility of the caretaker, who should clean them.

original: sbyin pa dang sdud pa'ang der mi gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang sdud pa'ang der mi gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The caretaker is also responsible for the distribution of alms and the collection of offerings.ğŸ”½The caretaker should also be responsible for the distribution of utensils to those who are in charge of the Sanghaâ€™s utensils.

original: dge 'dun gyi snod spyad las pa brnyan por btang ba dang mi dgos shing lhag pa sdud cing sbed pa dang byan po la snod spyad dbog ba yang rub ma pa'i las su bya'o //ğŸ”½khyim pa brnya na sbyin /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi snod spyad las pa brnyan por btang ba dang mi dgos shing lhag pa sdud cing sbed pa dang byan po la snod spyad dbog ba yang rub ma pa'i las su bya'o // khyim pa brnya na sbyin /
translated: If a layperson breaks something, he should pay for it.

original: dge 'dun gyi snod spyad la khyim pa brnya na sbyin /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi snod spyad la khyim pa brnya na sbyin /
translated: If a layperson breaks something belonging to the Sangha, he should pay for it.

original: de yod na spyad pa las so //
analyzed: de yod na spyad pa las so //
translated: If he has no money, he should pay with work.

original: khyim pa snod spyad brnyar sbyin pa ni rnying pa las sbyin /
analyzed: khyim pa snod spyad brnyar sbyin pa ni rnying pa las sbyin /
translated: If a layperson breaks something belonging to the Sangha, he should pay for it with something of equal value.

original: rnying ba med na sar pa las kyang sbyin /
analyzed: rnying ba med na sar pa las kyang sbyin /
translated: If he has no money, he should pay with work.

original: 'dir sbyin bdag gtsug lag khang du sbyin pa'am smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbyin bdag gtsug lag khang du sbyin pa'am smras pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the donor is not the one who is responsible for the temple.

original: khyim pas gtsug lag khang du mchod ston byed cing de'i rjes la khyim pa'i gnyen bshes kyang cig car gtsug lag khang du bsdus te mgron byed pa'i phyir snod spyad brnya na sbyin /
analyzed: khyim pas gtsug lag khang du mchod ston byed cing de'i rjes la khyim pa'i gnyen bshes kyang cig car gtsug lag khang du bsdus te mgron byed pa'i phyir snod spyad brnya na sbyin /
translated: If a lay person is offering a feast in the monastery and then wants to invite the lay person's relatives to a feast at the same time, the monk should give the lay person the necessary utensils.

original: dge slong la sar pa thal byung sbyin /
analyzed: dge slong la sar pa thal byung sbyin /
translated: If a monk is new to the monastery, the monk should be given a set of utensils.

original: dge slong rnying dang gsar du zhugs pa la snod spyad dang kha phyis med pa zhig yod na phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung snod spyad las ci mi bdog pa thal byung sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnying dang gsar du zhugs pa la snod spyad dang kha phyis med pa zhig yod na phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung snod spyad las ci mi bdog pa thal byung sbyin no //
translated: If an old monk or a new arrival does not have any utensils or a washbasin, the monk should be given a set of utensils from the property of the Sangha of the ten directions.

original: snod kyi phyir gnas bsko rub ma pa'i snod spyad dang / dkor la sogs pa 'brub pa'i mdzod khang bsngos shing sbyin /
analyzed: snod kyi phyir gnas bsko rub ma pa'i snod spyad dang / dkor la sogs pa 'brub pa'i mdzod khang bsngos shing sbyin /
translated: If a monk is appointed to a position for the sake of the utensils, the monk should be given a storehouse full of utensils and property.

original: zangs dang kham pa'i snod so sor gzhug / mdzod du rub ma pas sba brtul bya ba ni zangs dang kham pa'i snod spyad sde sde so sor bzhag / chu zhog shig / dge 'dun gyi spyir btung ba dang spyad pa la sogs pa'i chu bzhag / bab
analyzed: zangs dang kham pa'i snod so sor gzhug / mdzod du rub ma pas sba brtul bya ba ni zangs dang kham pa'i snod spyad sde sde so sor bzhag / chu zhog shig / dge 'dun gyi spyir btung ba dang spyad pa la sogs pa'i chu bzhag / bab
translated: Water for the general use of the Saá¹…gha, such as for drinking and washing, is to be placed.ğŸ”½It is not to be placed haphazardly.

original: chol du mi bzhag / chu dang chu snod la sogs pa bab chol du mi bzhag khang pa de'i phyir bya /
analyzed: chol du mi bzhag / chu dang chu snod la sogs pa bab chol du mi bzhag khang pa de'i phyir bya /
translated: Water, water vessels, and so forth are not to be placed haphazardly. They are to be placed outside the temple.

original: chu bab chol du mi gzhag pa'i phyir chu bzhag ba'i gnas kyi khang pa bya'o //
analyzed: chu bab chol du mi gzhag pa'i phyir chu bzhag ba'i gnas kyi khang pa bya'o //
translated: In order that water not be placed haphazardly, a room for placing water is to be made.

original: gtsug lag khang gi lho nub kyi ngos kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi lho nub kyi ngos kyi nang du'o //
translated: It is to be made inside the temple in the southwest corner.

original: chu bzhag pa'i khang pa bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi nang lho nub kyi mtshams kyi gra nas khang pa mig gcig bsngo /
analyzed: chu bzhag pa'i khang pa bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi nang lho nub kyi mtshams kyi gra nas khang pa mig gcig bsngo /
translated: The room for placing water is to be made by setting aside one room in the southwest corner of the temple.

original: skar khung gdod pha gu gding chu khung gdod sgo bya sgo leb dang yang mig gzhug / chu bzhag pa'i khang pa de thog ma brtsigs pa'i tshe nas skar khung gdod /
analyzed: skar khung gdod pha gu gding chu khung gdod sgo bya sgo leb dang yang mig gzhug / chu bzhag pa'i khang pa de thog ma brtsigs pa'i tshe nas skar khung gdod /

original: 'og tu so phag gding chu khung gdod sgo'i re bzhi bya sgo leb gzhug sgo leb la yang mig dang lag gzungs bca'/
analyzed: 'og tu so phag gding chu khung gdod sgo'i re bzhi bya sgo leb gzhug sgo leb la yang mig dang lag gzungs bca'/
translated: the bricks are to be laid below, the door is to be made at the beginning, the door-leaves and the bolts are to be put in later, and the door-leaves are to be provided with windows and with a handle.

original: tshags bzhag pa'i phyir @157a * //
analyzed: tshags bzhag pa'i phyir @157a * //
translated: The shelves for storing the goods are to be made

original: gdang yang ngo //
analyzed: gdang yang ngo //
translated: in the same way.

original: chu bzhag pa'i khang pa'i nang du tshags bskams zhing bzhag pa'i gdang bya /
analyzed: chu bzhag pa'i khang pa'i nang du tshags bskams zhing bzhag pa'i gdang bya /
translated: In the house for storing water, the shelves for drying and storing the goods are to be made.ğŸ”½The wooden racks for storing the goods are to be made in the house.

original: shing khri gzhag / khang bu'i nang du chu snod kyi gzhi shing khri gzhag phag bu'i stegs bu yang ngo //
analyzed: shing khri gzhag / khang bu'i nang du chu snod kyi gzhi shing khri gzhag phag bu'i stegs bu yang ngo //
translated: The wooden racks for storing the goods are to be made on the floor for storing water.

analyzed: chu bzhag ba'i gzhi phag bu la stegs bur byas kyang rung ngo // shong shong por ro //

analyzed: stegs bu la chu snod 'chags par bya ba'i phyir so sor shod bur bya /
translated: The wooden racks for storing the goods are to be made in such a way that the water-vessels can be placed on them.

original: spyad pa'i chu snod yan chad dag par bya /
analyzed: spyad pa'i chu snod yan chad dag par bya /
translated: The water-vessels for use are to be kept clean.

original: chus snod dang spyad pa'i snod spyad la sogs pa kha zas dang dri mas 'bags pa dag par bkru zhing byi ba dang bya /
analyzed: chus snod dang spyad pa'i snod spyad la sogs pa kha zas dang dri mas 'bags pa dag par bkru zhing byi ba dang bya /

original: gtsang sbrar ro //
analyzed: gtsang sbrar ro //

original: dben par rtog cing 'dug pa /

analyzed: khyo zhig mi tshangs par spyod pa la 'jab cing 'grengs te nyan pa na ltung ste yan lag gcig / g-yogs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: If one stands in a concealed place, listening to a man and a woman who are unchaste, one commits a downfall. One branch is concealed.

translated: If one engages in sexual intercourse in a place surrounded by a wall or fence, in a house, or in a place where the ground is covered, and one sees or hears from nearby, one commits a downfall due to one factor.

translated: If one does not see or hear anything, one commits no offense.ğŸ”½If one goes to the place of a person with whom one is to have sexual intercourse, but one does not engage in sexual intercourse because of the presence of a wild animal, a thief, or some other condition, one commits a downfall due to one factor.ğŸ”½All the factors of the secret places and the hidden places are included in this downfall.

analyzed: gzhan du bsnun na gzhan du ma bsnun kyang ngo //

original: ka ba la bsnun par mi sbyin /

translated: Just as it is a misdeed to strike a pillar with oneâ€™s hand, so it is a misdeed to strike any stone or wood. It is a misdeed to strike with an angry mind, with a weapon, or in play. It is not a misdeed to strike for a purpose.

analyzed: bsnun pa'o // 'tshog pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /

analyzed: // / gzas pa'i ltung ba la 'chad / bsnun @160b pa gzas pa / bsnun pa ltar bsdigs pa'i phyir btsog par gzas pa ni ltung ba ste yan lag dang bshad pa thams cad ltag ma 'tshog pa'i ltung ba dang 'dra'o //

original: gzas pa'o// gzas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzas pa'o// gzas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /

original: // / nyes smos la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / nyes smos la 'chad de /

analyzed: phas pham pa dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: The faults are the defeating offenses and the partially defeating offenses.

analyzed: phas pham pa dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcabs pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / ma gtogs pa ni mi bde ba dang dge sbyong dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang dge 'dun 'khrugs par dogs pa'i dbang du gtogs pa'o //
translated: There is a downfall if one conceals a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense.ğŸ”½There is no downfall if one conceals an offense for reasons such as the following: one is in a state of mental pain; one fears that one will be unable to continue oneâ€™s practice of virtue or to maintain pure conduct; one fears that the community will be disturbed.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba mthol na bdag la mi bde zhing gnod par 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang dge slong grogs la dge ba spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur zhing mi bde ba dang dge 'dun 'khrugs par 'gyur du dogs par 'di rnams kyi rkyen lta bu zhig gi phyir ma mthol cing bcabs pa ni nyes med de rkyen 'di rnams med pa
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ba mthol na bdag la mi bde zhing gnod par 'gyur ba dang / dge sbyong dang dge slong grogs la dge ba spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur zhing mi bde ba dang dge 'dun 'khrugs par 'gyur du dogs par 'di rnams kyi rkyen lta bu zhig gi phyir ma mthol cing bcabs pa ni nyes med de rkyen 'di rnams med pa
translated: There is no downfall if one does not confess an offense for reasons such as the following: one fears that one will be harmed or that oneâ€™s life will be in danger if one confesses; one fears that oneâ€™s virtuous practice or pure conduct will be interrupted; or one fears that the community will be disturbed.

original: las ltung ste yan lag gcig / sbas pa'o //
analyzed: las ltung ste yan lag gcig / sbas pa'o //
translated: There is a downfall if one conceals a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense.

original: nyes pa de shes bzhin du bcabs pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / zhag gi mthar na'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de shes bzhin du bcabs pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / zhag gi mthar na'o //
translated: If one conceals the offense while knowing it, it becomes a downfall, one part.ğŸ”½At the end of the day.ğŸ”½If the offense occurs at the end of the day, it becomes a downfall, one part.

analyzed: zhag gcig gi skya rengs byung ba las ltung bar gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan na ltung bar 'gyur te /

original: sngar ni nyes byas pa'o //

analyzed: bcabs par bsams na skya rengs ma byung gi bar du nyes byas /

analyzed: ltung ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa gzhan la yod cing byung ba shes te bcabs na nyes byas //

original: kha na mtho ba sbed pa'o //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba sbed pa'o //

original: dge slong gi nyes pa bcabs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong gi nyes pa bcabs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /

original: // / ltung ba'i bcu ste gcig 'das so //
analyzed: // / ltung ba'i bcu ste gcig 'das so //

original: bde ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: bde ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /

original: nad kyi gsos kyi phyir ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: nad kyi gsos kyi phyir ni ma gtogs te /

analyzed: dge slong na ba la phan pa'i phyir zan bcad pa dang / sman bya ba'i phyir zan ma byin pa ni nyes med do //
translated: It is not an offense if a monk fasts for the sake of his health or for the sake of taking medicine.

analyzed: bsams nas khyim pa'i sbyin bdag gi zas gcod par byed pa'o // dge slong la ched kar zan gcad par bsams nas khyim pa'i @161a * //
translated: The downfall is to intentionally deprive a layperson of food.

analyzed: gnas su dge slong la zan ma byin zhing bcad na ltung ba'o // nan da dang au pa nan das slob ma dar ma la zas bcad pa las bcas /

original: zas gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zas gcod par byed pa'o //

original: zan gcod pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: zan gcod pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /

original: // / me'i ltung ba la 'chad de /ğŸ”½seng ge la mi reg /
analyzed: // / me'i ltung ba la 'chad de / seng ge la mi reg /
translated: The downfall of fire is explained as follows.ğŸ”½Do not touch a lion.

original: seng ge la reg par mi bya /
analyzed: seng ge la reg par mi bya /

original: seng ge la reg na khros te reg tu mi bzod cing /
analyzed: seng ge la reg na khros te reg tu mi bzod cing /
translated: If you touch a lion, it will become angry and will not tolerate being touched.

analyzed: gnod par byed pa de bzhin du me la reg tu mi rung ba'i dper smos so //
translated: It will harm you. In the same way, fire is an example of something that should not be touched.

original: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa me la reg kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang dge slong grogs kyi phyir mchod cing bsro bar bsams te reg pa dang bus pa ni nyes med
analyzed: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa me la reg kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang dge slong grogs kyi phyir mchod cing bsro bar bsams te reg pa dang bus pa ni nyes med
translated: There is no fault if one touches or fans a fire thinking to make offerings and warmth for the sake of the Buddha, the teaching, the community, or a fellow monk.

analyzed: do // chos kyi bya ba'i phyir bya bar brtags te lhung bzed btso ba'i las la dus bsngo //
translated: There is no fault if one touches a fire for the sake of Dharma activity, and if one dedicates the time to the work of cooking in a begging bowl.

translated: There is no fault if one touches a fire for the sake of the Dharma, having dedicated oneâ€™s body, Dharma robes, begging bowl, and so forth to the Dharma.

original: ring du bsngo //
analyzed: ring du bsngo //
translated: One should dedicate for a long time.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos btso ba'i bsams pas sam yam gyi dus bsngo ba ni thog ma reg pa na zin gyi bar du gzung ngo snyam du bsam /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos btso ba'i bsams pas sam yam gyi dus bsngo ba ni thog ma reg pa na zin gyi bar du gzung ngo snyam du bsam /
translated: If one dedicates the time to cooking Dharma robes and begging bowls, one should think, â€œI will hold it until I touch it.â€

original: rtsed mo me la rtse ba'i phyir bzung na'ang ltung bar 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: rtsed mo me la rtse ba'i phyir bzung na'ang ltung bar 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad /

analyzed: mgal ba bskor ba dang zla ba dang nyi ma ltar mgal ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed do // ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi gzugs 'dra bar mgal ba la rtses shing bskor na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: One is guilty of a transgression if one turns a firebrand like a wheel, or if one makes the sun and moon turn like a wheel.ğŸ”½One is guilty of a transgression if one plays with the forms of these things, even if one does not really use a firebrand, etc.

original: 'di rnams kyi gzugs ma yin yang me la gzhan ji ltar rtses kyang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gzugs ma yin yang me la gzhan ji ltar rtses kyang ltung ba'o //
translated: One is guilty of a transgression if one plays with fire in any way, even if one does not imitate the forms of these things.ğŸ”½One is guilty of a transgression if one touches fire, except in an emergency.
