analyzed: mes so // me la reg pa las ltung bar 'gyur ta yan lag gcig / sa ma yam ma bsngos na'o // me la bzung ba'i tshe /
translated: One is guilty of a transgression if one touches fire, except in an emergency.ğŸ”½One is not guilty if one touches fire in order to put out a burning monastic robe.

original: sa ma yam ma bsngos pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / rtse pa dang don med pa'i phyir gzung ba ni sam yam bsngos kyang mi chud do //ğŸ”½mi na ba'i dbang gis ma 'dug par reg pa'o //
analyzed: sa ma yam ma bsngos pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / rtse pa dang don med pa'i phyir gzung ba ni sam yam bsngos kyang mi chud do // mi na ba'i dbang gis ma 'dug par reg pa'o //
translated: One is guilty of a transgression if one does not sit in oneâ€™s seat when the Saá¹…gha is sitting, except in an emergency.

original: bdag mi na bar me la reg pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig bdag gis ma bskos na'o //
analyzed: bdag mi na bar me la reg pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig bdag gis ma bskos na'o //
translated: One is guilty of a transgression if one touches fire, except in an emergency.

original: bdag gis bzung ngam gzhan 'dzin du bcug pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag @161b 'di rnams dang ldan par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½spar ba dang me cher bud pa'i phyir reg pa dang / gzhil ba dang me chung bar bya ba'i phyir reg pa dang / shing la reg pa dang / mgal ba la reg pa dang / ma reg par bus kyang rung /ğŸ”½mgal ba ma yin pa'i shing mes ma reg par mer bcug pa dang / 'jug pa dang shing mer 'jug pa dang / 'byin par bsko ba /
analyzed: bdag gis bzung ngam gzhan 'dzin du bcug pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag @161b 'di rnams dang ldan par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro // spar ba dang me cher bud pa'i phyir reg pa dang / gzhil ba dang me chung bar bya ba'i phyir reg pa dang / shing la reg pa dang / mgal ba la reg pa dang / ma reg par bus kyang rung / mgal ba ma yin pa'i shing mes ma reg par mer bcug pa dang / 'jug pa dang shing mer 'jug pa dang / 'byin par bsko ba /
translated: One commits a downfall by doing it oneself or by having someone else do it.ğŸ”½One commits a downfall if one touches a fire that is being spread or that is burning intensely, or if one touches it in order to extinguish it or to reduce it.ğŸ”½One commits a downfall if one touches wood, or if one blows on embers, or if one blows on a fire without touching it.

original: mgal ba phyir 'byin pa dang / mdag ma spyur ba dang 'bru ba'o //
analyzed: mgal ba phyir 'byin pa dang / mdag ma spyur ba dang 'bru ba'o //
translated: One commits a downfall if one puts wood into a fire that is not an ember, or if one puts it into a fire that is an ember, or if one turns it in order to make it burn, or if one turns it in order to extinguish it.ğŸ”½One commits a downfall if one scatters or piles up embers, or if one winnows them.

original: mdag ma spyur zhing spungs ba dang / mdag ma 'bru ba dang / 'di rnams gag kyang rung byas na ltung bar 'gyur /ğŸ”½me ma mur ni phyed do //
analyzed: mdag ma spyur zhing spungs ba dang / mdag ma 'bru ba dang / 'di rnams gag kyang rung byas na ltung bar 'gyur / me ma mur ni phyed do //
translated: One commits a downfall if one does any of these things.

original: thal ba me ma mur can la reg pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: thal ba me ma mur can la reg pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: One commits a serious violation if one scatters or piles up hot embers.ğŸ”½One commits an offense of wrong conduct if one touches hot ashes.

original: 'bar ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bar ba yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same for fire.

original: me lce la reg pa yang nyes byas /
analyzed: me lce la reg pa yang nyes byas /
translated: If one touches a flame, it is a fault.

original: der shing gis bcug ste phyung na me gzhan du chud do //
analyzed: der shing gis bcug ste phyung na me gzhan du chud do //
translated: If one puts wood into it and takes it out, the fire spreads elsewhere.

original: me lce dang me mar mur can la shing bcu ga ste mer mched pa la reg na ni ltung ba'o zhes t'i ka las bshad /
analyzed: me lce dang me mar mur can la shing bcu ga ste mer mched pa la reg na ni ltung ba'o zhes t'i ka las bshad /
translated: If one puts wood into a flame or a burning wick, and touches the fire that spreads, it is a downfall.

original: mkhan po kha cig na re nyes byas zhes bshad /
analyzed: mkhan po kha cig na re nyes byas zhes bshad /
translated: Some preceptors explain that it is a fault.

original: skra dang spu dang rus pa dang sen mo dang mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang tshad pa dang bal sran dang rgya sran dang shing mar dang / yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar rnams ni shing phyed bzhin no //
analyzed: skra dang spu dang rus pa dang sen mo dang mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang tshad pa dang bal sran dang rgya sran dang shing mar dang / yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar rnams ni shing phyed bzhin no //
translated: Hair, body hair, nails, teeth, mucus, phlegm, vomit, pus, blood, urine, and feces are like wood.

original: mang gis smos ba 'di rnams mer bsregs pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mang gis smos ba 'di rnams mer bsregs pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one burns these in a fire, it is a fault.

original: gzhan la byed cing gzhan bsngos pa bsngos pa phyed do //
analyzed: gzhan la byed cing gzhan bsngos pa bsngos pa phyed do //
translated: If one makes another do it, or if it is dedicated to another, it is a half-dedication.

original: sangs rgyas grogs kyi phyir bsngos te bus pa las gzhan gyi phyir spyad dam grogs lta bu'i phyir bud pa la sa ma yam gyi 'du shes gzhan gyi phyir bsngos pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas grogs kyi phyir bsngos te bus pa las gzhan gyi phyir spyad dam grogs lta bu'i phyir bud pa la sa ma yam gyi 'du shes gzhan gyi phyir bsngos pa ni nyes byas /
translated: If one uses it for the sake of others, or for the sake of a friend, and dedicates it to others, it is a minor infraction.

original: me'i khrims so //
analyzed: me'i khrims so //
translated: The rule about fire.

original: me la reg pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: me la reg pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of touching fire is complete.

original: // / dad pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dad pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of faith is explained as follows.

original: dge slong gi phyir las 'das pa dad pa byin te slar len pa'i phyir dag gis so //
analyzed: dge slong gi phyir las 'das pa dad pa byin te slar len pa'i phyir dag gis so //
translated: If a monk has given faith for a certain purpose, and then later takes it back, it is a downfall.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi las ci byed kyang rung sngar dad pa phul la phyis nad pa mi 'bul lo zhes smras shing bzlog pa ni ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi las ci byed kyang rung sngar dad pa phul la phyis nad pa mi 'bul lo zhes smras shing bzlog pa ni ltung ba'o //
translated: If one says, â€œWhatever the Sangha of monks does, first offer your faith, and then do not offer it to the sick,â€ and turns them away, it is a downfall.

original: dad pa slar lan pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa slar lan pa'o //
translated: Faith is taken back.

original: dad pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dad pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of faith is complete.

original: // / rab tu ma rdzogs pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de //
analyzed: // / rab tu ma rdzogs pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de //
translated: The downfall of not being fully ordained is explained as follows.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ma yin pa'i snang ba can gyi gnas kyi phyogs su mi nyal /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ma yin pa'i snang ba can gyi gnas kyi phyogs su mi nyal /
translated: One should not sleep in a place that is illuminated by anything other than the sun and moon.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od la nyal ba ni nyes med de me dang me mar @162a * //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od la nyal ba ni nyes med de me dang me mar @162a * //
translated: It is not a fault to sleep in the light of the sun or moon.

original: dang rin po che dang sman gyi 'od la nyal na nyes byas /
analyzed: dang rin po che dang sman gyi 'od la nyal na nyes byas /
translated: It is a fault to sleep in the light of fire, lamps, jewels, or medicine.

original: ma gtogs pa ni nad pa dang nad pa'i g-yog gi dbang gis na'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni nad pa dang nad pa'i g-yog gi dbang gis na'o //
translated: Except for the sick and those who are attending to the sick.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni dge slong nad pa me mar gyis btsa' dgos pa de dang de'i nad g-yog mi mar gyis btsa' dgos pa de dang / 'od la nyal ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni dge slong nad pa me mar gyis btsa' dgos pa de dang de'i nad g-yog mi mar gyis btsa' dgos pa de dang / 'od la nyal ba ni nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault for a sick monk who needs a lamp to sleep in its light, or for the attendant who needs a lamp to sleep in its light.

original: 'dir 'ga' 'ga' ltung ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' 'ga' ltung ba'o zhes so //
translated: Here, some say it is a downfall.

original: me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re ltung ba'o zhes kyang 'chad de ltung ba dgu bcu rtsa gcig tu mi 'byung bas ltung ba ma yin gyi nyes byas so //
analyzed: me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re ltung ba'o zhes kyang 'chad de ltung ba dgu bcu rtsa gcig tu mi 'byung bas ltung ba ma yin gyi nyes byas so //
translated: Some Abhidharma masters say that sleeping in the light of a lamp is a downfall, but since it is not mentioned in the list of one hundred and eleven downfalls, it is not a downfall but a minor offense.

original: nyal ba ma yin na ni phyed do //
analyzed: nyal ba ma yin na ni phyed do //
translated: If it is not sleeping, it is half.

original: me mar gyi 'od dang dge sbyong dang lhan cig khyim gcig gi nang na tsog pur thum phras su nyal ba ni ltung ba dang nyes byas kyi phyed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me mar gyi 'od dang dge sbyong dang lhan cig khyim gcig gi nang na tsog pur thum phras su nyal ba ni ltung ba dang nyes byas kyi phyed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Sleeping in the same room as a naked ascetic, or in the same room as a naked ascetic and a lamp, is a half-fault.

original: so sor nyin mo la yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor nyin mo la yang ngo //
translated: It is the same during the day.

original: nyin par me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba dang mtshan mo 'dra ste nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyin par me mar gyi 'od la nyal ba dang mtshan mo 'dra ste nyes byas so //
translated: Sleeping in the light of a lamp during the day is the same as at night: it is a fault.

original: mang du g-yogs pa'i bskor ba pa'i khyim gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: mang du g-yogs pa'i bskor ba pa'i khyim gyi mtha'o //
translated: The house is surrounded by many layers.

original: khyim gcig tu nyal na ltung ba'i khyim ni thog kyang gsum gnyis por rtsig pa'ang sum gnyis bskor ba'i nang du dge sbyong dang nyal na ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyim gcig tu nyal na ltung ba'i khyim ni thog kyang gsum gnyis por rtsig pa'ang sum gnyis bskor ba'i nang du dge sbyong dang nyal na ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: If one sleeps in the same house as a naked ascetic, the house is a house with three stories and two walls, and if one sleeps with a naked ascetic inside two and a half walls, it is a downfall.

original: der chud pa bzhin pa ni gtogs ba'i sgo'i ngos kyi mtshams kyang khyim du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: der chud pa bzhin pa ni gtogs ba'i sgo'i ngos kyi mtshams kyang khyim du gyur pa na'o //
translated: If it is surrounded by walls, the boundary of the house is the edge of the door.

original: khang pa gcig gi nang na nyal ba dang 'dra bar khang bu gcig phug na 'dug la sgo na khang pa'am khyams thog phor ba zhig yod na khang bu phug ma'i pha rol tshu rol gyi rtsig pa kha drang du bcad na phug pa tsam gyi sa khyon
analyzed: khang pa gcig gi nang na nyal ba dang 'dra bar khang bu gcig phug na 'dug la sgo na khang pa'am khyams thog phor ba zhig yod na khang bu phug ma'i pha rol tshu rol gyi rtsig pa kha drang du bcad na phug pa tsam gyi sa khyon
translated: If one sleeps in a house, it is like sleeping in one room. If one sleeps in a room with a door, if there is a vessel on the roof of the house or courtyard, if one cuts the wall straight from the side of the room to the other side,

original: tshad kyi nang tsam du byas pa'i phyi rol gyi khang par dge spyod nyal na phug mar dge slong nyal yang ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad kyi nang tsam du byas pa'i phyi rol gyi khang par dge spyod nyal na phug mar dge slong nyal yang ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: one should make it just the size of the space of the room. If one sleeps in the house outside, even if the monk sleeps in the room, it becomes a downfall.

original: rib ma ltag ma yang sgo de'i nang du chud do //
analyzed: rib ma ltag ma yang sgo de'i nang du chud do //
translated: The back of the curtain also falls within that door.

original: khang bu yang thog can du 'dug na sgo 'og khang gi nang du byung la gcig tu dge sbyong nyal la gcig tu dge slong nyal ba ni ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khang bu yang thog can du 'dug na sgo 'og khang gi nang du byung la gcig tu dge sbyong nyal la gcig tu dge slong nyal ba ni ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If the room has an upper story, if the door comes out from the lower story, if one sleeps in one place as a celibate and in another place as a monk, it becomes a downfall.

original: rim pa mang po gcig gi nang du gcig sgo phyung ba ni mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: rim pa mang po gcig gi nang du gcig sgo phyung ba ni mi brtsi'o //
translated: If there are many stories, it is not counted if one door is outside the other.

original: mtshams dang bcas pa'i gnas tsam phan chad gnas na der so sor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams dang bcas pa'i gnas tsam phan chad gnas na der so sor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one stays in a place with a boundary, it becomes individual for each one there.

original: ra mo ches bskor ba'i nang na nyal na 'dom gang pan chad du dge sbyong bsnyal pa ni nyes byas khang mo che zhig nas bdag nyal ba nas bdag gi gnas khang gcig tsam gyi sas @162b bar du bcad de de phan chad dge sbyong bsnyal ba ni
analyzed: ra mo ches bskor ba'i nang na nyal na 'dom gang pan chad du dge sbyong bsnyal pa ni nyes byas khang mo che zhig nas bdag nyal ba nas bdag gi gnas khang gcig tsam gyi sas @162b bar du bcad de de phan chad dge sbyong bsnyal ba ni
translated: If one sleeps in a place surrounded by walls more than an armspan high, but the place is separated from oneâ€™s dwelling by a wall, it is not a downfall.

original: nyes med / phyed pa ni shing gi rtsa ba dang rtsig pa'i ser ga dang ldum rtsa rnams so //ğŸ”½dge sbyong dang lhan cig tu shing gi lo ma 'dab chags su 'dres shing steng khebs par 'dug pa'i 'og tu nyal lam khang pa'i rtsig pa glo rdol du seng song por 'dug ste phan tshun mi rgyur rung ba dang gad pa'i ser ga seng song por 'dug
analyzed: nyes med / phyed pa ni shing gi rtsa ba dang rtsig pa'i ser ga dang ldum rtsa rnams so // dge sbyong dang lhan cig tu shing gi lo ma 'dab chags su 'dres shing steng khebs par 'dug pa'i 'og tu nyal lam khang pa'i rtsig pa glo rdol du seng song por 'dug ste phan tshun mi rgyur rung ba dang gad pa'i ser ga seng song por 'dug
translated: The â€œhalf-wallsâ€ are the roots of trees, the corners of buildings, and the walls of hedges.ğŸ”½If one sleeps under a tree with leaves that are connected and form a roof, or in a building with a wall that has a hole large enough to crawl through, or in a building with a wall that has a hole large enough to insert the head and neck,

original: pa'i nang du nyal lam rgun 'bru'i shing lta bu steng 'dzings pa dang ldum phong phung gi khrod du nyal ba ni nyes byas /
analyzed: pa'i nang du nyal lam rgun 'bru'i shing lta bu steng 'dzings pa dang ldum phong phung gi khrod du nyal ba ni nyes byas /
translated: or in a building with a wall that has a hole large enough to insert the hips, it is a downfall. If one sleeps in a place surrounded by a wall of grapevines, or in a place surrounded by a wall of bushes, it is a downfall.

original: sdug po dang bcas par bud med dang lhan cig nyal na'o //
analyzed: sdug po dang bcas par bud med dang lhan cig nyal na'o //
translated: It is sleeping with a woman, even if it is painful.ğŸ”½If one sleeps with a woman in a forest, or in grass, or in a thicket, it is a misdeed.

original: nags sam rtsva'am ldam ldum khrod du bud med dang nye bar nyal na nyes byas su 'gyur te ci tsam tshun chad pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: nags sam rtsva'am ldam ldum khrod du bud med dang nye bar nyal na nyes byas su 'gyur te ci tsam tshun chad pa ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The extent of that is explained below.

original: de'i lam ni bya gag 'phur nas bab pa nang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lam ni bya gag 'phur nas bab pa nang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Her path is the path of the crow's flight.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i tshed ni bya gag 'phur te bab pa'i lam tshun chad gcig tu nyal na nyes byas khang mo zhig du nyal na'ang bya gag 'phur ba'i lam tshun chad ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i tshed ni bya gag 'phur te bab pa'i lam tshun chad gcig tu nyal na nyes byas khang mo zhig du nyal na'ang bya gag 'phur ba'i lam tshun chad ltung ba'o //
translated: The extent of the misdeed is that if one sleeps in one place up to the path of the crow's flight, it is a misdeed. If one sleeps in a house, it is a downfall up to the path of the crow's flight.

original: thams cad kyi bar du rgyur yod pa khyim gzhan med par g-yogs na gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bar du rgyur yod pa khyim gzhan med par g-yogs na gcig go //
translated: If there is a continuous wall, it is one house.

original: khang pa phyi rgya gcig la nang mig so sor 'dug ste dbus kyi khyams dog pa zhig na sgo med dam sgo ma bcad par khang bu nang du dge sbyong nyal la dbus su dge slong nyal na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khang pa phyi rgya gcig la nang mig so sor 'dug ste dbus kyi khyams dog pa zhig na sgo med dam sgo ma bcad par khang bu nang du dge sbyong nyal la dbus su dge slong nyal na ltung ba'o //
translated: If a house has one outer wall but the inner walls are separate, and the central courtyard is narrow, if there is no door or the door is not closed, and a monk sleeps inside the house, and a monk sleeps in the center, it is a downfall.

original: so so ni bdag gi skal bar gtogs pa'i sgo bcing pas bcings na mtshams kyang ngo //
analyzed: so so ni bdag gi skal bar gtogs pa'i sgo bcing pas bcings na mtshams kyang ngo //
translated: If each one is bound by the door of his own destiny, then there is no transgression.

original: khang pa'i phyi rgyag cig la nang tha dad par 'dug na gcig tu dge slong nyal te sgo dam du bcad na gzhan du dge sbyong nyal kyang mi ltung //
analyzed: khang pa'i phyi rgyag cig la nang tha dad par 'dug na gcig tu dge slong nyal te sgo dam du bcad na gzhan du dge sbyong nyal kyang mi ltung //
translated: If the outer wall of a house is the same, but the inner walls are different, then if a monk sleeps in one part, and a Å›ramaá¹‡a sleeps in another part, having closed the door, there is no transgression.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gis ltung ba la bsrung na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gis ltung ba la bsrung na'o //
translated: In the same way, if a monk guards against downfalls.

original: bud med kyang dge slong gcig gis res kyis bsrungs la gcig nyal kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med kyang dge slong gcig gis res kyis bsrungs la gcig nyal kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a woman is guarded by a monk in turn, and if one sleeps while the other is awake, there is no downfall.

original: bdag pos bsrungs pa'i bud med na yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag pos bsrungs pa'i bud med na yang ngo //
translated: If a woman is guarded by her master,

original: bud med khyim thab dang bcas par 'dug pa ni khyi ma gcig na nyal kyang zhag gcig gis ltung bar mi 'gyur te zhag gnyis las 'das na ni rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang nyal ba ni ltung bar brtsi /
analyzed: bud med khyim thab dang bcas par 'dug pa ni khyi ma gcig na nyal kyang zhag gcig gis ltung bar mi 'gyur te zhag gnyis las 'das na ni rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang nyal ba ni ltung bar brtsi /
translated: if a woman lives with her husband, and if they sleep in the same bed, there is no downfall for one night, but if they stay together for a second night, then the downfall is calculated for the one who is not fully ordained and for the one who sleeps.

original: rim bla mar na skas phyung na'o //
analyzed: rim bla mar na skas phyung na'o //
translated: If the stairs are removed.

original: bdag yang thog tu nyal na bud med dam dge sbyong 'og khang du bsnyal la skas @163a * //
analyzed: bdag yang thog tu nyal na bud med dam dge sbyong 'og khang du bsnyal la skas @163a * //
translated: If you are sleeping on the top floor, put the woman or the ascetic on the lower floor.ğŸ”½

original: steng du drangs te nyal kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: steng du drangs te nyal kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one sleeps on the roof, it is permissible to place a woman or a novice on the lower floor and to draw her up the ladder to sleep with her.

original: 'bri ba ni khyim ma yin gzhan du gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba ni khyim ma yin gzhan du gyur na'o //
translated: Writing is not a downfall if it is done in a place other than a house.

original: khang pa thog phyed bor ba dang phyed bskor ba dang khang bu'i sgo'i phyi rol thog med pa la 'dom gang tshun chad thang ngam dbye la 'dom gang tshun chad du dge sbyong nyal na nyes byas /
analyzed: khang pa thog phyed bor ba dang phyed bskor ba dang khang bu'i sgo'i phyi rol thog med pa la 'dom gang tshun chad thang ngam dbye la 'dom gang tshun chad du dge sbyong nyal na nyes byas /
translated: If a novice sleeps on a flat roof that is half-covered and half-open, or on the roof of a building with an open roof, or on the ground outside the door of a building, within an armâ€™s reach of the building, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu grong na nub gsum du nyal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu grong na nub gsum du nyal ba'o //
translated: Sleeping three nights in a house with a woman who is not fully ordained is a downfall.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang khyim gcig la nub gnyis las 'das par nub gsum du nyal na ltung ba'o //ğŸ”½'thas na'o // nub gsum gyi mtha' skya rengs byung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang khyim gcig la nub gnyis las 'das par nub gsum du nyal na ltung ba'o // 'thas na'o // nub gsum gyi mtha' skya rengs byung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sleeping two nights in the same house with a woman who is not fully ordained and then a third night in a different house is also a downfall.

original: phan chad ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: phan chad ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If the woman is a relative, the offense is only a serious transgression.ğŸ”½The downfall is completed when the third night ends at dawn.ğŸ”½Sleeping with a woman for more than three nights is a serious transgression.

original: zhag gnyis nas gsum gyi skya rengs ma byung gi bar du dge sbyong dang nyal na nyes byas /
analyzed: zhag gnyis nas gsum gyi skya rengs ma byung gi bar du dge sbyong dang nyal na nyes byas /
translated: If a monk sleeps with a female renunciant from the time of dusk until the dawn two or three days later, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyes med pa ni lam ni ngal te myos pa'o //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni lam ni ngal te myos pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is exhausted from traveling and falls asleep.

original: lam ring po nas 'ongs te chad pa ni zhag gsum gyi skya rengs ma byung tshun chad ldang bar bsams te langs pa ni nyes med de /
analyzed: lam ring po nas 'ongs te chad pa ni zhag gsum gyi skya rengs ma byung tshun chad ldang bar bsams te langs pa ni nyes med de /
translated: There is no offense if the monk has traveled a long distance and falls asleep thinking that he will get up before the dawn of the third day.

original: de lta bu'i mthar yang ngo //ğŸ”½s'u tra ltag ma ltar chad pa'i dge slong skya rengs ma byung tshun chad ldang bar byas pa las thal byung gnyid log ste skya rengs byung yang nyes med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mthar yang ngo // s'u tra ltag ma ltar chad pa'i dge slong skya rengs ma byung tshun chad ldang bar byas pa las thal byung gnyid log ste skya rengs byung yang nyes med do //
translated: This is the limit.ğŸ”½There is no offense if the monk falls asleep in the morning thinking that he will get up before the dawn, but falls asleep again and the dawn breaks.

original: ma brtags pa'i dge slong gis bya ba de sgrub pa dang nad g-yog lhan cig tu yang ngo //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i dge slong gis bya ba de sgrub pa dang nad g-yog lhan cig tu yang ngo //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not inattentive and is attended by a nurse.

original: dge slong nad pa la sogs pa rtog cing byin len bya ba'i phyir dge sbyong bzhag ste gzhan du bsnyal na gnas med dam nad pa la mi bde na drung du bsnyal na yang nad pa la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur nad g-yog dge slong la yang ltungğŸ”½bar mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½dge sbyong dang yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong nad pa la sogs pa rtog cing byin len bya ba'i phyir dge sbyong bzhag ste gzhan du bsnyal na gnas med dam nad pa la mi bde na drung du bsnyal na yang nad pa la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur nad g-yog dge slong la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro // dge sbyong dang yang ngo //
translated: If a sick monk, etc. is placed in a monastery and another monk is placed nearby to do the examination and the receiving of alms, then if there is no place or if the sick one is not comfortable, it is not a downfall for the sick one or for the monk who is his attendant.ğŸ”½If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.

original: gzhan yang dge sbyong dang lhan cig nyal na yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yod de 'og nas 'chad do //ğŸ”½de yod pas so //ğŸ”½dge slong slob pa'am nye gnas dge sbyong yod pa ni dge sbyong de dang lhan cig nyal yang ltung bar mi 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge sbyong dang lhan cig nyal na yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba yod de 'og nas 'chad do // de yod pas so // dge slong slob pa'am nye gnas dge sbyong yod pa ni dge sbyong de dang lhan cig nyal yang ltung bar mi 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.ğŸ”½If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.ğŸ”½If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.ğŸ”½If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.

original: gnas de na sdig pa'i dge slong 'dug na'o //
analyzed: gnas de na sdig pa'i dge slong 'dug na'o //
translated: If a monk is sick, he may sleep with a novice monk, but not with a layperson.

original: bdag cag gi gnas na dge sbyong kha 'dren cing 'phrog pa dang dge sbyong gi rkub tu mi tshangs par spyod pa'i dge slong sdig pa spyod pa yod na bdag gi slob ma dge sbyong dang nub gnyis las lhag par nyal kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bdag cag gi gnas na dge sbyong kha 'dren cing 'phrog pa dang dge sbyong gi rkub tu mi tshangs par spyod pa'i dge slong sdig pa spyod pa yod na bdag gi slob ma dge sbyong dang nub gnyis las lhag par nyal kyang nyes med /
translated: If in our community there is a monk who is a false ascetic, who is a thief, who is unchaste, who is a sinner, then my disciples, though they sleep with two women, are not guilty.

original: bskrad par nan tan byas sam byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad par nan tan byas sam byed pa'o //
translated: Do you insist on expelling them?

original: @163b bdag cag gi 'khor na sdig ba byas pa'i dge sbyong yod na bdag cag gis kyang bskrad /
analyzed: @163b bdag cag gi 'khor na sdig ba byas pa'i dge sbyong yod na bdag cag gis kyang bskrad /
translated: If in our community there is a false ascetic who has committed a sin, we ourselves expel him.

original: bdag gi ma nus na rgyal po'am zhang blon la byas te 'ang bskrad tshul phyi ma'i dus na thog ma'i zla ba gnyis kyi tshe na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ma nus na rgyal po'am zhang blon la byas te 'ang bskrad tshul phyi ma'i dus na thog ma'i zla ba gnyis kyi tshe na'o //
translated: If we are unable to do so, we ask the king or the ministers to expel him.

original: sdig pa byed pa'i dge slong skrod ma nus na tshul phyi mar zhugs kyang zla ba gnyis lon nas tshul dral te bdag gi dge sbyong sngon du bcug la bkri'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i dge slong skrod ma nus na tshul phyi mar zhugs kyang zla ba gnyis lon nas tshul dral te bdag gi dge sbyong sngon du bcug la bkri'o //
translated: If we are unable to expel the sinful monk, we enter the rainy season retreat, but after two months we break the retreat and put our own ascetic in his place.

original: de las lhag par mi gnas /
analyzed: de las lhag par mi gnas /
translated: We do not stay longer than that.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas zla ba gnyis lon na de las ring du mi bsdad par mdo ltag ma ltar 'gro //
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas zla ba gnyis lon na de las ring du mi bsdad par mdo ltag ma ltar 'gro //
translated: If he has entered the latter mode for two months, he should not stay longer than that, but should leave like a bird flying away.

original: ma song na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma song na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not leave, he will fall into a downfall.

original: snga ma'i tshul ni mi dgos /
analyzed: snga ma'i tshul ni mi dgos /
translated: The former mode is not necessary.

original: sdig pa'i dge slong yod na tshul snga mar mi bsrung mi 'jug par bdag gi dge sbyong khrid la 'gro /
analyzed: sdig pa'i dge slong yod na tshul snga mar mi bsrung mi 'jug par bdag gi dge sbyong khrid la 'gro /
translated: If there is a sinful monk, he should not protect or enter the former mode, but should take his own ascetic with him and go.

original: phan chad pa 'ang mi bsrung /
analyzed: phan chad pa 'ang mi bsrung /
translated: He should not protect the former mode for more than two months.ğŸ”½Even if he has entered the former mode, if there is a sinful monk, he should not protect it for two months and stay there, but should break the former mode and take his own ascetic with him and go.

original: tshul snga mar zhugs kyang sdig pa'i dge slong yod na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bsrungs shing bsdad mi dgos kyi tshul phyi ma yod pas snga ma dral te dge sbyong khrid la song shig / de lta na mi gnas pa'i dge slong mi gzhag / bdag
analyzed: tshul snga mar zhugs kyang sdig pa'i dge slong yod na zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bsrungs shing bsdad mi dgos kyi tshul phyi ma yod pas snga ma dral te dge sbyong khrid la song shig / de lta na mi gnas pa'i dge slong mi gzhag / bdag
translated: In that way, he should not leave a non-staying monk.

original: cag gi 'khor na sdig pa'i dge slong yod na gzhan gyi dge sbyong nye gnas su 'ang mi gzhag / dge sbyong gsar du rab tu 'byung ba zhig yod na 'ang rab tu mi dbyung ngo //
analyzed: cag gi 'khor na sdig pa'i dge slong yod na gzhan gyi dge sbyong nye gnas su 'ang mi gzhag / dge sbyong gsar du rab tu 'byung ba zhig yod na 'ang rab tu mi dbyung ngo //
translated: If there is a sinful monk in our retinue, he should not leave another ascetic as his attendant, and if there is a new ascetic who has gone forth, he should not go forth.

original: gnyid ltung ste myos na lam du dge sbyong mthun du byas te 'gro'o //
analyzed: gnyid ltung ste myos na lam du dge sbyong mthun du byas te 'gro'o //
translated: If he falls asleep and is confused, he should make the spiritual practitioner go first and then follow him.

original: dge sbyong khrid de song ba las dge sbyong chad cing gnyid kyis myos na dge sbyong phyi bzhin 'brang du mi gzhug gi sngon du bcug la bkri'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong khrid de song ba las dge sbyong chad cing gnyid kyis myos na dge sbyong phyi bzhin 'brang du mi gzhug gi sngon du bcug la bkri'o //
translated: If the spiritual practitioner is tired and confused by sleep, he should not be made to follow, but should be made to go first and the monk should follow him.

original: de ste bkres na de'i tshe tshul dus pas sngar zas sbyin /
analyzed: de ste bkres na de'i tshe tshul dus pas sngar zas sbyin /
translated: If he is hungry, then at that time, he should be given food first.

original: dge sbyong bkres shing 'gro mi phong na gdugs tshod la ma bab par zan sbyin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong bkres shing 'gro mi phong na gdugs tshod la ma bab par zan sbyin no //
translated: If the spiritual practitioner is hungry and cannot go, he should be given food before noon.

original: bkres te mi bzod cing zas slong na phyi dro byin kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: bkres te mi bzod cing zas slong na phyi dro byin kyang nyes med do //
translated: If he is hungry and cannot wait, and begs for food, there is no fault in giving it to him in the afternoon.

original: de ste yang dus la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ste yang dus la yang ngo //
translated: If it is also the time,

original: mdo ltag ma ltar sngar zan byin kyang gdugs tshod kyi tshe'ang zas sbyin no //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar sngar zan byin kyang gdugs tshod kyi tshe'ang zas sbyin no //
translated: even if he was given food earlier, he should be given food at noon.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
translated: Sleeping with one who is not fully ordained.

original: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall is completed by sleeping with him.

original: // / chos la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / chos la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation of the points of training.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa shes te ci ltar gang bar du gcod pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa shes te ci ltar gang bar du gcod pa'i chos /
translated: A monk said, I understand the Bhagavan's explanation of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de bsnyen kyang bar du gcod par mi @164a * //ğŸ”½'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa dge slong zhig 'di skad ces smras te 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa ni shes te ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa ni de spyad kyang bar du gcod par mi
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de bsnyen kyang bar du gcod par mi @164a * // 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa dge slong zhig 'di skad ces smras te 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa ni shes te ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa ni de spyad kyang bar du gcod par mi
translated: Even if I practice what the Bhagavan said is an obstruction, it will not become an obstruction.

original: 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i dge slong de la dge slong dag gis 'di skad ces bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan ba khyod 'di skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa ni shes te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i dge slong de la dge slong dag gis 'di skad ces bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan ba khyod 'di skad ma zer cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa ni shes te /
translated: The other monks said to that monk, Venerable, do not say that. The Bhagavan's explanation of the Dharma is profound.

original: de ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs ba de spyad kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs ba de spyad kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: It is not that even if you practice what the Bhagavan said is an obstruction, it will not become an obstruction.

original: bcom ldan 'das la skur ba ma 'debs shig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pas dge bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la skur ba ma 'debs shig / bcom ldan 'das la skur pas dge bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Slandering the Bhagavat is not virtuous.ğŸ”½The Bhagavat has not said that, and in many scriptures he has said that an obstacle is an obstacle to Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ste du ma'i gzhung las kyang bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi ni bar gcod do zhes gsungs te de spyad pas bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis 'di lta bu'i sdig pa la lta ba thong shig ces bsgo ste ma mnyan
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ste du ma'i gzhung las kyang bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi ni bar gcod do zhes gsungs te de spyad pas bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis 'di lta bu'i sdig pa la lta ba thong shig ces bsgo ste ma mnyan
translated: If one practices that, it will be an obstacle. Therefore, give up the view of such a sin.

original: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not listen, there is a downfall.

original: lan gsum bsgo ba'i thabs dang bshad pa ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum la 'jug gi bzhi bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lan gsum bsgo ba'i thabs dang bshad pa ni dge 'dun gyi lhag ma bcu gsum la 'jug gi bzhi bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The method of admonishing up to three times and the explanation are like the fourth rule of the class of thirteen partial defeats.

original: tshig tsam nas mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: tshig tsam nas mi gtong ba'o //
translated: One does not give up just by words.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba las de skad ma zer bar thong shig ces lan gsum du bsgo bar gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas te ma btang na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba las de skad ma zer bar thong shig ces lan gsum du bsgo bar gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas te ma btang na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one says, â€œIt is not an obstacle,â€ one should be admonished up to three times, â€œDo not say that!â€ If one does not stop, there is a downfall.

original: 'di smad pa'i phyir de la zhu ba bya /
analyzed: 'di smad pa'i phyir de la zhu ba bya /
translated: One should request and petition the saá¹…gha to admonish that person.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar lan gsum du bsgo ste ma nyan pa'i dge slong de chos la 'gal zhis nyes pa mi gtong ba'i phyir dge 'dun smad pa'i las byas te bskrad do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar lan gsum du bsgo ste ma nyan pa'i dge slong de chos la 'gal zhis nyes pa mi gtong ba'i phyir dge 'dun smad pa'i las byas te bskrad do //
translated: The Buddha admonished him three times, but the monk would not listen. The Buddha then performed the act of censuring the Saá¹…gha, expelling the monk for not giving up his view.

original: lta bar zhugs ba mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: lta bar zhugs ba mi gtong ba'o //
translated: â€œNot giving up a view that has been entered into.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of claiming that what the Bhagavat taught is not an obstacle to awakening is complete.

original: // / smra ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / smra ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: â€œThe downfall of speakingâ€ is explained as follows.

original: 'bhrid / ltag tu bshad pa ltar dge slong bskrad pa shes bzhin du 'grogs pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bhrid / ltag tu bshad pa ltar dge slong bskrad pa shes bzhin du 'grogs pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: â€œLike the previous explanation, one commits a downfall by associating with a monk who has been expelled, knowing that he has been expelled.

original: de skad zer spangs pa slar ma byas pa'i dge slong las so //
analyzed: de skad zer spangs pa slar ma byas pa'i dge slong las so //
translated: â€œA monk who has been admonished three times for saying such things and has not given up his view is expelled.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa @164b las bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la lan gsum bsgo ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa @164b las bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la lan gsum bsgo ste /
translated: â€œThe Buddha taught that certain things are obstacles to awakening, but I say that they are not obstacles.â€

original: ma mnyan cing slar ma bshags pa'i dge slong dang bcar zhing 'grogs pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mnyan cing slar ma bshags pa'i dge slong dang bcar zhing 'grogs pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œOne commits a downfall by associating with a monk who has been admonished three times and has not given up his view.â€

original: bstan pa byin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bstan pa byin pa yang ngo //
translated: And also if one teaches the doctrine to one who has been expelled.

original: dge slong bskrad pa klog pa dang kha don 'bul ba la bstan cing bslabs na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bskrad pa klog pa dang kha don 'bul ba la bstan cing bslabs na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one teaches and instructs a monk who has been expelled to recite and to recite aloud, there is an offense.

original: kun 'dril ba dang / chos dang las byed pa la sogs pa bskrad pa'i dge slong 'dri zhing 'ong ba la bstan na 'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'dril ba dang / chos dang las byed pa la sogs pa bskrad pa'i dge slong 'dri zhing 'ong ba la bstan na 'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If one teaches to a monk who has been expelled and who is coming to ask about the Dharma, the rites, and so forth, there is an offense.

original: gnas bca' ba dang / bskrad pa'i dge slong de bdag la gnas 'char bcug na 'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas bca' ba dang / bskrad pa'i dge slong de bdag la gnas 'char bcug na 'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If one allows a monk who has been expelled to stay in oneâ€™s dwelling, there is an offense.

original: bstan pa dang 'chad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bstan pa dang 'chad pa yang ngo //
translated: And also if one teaches and explains the doctrine to him.

original: chos dang bsam gtan la sogs pa bstan cing bshad na 'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang bsam gtan la sogs pa bstan cing bshad na 'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If one teaches and explains the Dharma, concentration, and so forth to him, there is an offense.

original: lta ba 'chags pa bskrad pa'i dge slong de la khyod nyes pa med de dge 'dun gyis bskrad pa mi rigs na zhes smras na'ang ltung /ğŸ”½zang zing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba 'chags pa bskrad pa'i dge slong de la khyod nyes pa med de dge 'dun gyis bskrad pa mi rigs na zhes smras na'ang ltung / zang zing spyod pa'o //
translated: If one says to a monk who has been expelled, â€œYour view is correct. It is not right that the saá¹…gha has expelled you,â€ there is an offense.ğŸ”½If one gives him material things.

original: bskrad pa'i dge slong de bcar zhing zas dang gos la sogs pa byin pa'ang ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bskrad pa'i dge slong de bcar zhing zas dang gos la sogs pa byin pa'ang ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one gives food, clothing, and so forth to a monk who has been expelled, there is an offense.

original: g-yog bdag gir byas pa /
analyzed: g-yog bdag gir byas pa /
translated: Taking on a servant.

original: bskrad pa'i dge slong de bdag gi g-yog tu las dag byed du bcug na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa'i dge slong de bdag gi g-yog tu las dag byed du bcug na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If the monk who has been expelled is made to work as a servant, there is a downfall.

original: khyim du lhan cig nyal ba /
analyzed: khyim du lhan cig nyal ba /
translated: Sleeping together in a house.

original: bskrad pa'i dge slong de dang khyim gcig gi nang na lhan cig nyal na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa'i dge slong de dang khyim gcig gi nang na lhan cig nyal na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If the monk who has been expelled sleeps together in the same house, there is a downfall.

original: 'thas so // khyim gcig gi nang na nyal te skya rengs 'byung na 'ang ltung ngo //
analyzed: 'thas so // khyim gcig gi nang na nyal te skya rengs 'byung na 'ang ltung ngo //
translated: If they sleep in the same house, there is a downfall when dawn breaks.ğŸ”½Dawn means when the first light of dawn appears.

original: nub mo'o // skya rengs 'byung ba'i ni zhag gcig lon pa'i nub mo 'das pa'i skya rengs sa 'byung na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: nub mo'o // skya rengs 'byung ba'i ni zhag gcig lon pa'i nub mo 'das pa'i skya rengs sa 'byung na ltung ba'o //
translated: If they sleep in the same house, there is a downfall when the night has passed and the first light of dawn appears.

original: gzhan yang 'du ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du ba'o //
translated: Also, associating.

original: bskrad pa'i dge slong de dang lhan cig 'grogs kyang rung gtam byas kyang rung ste ci spyad kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskrad pa'i dge slong de dang lhan cig 'grogs kyang rung gtam byas kyang rung ste ci spyad kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one associates with the monk who has been expelled, whether by walking or talking, there is a downfall.

original: ma gtogs pa ni nad pa dang lta ba dbye ba bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni nad pa dang lta ba dbye ba bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Except if he is sick or if one is separating from a view.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni bskrad pa'i dge slong nad kyis btab ste gso ba dang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer zhing log pa bltas pa dang bral zhing 'chags su gzhug pa'i phyir bsnyen cing bcar ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni bskrad pa'i dge slong nad kyis btab ste gso ba dang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer zhing log pa bltas pa dang bral zhing 'chags su gzhug pa'i phyir bsnyen cing bcar ba ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if the expelled monk is sick and is being cured, or if he is free from wrong views and is approaching the Saá¹…gha to confess his faults.

original: spangs pa dang 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa dang 'dug pa'o //
translated: This has two types: abandoning and remaining.

original: dge slong bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir bskrad pa dang 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /ğŸ”½// / dge sbyong gi ltung ba @165a * //
analyzed: dge slong bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyir bskrad pa dang 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / dge sbyong gi ltung ba @165a * //
translated: The downfall of associating with an expelled monk is complete.

original: la 'chad de /ğŸ”½tshig de brtsams nas mi gtong ba'i dge sbyong ma rung bar bya /
analyzed: la 'chad de / tshig de brtsams nas mi gtong ba'i dge sbyong ma rung bar bya /
translated: The downfall of a renunciate is explained.ğŸ”½If a renunciate does not stop saying, â€œThe Buddha taught that desire is an obstacle, but it is not an obstacle,â€ and the Saá¹…gha has ordered him to stop,

original: dge sbyong zhig 'di skad zer te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa ni bar du gcod do zhes gsungs pa bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis de skad ma zer cig ces dge 'dun gyis bsgo ste ma mnyan
analyzed: dge sbyong zhig 'di skad zer te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa ni bar du gcod do zhes gsungs pa bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la bar du gcod par 'gyur gyis de skad ma zer cig ces dge 'dun gyis bsgo ste ma mnyan
translated: but he does not listen,

original: cing ma btang na dge spyong de bskrad do //
analyzed: cing ma btang na dge spyong de bskrad do //
translated: If you do not release him, we will expel you.

original: au pa nan da'i slob ma dge sbyong dang dge sbyong gzhan du rtse zhing sdig pa spyad pa dgra bcom pa dang bskur pa las bcas /
analyzed: au pa nan da'i slob ma dge sbyong dang dge sbyong gzhan du rtse zhing sdig pa spyad pa dgra bcom pa dang bskur pa las bcas /
translated: The disciples of Upananda, the monks who play and practice evil, are like arhats and are not to be expelled.ğŸ”½Previously, by the four-part action of requesting, you were called this, but later, by the four-part action of requesting, you are called that.

original: sngar zhu ba bzhi'i las kyis khyod ces nas phyis ma rung bar khyod do zhes rim gyis zhu ba byed de thong shig 'di lta bu'i gzugs sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa las dang po glag pa bya ste gnyis so zhes so sor de'i mthar dge slong
analyzed: sngar zhu ba bzhi'i las kyis khyod ces nas phyis ma rung bar khyod do zhes rim gyis zhu ba byed de thong shig 'di lta bu'i gzugs sdig pa la lta bar gyur pa las dang po glag pa bya ste gnyis so zhes so sor de'i mthar dge slong
translated: Release him. Such a form has become a view of evil. This is the first offense.ğŸ”½The monk should admonish him thus.

original: gis bsgo / mdo ltag ma ltar dge sbyong bskrad pa ni dge 'dun gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byed pa mthong bar mi dgug gi pho nyar dge slong cig btang ste bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de thong shig ma btang na khyod dge 'dun gyis
analyzed: gis bsgo / mdo ltag ma ltar dge sbyong bskrad pa ni dge 'dun gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byed pa mthong bar mi dgug gi pho nyar dge slong cig btang ste bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de thong shig ma btang na khyod dge 'dun gyis

analyzed: de dag ni mtshon cha ste g-yul du spyod pa dang rol mo'i yo byad kyis spyad kyang ngo //
translated: They are weapons, used in battle, and musical instruments.

original: dgos pa'i phyir dgos par grub na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i phyir dgos par grub na rtsa ba'o //
translated: If it is established as necessary for a purpose, it is the root.

original: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad ni ma chad cing ma bral te so so las su spyad du rung ba la @166b bzung na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad ni ma chad cing ma bral te so so las su spyad du rung ba la @166b bzung na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one touches weapons and musical instruments in a temple, except for the purpose of using them, it is a downfall.

original: ma grub na nyes byas pa /
analyzed: ma grub na nyes byas pa /
translated: If they are not usable, it is a minor infraction.

original: mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad chag gam grugs te spyad du mi rung pa la reg na nyes byas /
analyzed: mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad chag gam grugs te spyad du mi rung pa la reg na nyes byas /
translated: If one touches weapons and musical instruments that are broken or damaged and unusable, it is a minor infraction.

original: ma gtogs pa ni bdag gi bya bar ma zhugs pa nor chud mi gzan pa'i sems kyis gtsug lag khang dang de'i mtshams su gtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni bdag gi bya bar ma zhugs pa nor chud mi gzan pa'i sems kyis gtsug lag khang dang de'i mtshams su gtogs pa na'o //
translated: The exception is if one touches them in the temple or in its vicinity with the intention of not wasting the wealth that has been donated for the upkeep of the temple.

original: rin po che dang rin po che la gtogs pa bzung yang nyes pa med pa ni gtsug lag khang gi phyir tshun chad kyi nang ngam ra ba'i phyi rol gtsug lag khang gi mtshams su gtogs pa tshun chad gcig na gzhan gyi nor 'khyam pa zhig 'dug na
analyzed: rin po che dang rin po che la gtogs pa bzung yang nyes pa med pa ni gtsug lag khang gi phyir tshun chad kyi nang ngam ra ba'i phyi rol gtsug lag khang gi mtshams su gtogs pa tshun chad gcig na gzhan gyi nor 'khyam pa zhig 'dug na
translated: There is no fault if one touches precious objects or objects belonging to the precious Three Jewels if they are in the temple or in its vicinity, or if one touches precious objects that have been left in the temple by their owners.

original: nor bdag su'i yin na slar sbyin pa'i phyir mi stor bar bya bar bsams te bdag gis blangs sam gzhan len du bcug kyang nyes med /
analyzed: nor bdag su'i yin na slar sbyin pa'i phyir mi stor bar bya bar bsams te bdag gis blangs sam gzhan len du bcug kyang nyes med /
translated: If you think, â€œI will take it or have someone else take it in order to not lose it and return it to the owner of the object,â€ there is no fault.

original: de la mi g-yel bar ro //
analyzed: de la mi g-yel bar ro //
translated: Be diligent in that.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar rdzas blangs ba de nor bdag slar sbyin pa'i phyir ma stor bar nan tan tu bsrung /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar rdzas blangs ba de nor bdag slar sbyin pa'i phyir ma stor bar nan tan tu bsrung /
translated: If you take the object, in order to return it to the owner of the object, you should diligently protect it.

original: zhag bdun nam brgyad du de'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun nam brgyad du de'i mtshams su'o //
translated: For seven or eight days, you should keep it in a place that is not exposed.

original: slar sbyin pa'i phyir blangs pa'i nor de nor bdag len du ma 'ongs sam khungs ma phyin na bdag nyid kyi lag tu zhag bdun nam brgyad du chongs shig /'gro na nyal nyil lam lo ma bsdus pas g-yogs /
analyzed: slar sbyin pa'i phyir blangs pa'i nor de nor bdag len du ma 'ongs sam khungs ma phyin na bdag nyid kyi lag tu zhag bdun nam brgyad du chongs shig /'gro na nyal nyil lam lo ma bsdus pas g-yogs /
translated: If the owner of the object does not come to claim it or if you cannot find the owner, keep it in your possession for seven or eight days.ğŸ”½If you go somewhere else, cover it with grass or leaves.

original: rnyed pa'i gzhi de nyid du sbar rung ba zhig gam blangs pa las bdag gud du 'gro na sa'am sbur ma la sogs pas g-yogs te gzhan gyis mi rnyed bar sbas la 'gro /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i gzhi de nyid du sbar rung ba zhig gam blangs pa las bdag gud du 'gro na sa'am sbur ma la sogs pas g-yogs te gzhan gyis mi rnyed bar sbas la 'gro /
translated: If you are able to leave it at the place where you found it, do so. If you take it with you, cover it so that others will not see it.

original: rtags lam phab na nga'i zhes zer yang mi sbyin /
analyzed: rtags lam phab na nga'i zhes zer yang mi sbyin /
translated: If someone claims it, saying, â€œThis is mine,â€ do not give it to him.

original: nor rnyed pa de la nor bdag nga yin zhes zer zhing len pa zhig 'ongs na nor mi bstan par spu rtags dris te mthun na sbyin spu rtags dang mi mthun na mi sbyin /
analyzed: nor rnyed pa de la nor bdag nga yin zhes zer zhing len pa zhig 'ongs na nor mi bstan par spu rtags dris te mthun na sbyin spu rtags dang mi mthun na mi sbyin /
translated: If the owner of the lost property comes and says, â€œThis is my property,â€ the monk should ask him to describe the distinguishing marks of the object. If the description agrees with the marks on the object, the monk should return it to him. If the description does not agree, the monk should not return the object.

original: ma 'ongs te 'das na dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug / nor rnyed pa de zhag brgyad kyi bar du bsdad de nor bdag ma 'ongs shing khungs ma phyin na bdag gi lag na mi bcang bar dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug go //ğŸ”½zla ba drug gi mtha'i bar du bcad /
analyzed: ma 'ongs te 'das na dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug / nor rnyed pa de zhag brgyad kyi bar du bsdad de nor bdag ma 'ongs shing khungs ma phyin na bdag gi lag na mi bcang bar dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug go // zla ba drug gi mtha'i bar du bcad /
translated: If the owner does not come within eight days, the object should be put in the Sanghaâ€™s storehouse.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar dge 'dun gyi mdzod du bzhag pa las nor bdag ma 'ongs na zla ba drug gi bar du mdzod du bzhag ste bcad /ğŸ”½'das te ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyis gang du rnyed pa @167a * //

translated: If the owner of the lost property comes after eight days, the object should be kept in the Sanghaâ€™s storehouse for six months.ğŸ”½If the owner does not come within six months, the object should be divided among the monks.ğŸ”½If the owner comes after six months, the object should be returned to him.

original: der sbyar / zla ba drug gi bar du dge 'dun gyi mdzod du bzhag kyang nor bdag ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dang nye ba zhig na 'dug pa las rnyed na ni sangs rgyas kyi dkor du bya'o //
analyzed: der sbyar / zla ba drug gi bar du dge 'dun gyi mdzod du bzhag kyang nor bdag ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas kyi mchod rten dang nye ba zhig na 'dug pa las rnyed na ni sangs rgyas kyi dkor du bya'o //
translated: If the owner does not come forward, the property should be placed in the treasury of the community of monks and kept there for six months. If the owner is found, the property should be given to him.

original: dge 'dun dang nye ba zhig nas rnyed de blangs na dge 'dun gyi dkor du bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang nye ba zhig nas rnyed de blangs na dge 'dun gyi dkor du bya'o //
translated: If the owner is not found, the property should be given to the community of monks.

original: mi mkho na btsong la mkho zhing brtan par ro //
analyzed: mi mkho na btsong la mkho zhing brtan par ro //
translated: If the property is not needed by the community, it should be sold and the proceeds used to purchase articles that are needed and durable.

original: dge 'dun nam sangs rgyas la phul ba'i nor de spyad du mi mkho na phyis nor bdag len du 'ongs na gtan stor bar mi bya ba'i phyir zangs lta bu brtan par 'dug pa'i rdzas su btsong /
analyzed: dge 'dun nam sangs rgyas la phul ba'i nor de spyad du mi mkho na phyis nor bdag len du 'ongs na gtan stor bar mi bya ba'i phyir zangs lta bu brtan par 'dug pa'i rdzas su btsong /
translated: If the property offered to the community or to the Buddha is not needed, it should be sold and the proceeds used to purchase articles that are needed and durable, so that the property will not be lost.

original: de ste bdag po 'ongs na gnang ba bslang mi 'dod na sbyin //
analyzed: de ste bdag po 'ongs na gnang ba bslang mi 'dod na sbyin //
translated: If the owner comes forward and does not want to take back the property, it should be given to him.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar btsongs pa las nor bdag 'ongs nas khyod kyi bsod nams su rung ba'i phyir dkon mchog la phul te spu bsgyur ba 'di yin gyis dad pa bskyed cig ces dad pa bskyed du mi btub tu 'dod ces zer na slar sbyin /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar btsongs pa las nor bdag 'ongs nas khyod kyi bsod nams su rung ba'i phyir dkon mchog la phul te spu bsgyur ba 'di yin gyis dad pa bskyed cig ces dad pa bskyed du mi btub tu 'dod ces zer na slar sbyin /
translated: If he says, â€œI was sold like the second SÅ«tra, and the owner of the wealth came and said, â€˜This is the hair of the wealth that I offered to the Three Jewels for your merit. Develop faith,â€™ but I could not develop faith,â€ then give it back.ğŸ”½If he says, â€œIf I develop faith, do you not think that this is also much? For how long will you protect it?â€ say, â€œSay, â€˜I will protect it for this long.â€™ â€

translated: If he says, â€œI was sold like the second SÅ«tra, and the hair of the wealth was given back. I want the interest on the wealth, the wages for using it, and so on,â€

original: 'di srid du ngas bsrungs te nor dngos ma stor bar byin pa 'di nyid che zhing mang bar mi sems sam zhes shags gdab /
analyzed: 'di srid du ngas bsrungs te nor dngos ma stor bar byin pa 'di nyid che zhing mang bar mi sems sam zhes shags gdab /
translated: say, â€œI have protected it for this long. Do you not think that this is much and great, that I have given back the wealth without losing any?â€

original: nor bu la sogs pa bdar phug na mkho ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu la sogs pa bdar phug na mkho ba'o //
translated: If he says, â€œI want to test the jewels and so on,â€ it is necessary.

original: nor bu byi bdar byas shing phug pa la reg pa ni ltung ba ma bdar ma phug pa la reg pa ni nyes byas mgul 'khor dang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang phreng ba dang phreng phyed pa dang gzhug par na'o //
analyzed: nor bu byi bdar byas shing phug pa la reg pa ni ltung ba ma bdar ma phug pa la reg pa ni nyes byas mgul 'khor dang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang phreng ba dang phreng phyed pa dang gzhug par na'o //
translated: If one touches a jewel that has been polished and pierced, it is a downfall; if one touches one that has not been polished or pierced, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gser dngul dang nor bu'i mgul 'khor dang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang phreng ba dang do shal la sogs pa spyad cing gzhug tu rung ba la bzung ba ni ltung ba /
analyzed: gser dngul dang nor bu'i mgul 'khor dang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang phreng ba dang do shal la sogs pa spyad cing gzhug tu rung ba la bzung ba ni ltung ba /
translated: If one wears a golden or silver necklace, bracelet, armlet, garland, half-garland, or anklet that is suitable for a noble one, it is a downfall.

original: chag cing chad te spyad du mi rung ba la bzung ba ni nyes byas /
analyzed: chag cing chad te spyad du mi rung ba la bzung ba ni nyes byas /
translated: If one wears a broken or damaged one that is not suitable for a noble one, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rol mo byin na dang be nu dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang mu gho sha rnams rgyud dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: rol mo byin na dang be nu dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang mu gho sha rnams rgyud dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The following are suitable for a noble one: the veá¹‡u, the bindu, the baliratha, the mahÄti, and the mughoá¹£a.

original: rol mo spyad pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni byi bang sha dags te rgyud dang bcas pa la bzung na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: rol mo spyad pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni byi bang sha dags te rgyud dang bcas pa la bzung na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one wears any of these musical instruments mentioned by name, it is a downfall if they are suitable for a noble one.

original: rgyud dang so sor bral ba ni nyes byas /
analyzed: rgyud dang so sor bral ba ni nyes byas /
translated: If they are not suitable for a noble one, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zer ba gling bu dang / dung dang bud @167b dung dang / rnga dang rnga bo che ste gzings dang / bi dhri dang rnga be ri dang / pa ta ha dang rnga chung du lag pa gnyis kyis brdab pa dang / mu ra ba rnams so //
analyzed: zer ba gling bu dang / dung dang bud @167b dung dang / rnga dang rnga bo che ste gzings dang / bi dhri dang rnga be ri dang / pa ta ha dang rnga chung du lag pa gnyis kyis brdab pa dang / mu ra ba rnams so //
translated: The flute is a flute, a conch, a horn, a drum, a large drum, a kettledrum, a small kettledrum, and a cymbal.

original: rdzam dang las byas pa'i rnga dang 'di rnams la reg na'ang ltung ngo //
analyzed: rdzam dang las byas pa'i rnga dang 'di rnams la reg na'ang ltung ngo //
translated: If one touches these, one commits an offense.

original: gzhu rgyud dang bcas na'o //
analyzed: gzhu rgyud dang bcas na'o //
translated: With a bow means with a bow and arrow.

original: gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa la reg na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa la reg na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one touches a bow and arrow, one commits an offense.

original: de bzhin du ral gri dang zor ral dang so gcig pa dang mdung dang lag mdung dang ae ta dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du ral gri dang zor ral dang so gcig pa dang mdung dang lag mdung dang ae ta dag go //
translated: Similarly, sword means a sword, spear means a spear, javelin means a javelin, and axe means an axe.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyad du rung ba la reg na'ang ltung /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyad du rung ba la reg na'ang ltung /
translated: If one touches these, which are mentioned by name, that are suitable for use, one commits an offense.

original: spyad du mi rung na nyes byas /
analyzed: spyad du mi rung na nyes byas /
translated: If they are not suitable for use, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mda' dang lcags mda' dang stag mda' med bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mda' dang lcags mda' dang stag mda' med bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Arrow means an arrow, iron arrow means an iron arrow, tiger arrow means a tiger arrow, and with a shaft means with a shaft.

original: mda'i ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyad du rung zhing mde'u dang bcas pa la reg na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mda'i ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyad du rung zhing mde'u dang bcas pa la reg na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If one touches these weapons, which are mentioned by name, when they are equipped with arrows, there is an offense.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i sku gzugs la yang ngo //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i sku gzugs la yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one touches an image of the Teacher which contains relics.

original: sha ri ram nang na yod pa'i sku gzugs la reg na'ang ltung ba /
analyzed: sha ri ram nang na yod pa'i sku gzugs la reg na'ang ltung ba /
translated: If one touches an image which contains relics, there is an offense.

original: nyes med pa ni der ston pa'i 'du shes gzhan no //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni der ston pa'i 'du shes gzhan no //
translated: There is no offense if one has the perception of the Teacher in regard to that.

original: sha ri ram yod pa'i gzugs khyim pa'am dge sbyong med na ston pa yin par bsams shing mchod par gzung ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: sha ri ram yod pa'i gzugs khyim pa'am dge sbyong med na ston pa yin par bsams shing mchod par gzung ba ni nyes med do //
translated: If there is no layman or ascetic present, and one thinks that the image contains relics, and one worships it, there is no offense.

original: nor bu dang zan dang sog ma'i phreng ba dang chu sbrang dang ma til gyi sbal skad dang bal gzhu dang mde'u gzhu ni phyed do //
analyzed: nor bu dang zan dang sog ma'i phreng ba dang chu sbrang dang ma til gyi sbal skad dang bal gzhu dang mde'u gzhu ni phyed do //
translated: If one touches a jewel, a grain of rice, a straw, a bee, a frog, a spider, a bow, or an arrow, there is a serious transgression.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la reg cing byas na'ang nyes byas so //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la reg cing byas na'ang nyes byas so //
translated: If one touches or makes these, which are mentioned by name, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gser gyi thu lum mo mkho ba'o //
analyzed: gser gyi thu lum mo mkho ba'o //
translated: A lump of gold is a requisite.

original: gser dang dngul gyi gar bu dang sbram dang gser phye dang dgog la sogs pa byad du ma byas pa la reg pa ni nyes byas /ğŸ”½sdangs na gzung ngam bdag gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi'am mchod rten gyi gser dngul sbos te song shig 'jigs pa'i rkyen cig byung ste dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor gser dngul lam rin po che la sogs pa bkram pa'am ma brubs pa la bdag gis brub
analyzed: gser dang dngul gyi gar bu dang sbram dang gser phye dang dgog la sogs pa byad du ma byas pa la reg pa ni nyes byas / sdangs na gzung ngam bdag gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi'am mchod rten gyi gser dngul sbos te song shig 'jigs pa'i rkyen cig byung ste dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor gser dngul lam rin po che la sogs pa bkram pa'am ma brubs pa la bdag gis brub
translated: If one touches gold, silver, or precious substances that are not fashioned into something, it is a minor infraction.

original: cing gzhug nus pa tsam gyis chod na brubs te sdus la song shig reg kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: cing gzhug nus pa tsam gyis chod na brubs te sdus la song shig reg kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one is frightened, one should hide the gold and silver of the community or of the stÅ«pa, and then go. If a frightening situation arises, and one is able to hide the wealth of the Three Jewels, such as gold, silver, or precious substances, whether or not they are spread out, one should do so and then go. If one touches them, there is no fault.

original: dad pa'am dge sbyong gis so //
analyzed: dad pa'am dge sbyong gis so //
translated: If there is a faithful person or a renunciate,

original: ltag ma ltar brub pa dge sbyong dang khyim pa yod na bdag gis ma reg par khyim pa dang dge sbyong byed du gzhug / med na bdag gis so //ğŸ”½dkon mchog gi dkor brub pa khyim pa dang @168a * //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar brub pa dge sbyong dang khyim pa yod na bdag gis ma reg par khyim pa dang dge sbyong byed du gzhug / med na bdag gis so //ğŸ”½dkon mchog gi dkor brub pa khyim pa dang @168a * //
translated: if there is a renunciate or a layperson who is able to hide the wealth of the Three Jewels, one should not touch it oneself, but should have them do it. If there is no one, one should do it oneself.ğŸ”½If there is a layperson or a renunciate who is able to retrieve the wealth of the Three Jewels, one should not touch it oneself, but should have them do it. If there is no one, one should do it oneself.

original: dge sbyong dang khyim pa med na bdag gi brubs pa nyes med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang khyim pa med na bdag gi brubs pa nyes med do //
translated: If there are no ascetics or householders, then there is no fault in my digging up the treasure.

original: de brkos te'o //
analyzed: de brkos te'o //
translated: I will dig it up.

original: ltag tu bshad pa ltar dkon mchog gi dkor brub pa'i gnas med pa dge slong dang khyim pa'ang med na bdag gis sa brkos te spyad kyang nyes med /
analyzed: ltag tu bshad pa ltar dkon mchog gi dkor brub pa'i gnas med pa dge slong dang khyim pa'ang med na bdag gis sa brkos te spyad kyang nyes med /
translated: Just as it was explained above, if there is no place for the treasure of the Three Jewels, and no ascetics or householders, then I will dig up the earth and use it, but there is no fault.

original: med na sbyin /
analyzed: med na sbyin /
translated: If there is none, then give it.ğŸ”½Just as it was hidden, if there is no condition of fear from thieves, then take it out and leave it in the condition of the individual.

original: ltag ma ltar sbas pa las 'jigs pa'i rkyen rkun po med na phyung la so so'i rkyen du gzhag / dbyung ba'ang de bzhin nor sbas pa slar dbyung ba'i tshe dge sbyong dang khyim pa med na bdag gis phyung zhing reg kyang nyes med /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar sbas pa las 'jigs pa'i rkyen rkun po med na phyung la so so'i rkyen du gzhag / dbyung ba'ang de bzhin nor sbas pa slar dbyung ba'i tshe dge sbyong dang khyim pa med na bdag gis phyung zhing reg kyang nyes med /
translated: When the hidden treasure is taken out again, if there are no ascetics or householders, then I will take it out and touch it, but there is no fault.

original: nyes med pa ni mi ma yin pa'i gnas na bsod nams las skyes pa de ste de dag tu rin po che'i sa'am stegs la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni mi ma yin pa'i gnas na bsod nams las skyes pa de ste de dag tu rin po che'i sa'am stegs la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: There is no fault in the place of non-humans, that which is born from merit, and in those places there is also a jeweled ground or a platform and so forth.

original: lha bran lta bu kho bdag gi bsod nams kyis khang khyim dang sa gzhi yan chad rin po che dang gser dngul du 'dug pa zhig gis dge slong spyan drangs te spyad cing reg pa ni nyes med do //ğŸ”½bza' ba'i snod gzhan med na yang ngo //
analyzed: lha bran lta bu kho bdag gi bsod nams kyis khang khyim dang sa gzhi yan chad rin po che dang gser dngul du 'dug pa zhig gis dge slong spyan drangs te spyad cing reg pa ni nyes med do // bza' ba'i snod gzhan med na yang ngo //
translated: Like a god's servant, if one's own merit causes the house and ground to be made of jewels, gold and silver, and one invites a monk to use and touch them, there is no fault.ğŸ”½If there is no other vessel for eating, it is also permissible.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar reg kyang nyes med pa ni bza' ba'i snod spyad dang / rdzas gzhan med na reg kyang nyes med /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar reg kyang nyes med pa ni bza' ba'i snod spyad dang / rdzas gzhan med na reg kyang nyes med /
translated: If there is no other vessel for eating, it is also permissible to touch it.

original: mal stan du 'dug pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mal stan du 'dug pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also permissible to sit on a bed.

original: ltag tu bshad pa ltar spyan drangs ba la zhag du gnas na'ang khri stan rin po che la 'dug cing nyal ba'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: ltag tu bshad pa ltar spyan drangs ba la zhag du gnas na'ang khri stan rin po che la 'dug cing nyal ba'ang nyes med do //
translated: As explained above, if one invites a monk and stays for several days, it is also permissible to sit and sleep on a precious bed.

original: song shig theg pas so //
analyzed: song shig theg pas so //
translated: One may go by vehicle.

original: lam ring por 'gro na rta dang shing rta dang bal glang dang khyogs la bzhon du'ang rung ngo //
analyzed: lam ring por 'gro na rta dang shing rta dang bal glang dang khyogs la bzhon du'ang rung ngo //
translated: If one is traveling a long distance, it is also permissible to ride a horse, a carriage, an elephant, or a palanquin.

original: chos kyi don gyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi dbang gis te /
translated: For the sake of the purpose of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi don gyi phyir gzhan gyis bkug gam bdag chos slob pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni bzhon du dbang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi phyir gzhan gyis bkug gam bdag chos slob pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni bzhon du dbang ngo //
translated: One may ride a vehicle when summoned by others for the sake of the Dharma, or when going to study the Dharma.

original: rgyan can la ma yin /
analyzed: rgyan can la ma yin /
translated: One should not ride a vehicle

original: rta dang shing rta la sogs pa gser dngul dang rin po ches brgyan pa la mi bzhon /
analyzed: rta dang shing rta la sogs pa gser dngul dang rin po ches brgyan pa la mi bzhon /
translated: adorned with gold, silver, and jewels, such as a horse-drawn chariot.

original: rgan po dang nad pa ma yin pa gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: rgan po dang nad pa ma yin pa gzhan ma yin /
translated: One should not ride such a vehicle unless one is old or sick.

original: chos kyi phyir bzhon du dbang ba yang nad pa dang rgan po 'gro mi phod pa bzhon du dbang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi phyir bzhon du dbang ba yang nad pa dang rgan po 'gro mi phod pa bzhon du dbang ngo //
translated: One may ride a vehicle when sick or old and unable to walk, but only for the sake of the Dharma.

original: 'dug cing chos nyan pa'i phyir rin po che'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pa yid la bya ste bcom na'o //
analyzed: 'dug cing chos nyan pa'i phyir rin po che'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pa yid la bya ste bcom na'o //
translated: One may sit on a jeweled lion throne to listen to the Dharma, but only after reflecting on impermanence.

original: chos bshad pa dang kha ston byed pa'i phyir rin po che la sogs pa'i khri'i steng du 'dug na'ang mi rtag cing 'jig par 'gyur ro snyam bsams te 'dug na'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: chos bshad pa dang kha ston byed pa'i phyir rin po che la sogs pa'i khri'i steng du 'dug na'ang mi rtag cing 'jig par 'gyur ro snyam bsams te 'dug na'ang nyes med do //
translated: One may sit on a jeweled throne, etc., to teach the Dharma or to give advice, but only after reflecting that even such a throne is impermanent and will be destroyed.

original: 'jug na @168b khyim pa'i'o zhes bcas pa dag las brtag / khyim pa'i khri stan rin po che zhig la gzhag na'ang khyim pa'i rdzas de mi rtag cing 'jig pa yin te spyad pas bsod nams rtag par 'gyur ro bar bsams te 'dug na'ang nyes med /
analyzed: 'jug na @168b khyim pa'i'o zhes bcas pa dag las brtag / khyim pa'i khri stan rin po che zhig la gzhag na'ang khyim pa'i rdzas de mi rtag cing 'jig pa yin te spyad pas bsod nams rtag par 'gyur ro bar bsams te 'dug na'ang nyes med /
translated: If he sits on a householderâ€™s precious throne, he should think that the householderâ€™s possessions are impermanent and will perish, and that by using them he will acquire merit.

original: gser gyis spras dril bus bskor ba'i gos la yang ngo //
analyzed: gser gyis spras dril bus bskor ba'i gos la yang ngo //
translated: He should also think this if he wears clothes decorated with gold and surrounded by bells.

original: khyim pa'i khri stan la gser gyis spras pa'i dril bus brgyan pa zhig na'ang ltag ma ltar bsams te spyad do //ğŸ”½der nor bus spras gser dngul gyis brgyan /
analyzed: khyim pa'i khri stan la gser gyis spras pa'i dril bus brgyan pa zhig na'ang ltag ma ltar bsams te spyad do // der nor bus spras gser dngul gyis brgyan /
translated: If he sits on a householderâ€™s throne decorated with gold and bells, he should think of it as a donkeyâ€™s load.ğŸ”½If he uses a householderâ€™s throne decorated with jewels and silver,

original: khyim pa'i khri stan gser dngul gyi gyim phag dang nor bus brgyan pa zhig la spyod na'ang ltag ma ltar bsams te spyad do //
analyzed: khyim pa'i khri stan gser dngul gyi gyim phag dang nor bus brgyan pa zhig la spyod na'ang ltag ma ltar bsams te spyad do //
translated: he should think of it as a donkeyâ€™s load.

original: de dag kyang gzhug / khyim pa'i khri stan rgyan can la spyod spyod de char pa bab ste drung na khyim pa med na bskyal zhing sba ba'i phyir reg kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhug / khyim pa'i khri stan rgyan can la spyod spyod de char pa bab ste drung na khyim pa med na bskyal zhing sba ba'i phyir reg kyang nyes med do //

original: de dag bslab /
analyzed: de dag bslab /

analyzed: stottra dang sum rgyud dang dbyangs dag bslabs kyang nyes med /
