original: me tog gi rgyan mi bcing me tog sna tshogs spel zhing brgyu ba la sogs pa rgyan du bya ba'i bzo lag dar te mi bya /
analyzed: me tog gi rgyan mi bcing me tog sna tshogs spel zhing brgyu ba la sogs pa rgyan du bya ba'i bzo lag dar te mi bya /
translated: Do not make garlands of flowers; do not engage in the crafts of weaving and stringing various flowers and so forth for the purpose of ornamentation.

original: mi bgo / me tog gi rgyan la sogs pa lus la mi bgo / rol mo pa'i bya dga' mi sbyin /
analyzed: mi bgo / me tog gi rgyan la sogs pa lus la mi bgo / rol mo pa'i bya dga' mi sbyin /
translated: Do not wear flower garlands and so forth on your body; do not give rewards to musicians.

original: rol mo mkhan rol mo byed byed pa'i phyir bya dga' mi sbyin /
analyzed: rol mo mkhan rol mo byed byed pa'i phyir bya dga' mi sbyin /
translated: Do not give rewards to musicians for the purpose of making music.

original: tha mal pa'i tshe mi brgyug / rkyen ma byung bar @170b tha mal par 'gro ba'i tshe drag tu mi brgyug / drag shul dang mchang ba mi bya /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i tshe mi brgyug / rkyen ma byung bar @170b tha mal par 'gro ba'i tshe drag tu mi brgyug / drag shul dang mchang ba mi bya /
translated: Do not run at ordinary times; do not run fast when going in an ordinary way without a reason.

original: lus kyi drag shul dang mchangs pa la sogs pa mi bya /
analyzed: lus kyi drag shul dang mchangs pa la sogs pa mi bya /
translated: Do not engage in physical violence and jumping.

original: brla dang dpung pa dang nyva thabs bzlog shing brje bar mi bya /
analyzed: brla dang dpung pa dang nyva thabs bzlog shing brje bar mi bya /
translated: Do not cross your legs, arms, or ankles.

original: phyi tshar dang snga tshar la sogs pa lus kyis bsgyur ba rkang pa gnya' ba'i steng du bzhag pa la sogs pa mi bya /
analyzed: phyi tshar dang snga tshar la sogs pa lus kyis bsgyur ba rkang pa gnya' ba'i steng du bzhag pa la sogs pa mi bya /
translated: Do not do things like putting your feet on your head.

original: chu la rdo phyar mi bya /
analyzed: chu la rdo phyar mi bya /
translated: Do not throw stones into the water.

original: chu'i steng du rdo 'phangs te phyar rar 'gro ba mi bya /
analyzed: chu'i steng du rdo 'phangs te phyar rar 'gro ba mi bya /
translated: Do not throw stones into the water and make them skip across the surface.

original: lag changs kyi chus mi gtor /ğŸ”½chu sbas skad kyi sgra mi bya /
analyzed: lag changs kyi chus mi gtor / chu sbas skad kyi sgra mi bya /
translated: Do not sprinkle water with your hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by hiding and then calling out.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by slapping the water with your palm.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by sucking on the water.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by slapping the water with your palm.

original: lag pa'i thal mos chu la brdabs te sgra mi dbyung /ğŸ”½chu la phyil mo mi nyug chab brom dang sa 'greng mo la sogs pa la phyis mo mi bya /
analyzed: lag pa'i thal mos chu la brdabs te sgra mi dbyung / chu la phyil mo mi nyug chab brom dang sa 'greng mo la sogs pa la phyis mo mi bya /
translated: Do not make a sound by sucking on the water.

original: bal glang skad dang rta skad dang glang po'i skad dang rma bya dang ko ko la'i skad du mi bya /
analyzed: bal glang skad dang rta skad dang glang po'i skad dang rma bya dang ko ko la'i skad du mi bya /
translated: Do not make sounds like an elephant, a horse, a bull, a peacock, or a kokila bird.ğŸ”½Do not speak or make the sounds of those mentioned by name.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi skad mi smra mi dbyung /ğŸ”½kha'i dung 'ba' 'ba' mi bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi skad mi smra mi dbyung / kha'i dung 'ba' 'ba' mi bya /
translated: Do not make a continuous sound with your mouth.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound like a conch or a bee.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.

original: kha nas dung 'dra ba zer ba dang 'ba' 'bu blang /
analyzed: kha nas dung 'dra ba zer ba dang 'ba' 'bu blang /
translated: Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.ğŸ”½Do not make a sound by blowing into your cupped hands.

original: blug la sogs pa mi bya /ğŸ”½trog trog po'i dngos por gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: blug la sogs pa mi bya /ğŸ”½trog trog po'i dngos por gtogs pa'o //
translated: Do not

original: rin po che la reg pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rin po che la reg pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of touching precious things is complete.

original: // /'khrug pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'khrug pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of bathing is explained as follows:

original: dpyid kyi lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang dbyar gyi thog ma'i zla ba'o //
analyzed: dpyid kyi lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang dbyar gyi thog ma'i zla ba'o //
translated: The two and a half months of the remainder of spring and the first month of summer.

original: dbyar zla ra ba'i tshes nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya phan chad zla ba phyed dang gsum ni tsha bas na dus la bab te nam bkrus kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba'i tshes nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya phan chad zla ba phyed dang gsum ni tsha bas na dus la bab te nam bkrus kyang nyes med /
translated: From the first day of the first summer month until the full moon of the last summer month, the three and a half months are the hot season. It is proper to bathe at any time, and there is no fault in doing so.

original: gos med pa'i gnyis po rnyed pa de'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gos med pa'i gnyis po rnyed pa de'i tshul lo //
translated: The two without a robe are the way to obtain one.

original: yang za ba'i rkyen dus ma gtogs par na ba dang lam dang gru bzhugs pa dang las dang gzhi'i rkyen gcig byas na'ang 'khrur dbang ste nyes med do //
analyzed: yang za ba'i rkyen dus ma gtogs par na ba dang lam dang gru bzhugs pa dang las dang gzhi'i rkyen gcig byas na'ang 'khrur dbang ste nyes med do //
translated: Moreover, if one bathes for any reason other than the time of eating, or if one bathes while sick, on the road, on a boat, or for the sake of work or a special occasion, one is allowed to bathe and there is no fault.

original: rlung gis ma brtul na'o /
analyzed: rlung gis ma brtul na'o /
translated: If the wind does not blow.

original: rlung gis gos ma bzlog gam rdul gyis lus la ma phog pa las bkrus na ltung bar 'gyur gyi rlung dang rdul gyis phog pa ni bkrus kyang nyes med /
analyzed: rlung gis gos ma bzlog gam rdul gyis lus la ma phog pa las bkrus na ltung bar 'gyur gyi rlung dang rdul gyis phog pa ni bkrus kyang nyes med /
translated: If one bathes without the wind blowing to remove the robe or without dust falling on the body, one commits a downfall. If the wind and dust blow, there is no fault in bathing.

original: gos kyi grva 'gul ba de'i mthas so //
analyzed: gos kyi grva 'gul ba de'i mthas so //
translated: The edge of the robe is its border.

original: rlung gis phog pa'i tshad ni gos kyi grva 'gul ba yan chad kyis 'khrur dbang /
analyzed: rlung gis phog pa'i tshad ni gos kyi grva 'gul ba yan chad kyis 'khrur dbang /
translated: The measure of being affected by wind is that the edge of the robe moves.

original: char gyis ma bab /
analyzed: char gyis ma bab /
translated: It is not raining.

original: char gyis bab pa ni 'khrur dbang ste bkrus kyang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: char gyis bab pa ni 'khrur dbang ste bkrus kyang mi ltung ngo //
translated: If it is raining, it is permitted to bathe even if it does not reach the body.

original: de thigs gnyis ltung na'o //
analyzed: de thigs gnyis ltung na'o //
translated: If two drops fall on the body, it is permitted to bathe.

original: char gyis bab pa'i tshad ni thigs pa gnyis sam gsum phog nas 'khrur dbang ngo //
analyzed: char gyis bab pa'i tshad ni thigs pa gnyis sam gsum phog nas 'khrur dbang ngo //
translated: The measure of rain is that it is permitted to bathe when two or three drops fall on the body.

original: lus la'o // char gyis phog pa ni gos la phog pa la mi bya'i lus la @171a * //
analyzed: lus la'o // char gyis phog pa ni gos la phog pa la mi bya'i lus la @171a * //
translated: It is not that rain falling on the robe is not considered rain;

original: phog pa la 'khrur gnang ngo //
analyzed: phog pa la 'khrur gnang ngo //
translated: it is permitted to bathe when it falls on the body.

original: gzhan yang zhag bco lnga las khrus kyi nyi ma ma yin te tshun chad bkru ba ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhag bco lnga las khrus kyi nyi ma ma yin te tshun chad bkru ba ma yin /
translated: Moreover, it is not permitted to bathe before fifteen days have passed.

original: zhag bco lnga ma lon par khrus byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhag bco lnga ma lon par khrus byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one bathes before fifteen days have passed, one commits an offense.

original: bco lnga la lan cig khrus byas pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: bco lnga la lan cig khrus byas pa ni nyes med /
translated: If one bathes after fifteen days, there is no offense.

original: blugs par ma zhug pas so ;
analyzed: blugs par ma zhug pas so ;
translated: Because it is not a pouring rain.

original: / khrus byad pa ni chu'i nang du zhugs kyang rung bcus te spyi bo nas blugs kyang rung gang ltar bkrus kyang ltung ngo //
analyzed: / khrus byad pa ni chu'i nang du zhugs kyang rung bcus te spyi bo nas blugs kyang rung gang ltar bkrus kyang ltung ngo //
translated: If you bathe in water, or if you pour water over your head, you have committed an offense no matter what.

original: de lte bar phyin na'o //
analyzed: de lte bar phyin na'o //
translated: If it reaches your navel.

original: bkru ba'i tshad ni spyi bo nas blugs te chu lte bar phyin kyang rung chu'i nang du zhugs te lte bar phyin kyang rung bkrus par chud do //ğŸ”½tshun chad na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: bkru ba'i tshad ni spyi bo nas blugs te chu lte bar phyin kyang rung chu'i nang du zhugs te lte bar phyin kyang rung bkrus par chud do // tshun chad na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: The measure of bathing is this: if you pour water over your head and it reaches your navel, or if you enter water and it reaches your navel, you have bathed.

original: lte bar ma phyin par bkrus pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: lte bar ma phyin par bkrus pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it does not reach your navel, it is a minor infraction.ğŸ”½If the water does not reach your navel, it is a minor infraction.

original: thams cad du dus su bsngo ba ma bsngos na yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du dus su bsngo ba ma bsngos na yang ngo //
translated: In all cases, if you do not dedicate the time, it is also a minor infraction.

original: las ci byed do cog la yang bsam pa'ang rung smra ba'ang rung lus kyis byed pa'ang rung sa ma yam ma bsngos par byas na ci byas so cog nyes byas so //
analyzed: las ci byed do cog la yang bsam pa'ang rung smra ba'ang rung lus kyis byed pa'ang rung sa ma yam ma bsngos par byas na ci byas so cog nyes byas so //
translated: Whatever action you do, whether you think about it, speak about it, or do it physically, if you do not dedicate the earth and water, whatever you do is a minor infraction.

original: don gyi chur myong ba khrus ma yin /
analyzed: don gyi chur myong ba khrus ma yin /
translated: Tasting the water is not bathing.

original: chu chen po rgal ba la 'bogs kyang rung rkyal pa'ang rung /
analyzed: chu chen po rgal ba la 'bogs kyang rung rkyal pa'ang rung /
translated: If you cross a great river, whether you do so by boat or by swimming,

original: lus thams cad gsher ba ni khrus byas par mi chud do nyes med do //
analyzed: lus thams cad gsher ba ni khrus byas par mi chud do nyes med do //
translated: If the whole body is wet, it is not considered a bath.

original: de bas na rgal ba dang ma tshor bar ltung ba dang brgyal ba la btab pa la ltung ba med /
analyzed: de bas na rgal ba dang ma tshor bar ltung ba dang brgyal ba la btab pa la ltung ba med /
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if one is crossing water, falls in unintentionally, or faints.

original: chu rgal ba dang chu'i nang du lhung ba dang brgyal ba'i phyir chus btab pa la sogs pa yang bkrus par mi chud de nyes med do //
analyzed: chu rgal ba dang chu'i nang du lhung ba dang brgyal ba'i phyir chus btab pa la sogs pa yang bkrus par mi chud de nyes med do //
translated: Also, if one is crossing water, falls in, or faints, and is sprinkled with water, it is not considered a bath.ğŸ”½Know that these are not the countries of Asmapadana.

original: yul aasma pa ran da kan 'di dag med par shes shig / yul aasma pa ran da ka na ko lpags 'chang du gnang ba'i yul na ni rtag par khrus byas kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gnang ngo //
analyzed: yul aasma pa ran da kan 'di dag med par shes shig / yul aasma pa ran da ka na ko lpags 'chang du gnang ba'i yul na ni rtag par khrus byas kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gnang ngo //
translated: In the country of Asmapadana, where the wearing of leather is permitted, it is permitted to always bathe without offense.

original: mchog yod na chung ngu'i brtag par mi bya /
analyzed: mchog yod na chung ngu'i brtag par mi bya /
translated: If there is a superior reason, one should not consider the lesser.

original: char gyis phog na 'khrur gnang ngo zhes byas pa'i phyir ched kar gyis phog par byas te khrus mi bya /
analyzed: char gyis phog na 'khrur gnang ngo zhes byas pa'i phyir ched kar gyis phog par byas te khrus mi bya /
translated: Since it is said that one should bathe when struck by rain, one should not bathe intentionally by making rain.

original: yul mtha' khob tu aa shi lngas khrims rdzogs su gnang ba las lnga nyi tshes chog ces te dge 'dun ldas rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: yul mtha' khob tu aa shi lngas khrims rdzogs su gnang ba las lnga nyi tshes chog ces te dge 'dun ldas rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: In border regions, the full ordination is given with five nuns, but in the case of five nuns, it is sufficient to have twenty-five.

original: dpe bshad pa 'di gnyis dang 'dra bar ci bya'o cog thams cad gnang ba'i tshig la brten te sla chos su sgyu mi bya /
analyzed: dpe bshad pa 'di gnyis dang 'dra bar ci bya'o cog thams cad gnang ba'i tshig la brten te sla chos su sgyu mi bya /
translated: Just as in these two examples, do not act deceitfully, taking the words that allow for everything to be done as a license for laxity.

original: khrus kyi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khrus kyi ltung ba'o //
translated: This is the downfall of bathing.

original: khrus byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: khrus byed pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
translated: The downfall of bathing is finished.

original: dgu bcu ltung ba'i bcu sde rdzogs so /
analyzed: dgu bcu ltung ba'i bcu sde rdzogs so /
translated: The ten sets of ten downfalls are finished.

original: // / byol song gsod pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /ğŸ”½bsad @171b pa'i sems kyis byol song la bsad pa'i sems kyis bsad na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / phyugs la bsnun na'o //
analyzed: // / byol song gsod pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de / bsad @171b pa'i sems kyis byol song la bsad pa'i sems kyis bsad na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / phyugs la bsnun na'o //
translated: The downfall of killing cattle is explained.ğŸ”½If one kills a cow with the intention to kill, it is a downfall. One part is that one strikes the cow.

original: byol song bsad pa'i phyir bsnun kyang bsnun pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / der ram gzhan yang de'i shi na'o //
analyzed: byol song bsad pa'i phyir bsnun kyang bsnun pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / der ram gzhan yang de'i shi na'o //
translated: If one strikes a cow in order to kill it, it is a downfall from striking. One part is that it dies from that or from another blow.

original: bdag gis bsad de 'phral la shi yang rung bsad par bsnun pa las 'phral du ma shi'i phyis shi yang rung ste shi na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan pas byol song bsad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis bsad de 'phral la shi yang rung bsad par bsnun pa las 'phral du ma shi'i phyis shi yang rung ste shi na ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan pas byol song bsad na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whether the animal dies immediately or not, if it dies later, there is an offense.

original: nyes byas pa ni sems can 'dra la sems can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni sems can 'dra la sems can ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the animal is similar to a sentient being but not a sentient being, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sems can gyi gzugs su byas pa'am sems can gyi gzugs su ri mo bris pa bshig na nyes byas /
analyzed: sems can gyi gzugs su byas pa'am sems can gyi gzugs su ri mo bris pa bshig na nyes byas /
translated: If one destroys a drawing of a sentient being or a statue of a sentient being, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byol song gsod pa'o //
analyzed: byol song gsod pa'o //
translated: Killing animals.

original: byol song gsod pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: byol song gsod pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of killing animals is complete.

original: // / the tshom la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / the tshom la 'chad de /
translated: Doubt is explained as follows.

original: khyed rab tu ma rdzogs la phas pham pa byung zhes pa la sogs pa dge slong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom skur na'o //
analyzed: khyed rab tu ma rdzogs la phas pham pa byung zhes pa la sogs pa dge slong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom skur na'o //
translated: If one doubts and says, â€œYou are not fully ordained, and you have incurred a defeating offense,â€ and so forth, because the other is not a fully ordained monk, it is a downfall.

original: dge slong la yo byad ma tshang ba la sogs pa khrims mi 'chags pa'i tshig gang byas kyang rung ste khyod khrims ma chags so zhes the tshom skur pa dang phas pham par ma gyur pa la pham par gyur to zhes the tshom skur pa las ltung bar
analyzed: dge slong la yo byad ma tshang ba la sogs pa khrims mi 'chags pa'i tshig gang byas kyang rung ste khyod khrims ma chags so zhes the tshom skur pa dang phas pham par ma gyur pa la pham par gyur to zhes the tshom skur pa las ltung bar
translated: Whether one says to a fully ordained monk, your articles are incomplete and so on, or any words that do not confess his downfalls, it is a downfall to cast doubt by saying, you have not confessed your downfalls or to cast doubt by saying, you have committed a defeating offense when you have not.

original: 'gyur te yan lag gcig /ğŸ”½drug sdes bcu bdun sde lo ma tshang par khrims rdzogs pa dang bus pha phul zhing 'gro ba las shi ba la pham pa dang mtshams med pa yod do zhes the tshom skur pa las bcas /
analyzed: 'gyur te yan lag gcig / drug sdes bcu bdun sde lo ma tshang par khrims rdzogs pa dang bus pha phul zhing 'gro ba las shi ba la pham pa dang mtshams med pa yod do zhes the tshom skur pa las bcas /
translated: This has one branch.

original: dge slong na'o //
analyzed: dge slong na'o //
translated: The group of six said to the group of seventeen, you have not completed your ethics because you lack leaves and you have committed a defeating offense and a heinous act by offering your father and going forth and dying.ğŸ”½This is a downfall due to doubt.

original: the tshom skur pa de dge slong yang yin pa las ltung ste yan lag 'di gnyis dang ldan na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: the tshom skur pa de dge slong yang yin pa las ltung ste yan lag 'di gnyis dang ldan na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: This has two branches: the doubt and the monk who is the object of the doubt.

original: mi bde ba bskyed pa'i sems kyi na rtsed mos kyang the tshom ma skyes kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi bde ba bskyed pa'i sems kyi na rtsed mos kyang the tshom ma skyes kyang ngo //
translated: Even if one does not arouse doubt, it is a downfall to make another feel uneasy through jest.

original: pha rol po dge slong mi bde zhing mi dga' bar bya ba'i phyir khrims ma chags pa la sogs pa yin no zhes smras na ltung ba dge slong ma yin pa dang mi dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin gyi rtsed mo byas pa ni nyes byasğŸ”½/ gzhan gyis na nyes byas pa'o //ğŸ”½lhag ma dang ltung ba zhig tu gyur to zhes the tshom skur na nyes byas /ğŸ”½the tshom skur pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol po dge slong mi bde zhing mi dga' bar bya ba'i phyir khrims ma chags pa la sogs pa yin no zhes smras na ltung ba dge slong ma yin pa dang mi dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin gyi rtsed mo byas pa ni nyes byas / gzhan gyis na nyes byas pa'o // lhag ma dang ltung ba zhig tu gyur to zhes the tshom skur na nyes byas / the tshom skur pa'o //
translated: If one says, â€œI am unsure whether this is a downfall or not,â€ it is a minor infraction.

original: the tshom skur pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: the tshom skur pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of doubt is finished.

original: // / mdzub mo'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / mdzub mo'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of the finger is explained as follows.ğŸ”½If a monkğŸ”½is sick,

original: dge slong na'o //ğŸ”½dge slong la ga ga @172a * //
analyzed: dge slong na'o // dge slong la ga ga @172a * //
translated: and another monk

original: tshil byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig sor mo dang khu tshur dang gru mo dang phrag pa dang mgo dang logs dang rgyab dang sta zur dang brang dang pus mo dang byin pa dang rkang pa'i mthe bong la sogs pas reg cing ga ga

analyzed: de bas na rma dang sprang ma dang mdzer pa dang sme ba dang spu 'khyil ba bstan pa ni ltung ba med do //

original: ltung pa du ma yang gcig go //
analyzed: ltung pa du ma yang gcig go //
translated: Even though there are many offenses, there is only one.

analyzed: ga ga tshil byas pa ni sor mo re re ltung ba re rer mi 'gyur gyi ltung ba gcig tu zad do //

original: // / dga' ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dga' ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /

original: chu'i yul du bya ba nan tan no //
analyzed: chu'i yul du bya ba nan tan no //

translated: The downfall is incurred by delighting in and playing in water.ğŸ”½The downfall is incurred by doing any of the following: entering the water, submerging in the water, submerging the body in the water, floating on the water, or crossing to the other side of the water.

original: chu'i rgyud bzhin du 'gro ba dang / rgyun las log ste 'gro ba dang / chu rnga dang chu la lag gis brdabs te sgra 'byin pa dang / sbal pa'i zer ba dang / chu'i nang du mchu btsugs nas blag blug zer ba dang / chus phyar ba dang /

translated: The downfall is incurred by doing any of the following: swimming back and forth, going upstream and downstream, going with the current or against it, splashing water, clapping the water with the hands, making sounds like a frog, making sounds by blowing bubbles, or playing with water.

original: chu la rdo 'phyar byed pa'ang rung chu la lag changs kyis gtor kyang rung /
analyzed: chu la rdo 'phyar byed pa'ang rung chu la lag changs kyis gtor kyang rung /
translated: It is also suitable to throw stones into the water, or to scatter water with oneâ€™s hand.

analyzed: bskor ba dang chu la lag pas bskor ba dang / rdo rje dang chu la rdo rje thabs su 'phangs kyang rung rdo rje 'dra ba bris kyang rung /

translated: If one circles a well or the water in it, or if one circles the water with oneâ€™s hand, or if one draws a hole in the center of the water, or if one draws a swirl in the water, or if one draws a line in the water, or if one draws a furrow in the water, one commits a downfall.

original: chu la ri mo bri ba dang shur shur por drangs pa dang 'di rnams gag byas kyang ltung ngo //
analyzed: chu la ri mo bri ba dang shur shur por drangs pa dang 'di rnams gag byas kyang ltung ngo //
translated: If one draws a picture in the water, or if one draws a furrow in the water, or if one does these things with oneâ€™s mouth, one commits an offense.

original: bltubs pa bsnun na nyes byas //
analyzed: bltubs pa bsnun na nyes byas //
translated: If one strikes a water bubble, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu la bem rtol bsnun pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: chu la bem rtol bsnun pa ni nyes byas /

original: rdza ma dang phru ba dang ril ba dang phor bur ro //
analyzed: rdza ma dang phru ba dang ril ba dang phor bur ro //
translated: It is the same for a pot, a water jar, a water pot, or a cup.

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nang na chu 'dug pa la gong ma'i rim pa ltar rtses na nyes byas /
translated: If one plays with the water in these in the manner described above, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bu ram khu ba dang tshod ma dang thug pa dang chan khu bsros pa yod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: bu ram khu ba dang tshod ma dang thug pa dang chan khu bsros pa yod pa la yang ngo //

analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi khu ba la rtag tu smos pa ltar rtses na nyes byas /

original: chu ma yin pa la dga' ba yang ngo //
analyzed: chu ma yin pa la dga' ba yang ngo //

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la rtses na'ang nyes byas /

analyzed: de bas na sim pa 'dod pa'i phyir zhugs na ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, if one enters the water for the sake of refreshment, there is no downfall.

analyzed: rkyal slob pas zheng ngam chur 'bad na'o //

original: ma gtogs pa ni skyo ba'i phyir ba'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni skyo ba'i phyir ba'o //
translated: The exception is when it is done to discourage others from unwholesome actions.

original: mi sdug cing 'jigs par smras kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni chags pa dang dbral zhing 'khor ba las skyo bar bya ba'i phyir mi sdug cing mi snyan pa'i chos bshad kyang nyes med do //

translated: There is no offense if one speaks unpleasantly and frightens others in order to separate them from attachment and to discourage them from cyclic existence.

translated: Therefore, there is no offense in speaking about the hells, animals, ghosts, humans, and so on, in order to discourage people.ğŸ”½There is no offense in explaining and teaching the Dharma, saying, â€œThe five destinies of sentient beings are suffering, fearful, harmful,ğŸ”½and impure,â€ in order to discourage attachment.

analyzed: mi gtsang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos bshad cing smras pa ni nyes med do // sdangs byed do //

original: pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /

translated: â€œHidingâ€ means to conceal the requisites of a renunciate, such as the begging bowl, robes, water bottle, cup, and belt, and the other articles necessary for a monkâ€™s livelihood.

translated: The Buddhaâ€™s teachings refers to any of the renunciates of the Buddhaâ€™s teachings, whether fully ordained monks or nuns, male or female novices, or male or female postulants.ğŸ”½If a monk hides any of these named articles, he commits an offense.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la ma gtogs shing dge slong gis gos su brtags shing sngags chags pa'i rdzas shig las sbas na'ang ltung ba /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la ma gtogs shing dge slong gis gos su brtags shing sngags chags pa'i rdzas shig las sbas na'ang ltung ba /

original: dge slong gis gyos ma brtags pa zhig sbas na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong gis gyos ma brtags pa zhig sbas na nyes byas /
translated: If a monk hides something that he has not identified as a piece of clothing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbed du bcug pa yang ngo dge slong dang dge sbyong gis rdzas la gzhan zhig la sbed du bcug na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbed du bcug pa yang ngo dge slong dang dge sbyong gis rdzas la gzhan zhig la sbed du bcug na'ang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk is made to hide something, he also commits an offense of wrong conduct. If a monk or a novice monk makes someone else hide something, he also commits an offense.

original: ma gtogs pa ni phan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni phan par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The exception is when it is done with the intention of helping.

translated: In order to benefit, if one is negligent and lazy about the requisites, in order to prevent future laziness, one should hide the requisites for a moment and threaten, and in order to prevent going to a non-virtuous friend or going to a place that will cause affliction, one should seize the requisites.

original: phyir rdzas gtar bzung ba ni nyes med do //

analyzed: byin te 'tsho ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /

original: // / skur ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /

analyzed: bdag gis dge slong grogs shig la tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang smad cing gtam ngan par bya ba'i phyir brdzun gyis skur na ltung bar 'gyur te dge sbyong dang khyim pa ni mi bya'i dge slong @174b la shes bzhin du skur pa las ltung ba'o //
translated: and one lies in order to slander him, saying, He is not a monk, or, He is not celibate, or, He is not a virtuous person, or, He is not a holy person, or, He is not an ascetic, or, He is not a brÄhmaá¹‡a, or, He is not a renunciant, or, He is not a monk, then one commits a downfall. One does not commit a downfall if one slanders a non-monk or a householder, but one does commit a downfall if one slanders a monk while knowing that he is a monk.

original: 'du shes sbas pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sbas pa dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If one conceals the perception of a monk who has committed a partial defeat, one commits a downfall of partial defeat.

translated: Accusation is when I say to another monk, â€˜You have a downfall.â€™ğŸ”½Gradually, I should accuse a fellow monk of a partial defeat.

original: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ltung bar 'gyur ro //

original: skur pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: skur pa'i ltung ba'o //

analyzed: skur ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so / // / skyes pa med par lam du 'gro ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of accusation is finished.

original: 'dod pas lam du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas lam du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The downfall of traveling on a road with a man is explained as follows.ğŸ”½A man is one who has sexual organs.

original: bud med dang lam du 'grogs pa ni 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod de 'phral la lam du phrad de 'grogs pa ni ma gtogs te 'grogs 'dod pa'i phyir bud med dang dus byas te lam du 'grogs pa ni ltung ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang lam du 'grogs pa ni 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod de 'phral la lam du phrad de 'grogs pa ni ma gtogs te 'grogs 'dod pa'i phyir bud med dang dus byas te lam du 'grogs pa ni ltung ba'o //
translated: Accompanying a woman on the road is a condition of fear. Except for the case of meeting and accompanying her on the road by chance, it is a downfall to accompany a woman on the road for the purpose of companionship.

original: rgyang grags so sor ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags so sor ro //
translated: Each league is a downfall.

analyzed: bud med dang 'grogs pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Accompanying a woman on the road is a downfall for each league.

analyzed: reg pa'i skyes pa med par bud med dang 'grogs pa las ltung ngo // de so sor phyed cing yang nyes byas so //
translated: There is a downfall if one accompanies a woman without a male companion.ğŸ”½Each half league is a fault.

original: rgyang grags phyed cing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags phyed cing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: Each half league is a minor offense.

original: ma gtogs pa ni bsel byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni bsel byed pa'o //
translated: An exception is made for when one is ill.

original: bud med dang 'grogs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni 'jigs pa'i bsel du skyes pa med de bud med 'ongs nas ngas bsel nus zhes zer ba dang deng yod dang rkun pos yul mi ngo shes pa'i phyir rkun po mi 'ong gis bsel bya'o zhes zer ba
analyzed: bud med dang 'grogs kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni 'jigs pa'i bsel du skyes pa med de bud med 'ongs nas ngas bsel nus zhes zer ba dang deng yod dang rkun pos yul mi ngo shes pa'i phyir rkun po mi 'ong gis bsel bya'o zhes zer ba
translated: There is no fault in accompanying a woman when there is no man, such as in a fearful place, and she says, â€œI can protect you,â€ or when there is a thief, and she says, â€œBecause the people of the country know me, the thief will not come, so I will protect you.â€

original: dang 'grogs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: dang 'grogs pa ni nyes med /
translated: Accompanying her is faultless.

original: des lam stor ba lam du zhugs pa'i phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: des lam stor ba lam du zhugs pa'i phyir na yang ngo //
translated: Also, when she is lost and enters the path, it is faultless to accompany her.

original: dge slong lam stor ram lam mi shes pa la bud med kyis lam mkhan byas te 'grogs pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong lam stor ram lam mi shes pa la bud med kyis lam mkhan byas te 'grogs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: When a bhiká¹£u is lost or does not know the path, it is faultless to accompany a woman who is a guide on the path.

original: bud med 'jigs pa'i rkyen dang bud med lam mi shes pa la ni dge slong gis bsel dang lam ston par 'grogs su mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: bud med 'jigs pa'i rkyen dang bud med lam mi shes pa la ni dge slong gis bsel dang lam ston par 'grogs su mi gnang ngo //
translated: However, it is not permitted for a bhiká¹£u to accompany a woman who is a protector or a guide on the path when there is a fearful condition for a woman or when a woman does not know the path.

original: 'gro mi nus pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gro mi nus pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, when one is unable to go.

original: dge slong nad kyis btab pa ma chad de 'gro mi phod pa la bud med kyis grogs byas te rdzas dag khyer nas lam du 'grogs pa ni @175a * //
analyzed: dge slong nad kyis btab pa ma chad de 'gro mi phod pa la bud med kyis grogs byas te rdzas dag khyer nas lam du 'grogs pa ni @175a * //
translated: When a bhiká¹£u is afflicted by illness, and is unable to go without support, it is faultless to accompany a woman who is a companion and carries his belongings on the path.

original: nyes med bud med dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes med bud med dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'o //
translated: To travel with a woman who is not a relative.

original: rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med dang lam du lhan cig 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med dang lam du lhan cig 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of traveling on the road with a woman without a male companion is completed when a man and a woman travel together on the road without a male companion.

original: // / bcu ste gcig 'das /ğŸ”½rkun 'grogs kyi ltung ba 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bcu ste gcig 'das / rkun 'grogs kyi ltung ba 'chad de /
translated: The tenth is finished.

original: grong 'joms pa'i rkun po dang sho gam 'joms pa'i rkun po dag go //
analyzed: grong 'joms pa'i rkun po dang sho gam 'joms pa'i rkun po dag go //
translated: The downfall of traveling with thieves is to travel with thieves who plunder villages or with thieves who plunder the royal border guards.

original: grong 'joms shing chom po byed pa'i rkun po dang shog gam pa nor ci dbang ba mi sbyin pa'i phyir sho gam dral ba dang sho gam rku ba'i tshong pa dang 'grogs na ltung bar 'gyur /ğŸ”½bya ma rta dang rkun pos rab tu byung ba dang na nyes pa'o //
analyzed: grong 'joms shing chom po byed pa'i rkun po dang shog gam pa nor ci dbang ba mi sbyin pa'i phyir sho gam dral ba dang sho gam rku ba'i tshong pa dang 'grogs na ltung bar 'gyur / bya ma rta dang rkun pos rab tu byung ba dang na nyes pa'o //
translated: To travel with thieves who plunder villages or with thieves who plunder the royal border guards, or with merchants who do not pay the appropriate taxes, constitutes this downfall.

original: bya ma rta dang mkhan po dang a'a ts'arya med par rab tu byung ba dang 'grogs pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ma rta dang mkhan po dang a'a ts'arya med par rab tu byung ba dang 'grogs pa ni rgyang grags re re zhing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: The downfall of ordaining a novice without a master or teacher is to ordain a novice without a preceptor or teacher.

original: rkun po dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkun po dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'o //
translated: To travel with thieves is to travel with thieves.

original: grogs po rkun ma dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: grogs po rkun ma dang lhan cig 'grogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of accompanying a thief as a friend is finished.

original: // / lo nyi shu ma lon pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / lo nyi shu ma lon pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of not having twenty years is explained.

original: 'bhrid / lo nyi shur ma lon par shes bzhin du rdzogs par byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bhrid / lo nyi shur ma lon par shes bzhin du rdzogs par byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one knowingly gives full ordination to someone who has not completed twenty years, there is a downfall.

original: lo nyi shur ma lon pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shur ma lon pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: One who has not completed twenty years is fully ordained.

original: dge sbyong lo nyi shur ma lon par shes bzhin du khrims rdzogs par 'gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong lo nyi shur ma lon par shes bzhin du khrims rdzogs par 'gyur na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knowingly gives full ordination to someone who has not completed twenty years, there is a downfall.

original: mkhan pos bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan pos bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The preceptor is fully ordained.

original: lo nyi shu ma lon par khrims rdzogs par byas pa ni mkhan po gang yin pa ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma lon par khrims rdzogs par byas pa ni mkhan po gang yin pa ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives full ordination to someone who has not completed twenty years, the preceptor incurs a downfall.

original: des de la tshang ngam zhes mi 'dri bar mi bya /
analyzed: des de la tshang ngam zhes mi 'dri bar mi bya /
translated: He should not fail to ask him, â€œAre you complete?â€

original: khrims rdzogs par byed pa'i dge slong de la mkhan po gang yin pas lo nyi shu tshang ngam zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: khrims rdzogs par byed pa'i dge slong de la mkhan po gang yin pas lo nyi shu tshang ngam zhes 'dri'o //
translated: The preceptor of the one who is giving full ordination should ask, â€œAre you complete in twenty years?â€

original: lo'ang ma tshang la ma dris na ma dris pa'i nyes byas dang / lo ma tshang pa'i ltung ba dang gnyis yod do //ğŸ”½gzhan gyis ma yin /
analyzed: lo'ang ma tshang la ma dris na ma dris pa'i nyes byas dang / lo ma tshang pa'i ltung ba dang gnyis yod do // gzhan gyis ma yin /
translated: If the year is not complete and one does not ask, there is the offense of not asking, and there is the offense of the incomplete year.ğŸ”½If the year is complete but one does not ask, there is the offense of not asking.

original: rab tu rdzogs par 'dod pa la dge 'dun gyis kyang lo tshang ngam zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: rab tu rdzogs par 'dod pa la dge 'dun gyis kyang lo tshang ngam zhes 'dri'o //
translated: If the year is complete and the Saá¹…gha asks, â€œIs the year complete?,â€ then the aspirant is fully ordained.

original: lo ma tshang ba zhig ma dris pa rdzogs par byas na ma dris pa'i nyes byas re re dang lo ma tshang pa'i nyes byas re re yod do //
analyzed: lo ma tshang ba zhig ma dris pa rdzogs par byas na ma dris pa'i nyes byas re re dang lo ma tshang pa'i nyes byas re re yod do //
translated: If the year is incomplete and one does not ask, there is the offense of not asking, and there is the offense of the incomplete year.

original: brtags pa mi shes pa bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: brtags pa mi shes pa bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: One should not give the full ordination to someone who does not know how to count.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa de kho bdag gis kyang lo grangs mi shes la dge 'dun gyis kyang mi shes na bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa de kho bdag gis kyang lo grangs mi shes la dge 'dun gyis kyang mi shes na bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: If the aspirant does not know how to count the years and the Saá¹…gha does not know, then one should not give the full ordination.

original: thams cad nyi shur tshang na @175b rab tu rdzogs par skye'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyi shur tshang na @175b rab tu rdzogs par skye'o //
translated: If all the years are complete, then the aspirant is fully ordained.

original: khrims rdzogs par 'dod pa de lo nyi shur ni tshang gi kho bdag dang mkhan po dang dge 'dun gyis lo ma tshang bar shes te khrims rdzogs pa ni 'du shes mi btsan gyi khrims 'tshags so //ğŸ”½gzhan du lo tshang bar 'du shes na yang ngo //
analyzed: khrims rdzogs par 'dod pa de lo nyi shur ni tshang gi kho bdag dang mkhan po dang dge 'dun gyis lo ma tshang bar shes te khrims rdzogs pa ni 'du shes mi btsan gyi khrims 'tshags so // gzhan du lo tshang bar 'du shes na yang ngo //
translated: If the aspirant desires to complete the vows, but the master, preceptor, and the community know that the years are not complete, then the vows are not received, even though the aspirant is certain that the years are complete.ğŸ”½If the aspirant is certain that the years are complete, but the master, preceptor, and the community think that the years are not complete, then the vows are received, even though the aspirant is uncertain.

original: khrims rdzogs par 'dod pa na de ni lo ma tshang gi kho bdag dang dge dun gyis lo tshang bar bsams shing khrims phog pa yang khrims 'chags shing 'du shes can no //
analyzed: khrims rdzogs par 'dod pa na de ni lo ma tshang gi kho bdag dang dge dun gyis lo tshang bar bsams shing khrims phog pa yang khrims 'chags shing 'du shes can no //
translated: If the aspirant desires to complete the vows, and the master, preceptor, and the community think that the years are complete, then the vows are received, even though the aspirant is uncertain.

original: mi shes sam mi dran nam yid gnyis na yang ngo //
analyzed: mi shes sam mi dran nam yid gnyis na yang ngo //
translated: If the aspirant does not know, does not remember, or is uncertain, then the vows are received.

original: lo tshang ngam ma tshang mi shes sam mi dran nam the tshom za bzhin du khrims phogs pa yang lo ma tshang yang khrims 'chags so //
analyzed: lo tshang ngam ma tshang mi shes sam mi dran nam the tshom za bzhin du khrims phogs pa yang lo ma tshang yang khrims 'chags so //
translated: If the aspirant does not know, does not remember, or is uncertain whether the years are complete, then the vows are received, even if the years are not complete.

original: shes na de zhig go //
analyzed: shes na de zhig go //
translated: If the aspirant knows, then the vows are not received.

original: s'u tra ltag ma gnyis ltar lo ma tshang la tshang bar bsams pa dang lo ma tshang la mi shes sam yid gnyis su khrims phog ma phyis lo grangs ma tshang bar shes na khrims mi 'chags te med par song ngo //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma gnyis ltar lo ma tshang la tshang bar bsams pa dang lo ma tshang la mi shes sam yid gnyis su khrims phog ma phyis lo grangs ma tshang bar shes na khrims mi 'chags te med par song ngo //
translated: If, like the first Sutra, one thinks that the years are complete, or if, like the second Sutra, one thinks that the years are incomplete, or if one is unsure, or if one is in doubt, the vows are not received, and the vows do not arise.

original: de ste 'di ltar tshang ba thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ste 'di ltar tshang ba thob pa ma yin no //
translated: If one does not obtain them in this way, they are not received.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar lo ma tshang par nam shes shing tshor ba'i tshe lo tshang na khrims rdzogs pa'i tshe lo ma tshang na yang khrims med par mi 'gyur te 'chags so //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar lo ma tshang par nam shes shing tshor ba'i tshe lo tshang na khrims rdzogs pa'i tshe lo ma tshang na yang khrims med par mi 'gyur te 'chags so //
translated: If, like the second Sutra, one knows or feels that the years are incomplete, if the years are complete, the vows are complete. If the years are incomplete, the vows are not lost, but are received.

original: lhag pa dang mngal gyi zla ba dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: lhag pa dang mngal gyi zla ba dang bcas par ro //
translated: They are received together with the extra months and the months of pregnancy.

original: khrims rdzogs pa las phyis lo ma tshang bar tshor na khrims 'chags shing lo tshang bya ba'i thabs 'di yod de /
analyzed: khrims rdzogs pa las phyis lo ma tshang bar tshor na khrims 'chags shing lo tshang bya ba'i thabs 'di yod de /
translated: If one feels that the years are incomplete after the vows are complete, the vows are received. There is a method for making the years complete.

original: thog ma mngal na 'dug pa'i zla bas kyang bsnan skar mkhan gyis chos su lo phyed dang gsum zhing zla ba gcig gi khong nas lhag par 'byin cing brtsis des kyang bsnan la nam tshor ba'i tsher tshang na 'chags /
analyzed: thog ma mngal na 'dug pa'i zla bas kyang bsnan skar mkhan gyis chos su lo phyed dang gsum zhing zla ba gcig gi khong nas lhag par 'byin cing brtsis des kyang bsnan la nam tshor ba'i tsher tshang na 'chags /
translated: Also, if the age is calculated from the month of conception, it is increased by one month. If calculated from the month of birth, it is increased by six months and three years.

original: thog ma khrims 'bogs pa'i tshe ni nyi shur ma tshang bar shes na mngal gyi zla ba bsnan kyang khrims mi 'chags so //ğŸ”½ma tshang ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: thog ma khrims 'bogs pa'i tshe ni nyi shur ma tshang bar shes na mngal gyi zla ba bsnan kyang khrims mi 'chags so // ma tshang ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i'o //
translated: If one knows that at the time of the ceremony one is less than twenty years old, then even if the months in the womb are added, the vows will not be generated.

original: dge sbyong lo nyi shur ma tshang ba bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge sbyong lo nyi shur ma tshang ba bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The vows of a fully ordained monk are not generated in one who is less than twenty years old.ğŸ”½The downfall is accrued by the monk who ordains him.

original: // / sa rko ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / sa rko ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of digging the earth is explained as follows.

original: brkos sam rkor bcug na'o //
analyzed: brkos sam rkor bcug na'o //
translated: If one digs or has it dug.

original: bdag gis brkos kyang rung gzhan gyis rkor bcug kyang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis brkos kyang rung gzhan gyis rkor bcug kyang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whether one digs it oneself or has another do it, the downfall is accrued.

original: sa'i sa'o // bye ma dang gseg ma ma yin pa sa bzang po 'thas pa las brkos na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sa'i sa'o // bye ma dang gseg ma ma yin pa sa bzang po 'thas pa las brkos na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: The earth is not sand or gravel, but good earth that is solid.

original: ma gtogs pa ni sor bzhi tsam gyi phur @176a * //ğŸ”½bus brkos pa ste las sar pa pas skar ma'i cho ga la brtag par byed par med na'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni sor bzhi tsam gyi phur @176a * // bus brkos pa ste las sar pa pas skar ma'i cho ga la brtag par byed par med na'o //
translated: Except for that, it is digging with a post hole digger, and so on, that is, with a tool, even if it is only four fingerbreadths deep.ğŸ”½If there is no one else to do it, a novice monk may dig the ground to determine the auspiciousness of the site for a ritual of the stars.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i las mi la sogs pa ma tshogs la skar ma bzang po'i nyi ma la bab ste gtsug lag khang gi mkhar len gyi mgo nyi ma de la gzugs dgos te mi gzhan med na /
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i las mi la sogs pa ma tshogs la skar ma bzang po'i nyi ma la bab ste gtsug lag khang gi mkhar len gyi mgo nyi ma de la gzugs dgos te mi gzhan med na /
translated: If there is no one else to do it, a monk may drive a post into the ground as a marker for the foundation of a temple, if it is the day of an auspicious star, and the work of building the temple has not yet begun.

original: sa'i rngams sor bzhi tsam yan chad mkhar len gyi rmang gzugs pa'i mtshan mar dge slong gis phur bu btab kyang nyes med de /
analyzed: sa'i rngams sor bzhi tsam yan chad mkhar len gyi rmang gzugs pa'i mtshan mar dge slong gis phur bu btab kyang nyes med de /
translated: If the post is driven into the ground to a depth of more than four fingerbreadths, there is no offense.

original: brkos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: brkos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If the ground is dug, there is no offense.

original: de ste sa rigs ma na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de ste sa rigs ma na rtsa ba'o //
translated: If the ground is hard, the post may be driven in with the root of a plant.

original: thog ma nas ma brkos par 'dug pa'am brkos pa las slar 'thas pa zhig las brkos na ltung ba /
analyzed: thog ma nas ma brkos par 'dug pa'am brkos pa las slar 'thas pa zhig las brkos na ltung ba /
translated: If the ground has not been dug before, or if it has been dug and has dried out again, and the monk digs it, he commits an offense.

original: de ste ma yin na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ste ma yin na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If it has not dried out, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sa brkos shing klongs pa lhar ma 'thas pa las brkos pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sa brkos shing klongs pa lhar ma 'thas pa las brkos pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one digs the earth and it is not hardened by the gods, then it is a misdeed.

original: zla ba gsum spungs te gnas na snga ma'o //
analyzed: zla ba gsum spungs te gnas na snga ma'o //
translated: If one stays for three months, it is the former.

original: brkos shing klongs pa las zla ba gsum lon pa ni brkos na sa rigs ma las brkos pa dang 'dra ste ltung ngo //
analyzed: brkos shing klongs pa las zla ba gsum lon pa ni brkos na sa rigs ma las brkos pa dang 'dra ste ltung ngo //
translated: If one digs and it is three months, then it is like digging the earth and it is a downfall.

original: des de mi 'chad par char bab na'o //
analyzed: des de mi 'chad par char bab na'o //
translated: If it does not rain, it is not a downfall.

original: mdo ltag ma zla ba gsum lon pa ni rtag tu char rgyun mi 'chad par bab nas rigs mar gyur te brkos na ltung ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma zla ba gsum lon pa ni rtag tu char rgyun mi 'chad par bab nas rigs mar gyur te brkos na ltung ngo //
translated: If it rains for more than three months, then it is a downfall if one digs the earth.

original: gzhan du na drug gis so //
analyzed: gzhan du na drug gis so //
translated: Otherwise, it is six months.

original: sa brkos shing klongs pa char pa ltag tu ma bab pa zhig na zla ba drug lon na rigs mar 'gyur te brkos na ltung /
analyzed: sa brkos shing klongs pa char pa ltag tu ma bab pa zhig na zla ba drug lon na rigs mar 'gyur te brkos na ltung /
translated: If one digs the earth and it does not rain for six months, then it is a downfall if one digs the earth.

original: rtsig pa ni sa ma yin pa rigs ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa ni sa ma yin pa rigs ma yin no //
translated: A wall is not earth, and it is not a downfall.

original: rtsig pa zhig brkos shing dral na'ang ltung bar 'gyur 'dus pa'i mtshan ma mang pa btsan no //
analyzed: rtsig pa zhig brkos shing dral na'ang ltung bar 'gyur 'dus pa'i mtshan ma mang pa btsan no //
translated: If one digs a wall and breaks it, it is a downfall.

original: sa bye ma'ang bzang po 'dres pa gang mang ba btsan no //
analyzed: sa bye ma'ang bzang po 'dres pa gang mang ba btsan no //
translated: Also, the sand is good if it is mixed with many good things.

original: de bas na thams cad rdzas nyung du dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad rdzas nyung du dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all are dug up together with little substance.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar sa bzang ngan gang mang ba btsan pas bzang po mang ba las brkos na ltung ba /
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar sa bzang ngan gang mang ba btsan pas bzang po mang ba las brkos na ltung ba /
translated: If one digs up good earth from a place where good earth is predominant, it is a downfall.

original: ngan pa bye ma mang ba las brkos na nyes byas /
analyzed: ngan pa bye ma mang ba las brkos na nyes byas /
translated: If one digs up bad earth with much sand, it is a minor infraction.

original: tshig pa ni ma rung pa'o //
analyzed: tshig pa ni ma rung pa'o //
translated: Burnt earth is unusable.

original: sa tshig pa ni ma rung ba ste sa ngan pa'i nang du brtsi ste bzang por mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: sa tshig pa ni ma rung ba ste sa ngan pa'i nang du brtsi ste bzang por mi brtsi'o //
translated: Burnt earth is bad earth, and is counted as bad earth, not as good earth.

original: ma rung ba ni phyed do //
analyzed: ma rung ba ni phyed do //
translated: Usable is half.

original: sa tshig pa ngan pa la brkos pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: sa tshig pa ngan pa la brkos pa ni nyes byas /
translated: If one digs up burnt bad earth, it is a minor infraction.

original: 'phags pas zhag dang rtsig pa'i skyang nul dang gad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pas zhag dang rtsig pa'i skyang nul dang gad pa yang ngo //
translated: Noble earth is earth that is moist, plastered, or smooth.

original: sa skrangs pa lta bur 'phags pa las bkogs pa dang sa zhag 'phags pa las bkogs pa dang skyang nul dang gad pa @176b 'phags pa las brkos shing bkogs pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: sa skrangs pa lta bur 'phags pa las bkogs pa dang sa zhag 'phags pa las bkogs pa dang skyang nul dang gad pa @176b 'phags pa las brkos shing bkogs pa ni nyes byas /
translated: If one digs up earth that is like a swelling, or noble earth that is moist, plastered, or smooth, it is a minor infraction.

original: sa ma rdo dang bye ma la sogs pa mang na yang ngo //
analyzed: sa ma rdo dang bye ma la sogs pa mang na yang ngo //
translated: If there is a lot of sand, gravel, and so forth, it is not.

original: sa ma rdo dang bye ma dang sa bzang po dang 'dres pa la sa ma rdo dang bye ma mang ba la brkos na nyes byas /
analyzed: sa ma rdo dang bye ma dang sa bzang po dang 'dres pa la sa ma rdo dang bye ma mang ba la brkos na nyes byas /
translated: If there is a lot of sand, gravel, and so forth mixed in with good soil, and one digs it up, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: byed pa yang ngo //
translated: If one makes it, it is also.

original: byed par byas na'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin te 'og nas 'chad pa yin /
analyzed: byed par byas na'ang nyes byas su 'gyur ba yin te 'og nas 'chad pa yin /
translated: If one makes it, it is also an offense of wrong conduct. This will be explained below.

original: phur pa 'byin pa dang 'dri ba 'dren pa dang lci bas dang bcas te bkogs pa dang 'dam bskul pa der chags pa rdza ma la sogs pa drangs pa dang ba tsha can bzhar ba dang der klong bar bsams na yang der ro //
analyzed: phur pa 'byin pa dang 'dri ba 'dren pa dang lci bas dang bcas te bkogs pa dang 'dam bskul pa der chags pa rdza ma la sogs pa drangs pa dang ba tsha can bzhar ba dang der klong bar bsams na yang der ro //
translated: If one digs up a post, or draws a line, or digs with a heavy object, or stirs up mud, or draws a pot and so forth, or cuts a reed, or thinks of digging there, it is the same.

original: byed pa ni 'di rnams te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las gag byas kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa ni 'di rnams te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las gag byas kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the actions. If one does any of these mentioned by name, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bas na 'gro ba dang rtsi ba la sogs par bsams pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba dang rtsi ba la sogs par bsams pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, if one thinks of going, or measuring, and so forth, there is no offense.

original: sa ma rung bar bya bar bsams par phan tshun 'gro ba'i lam du snad cing gogs pa dang rtsis byed pa'i phyir ri mor bris pa ni nyes med do ;
analyzed: sa ma rung bar bya bar bsams par phan tshun 'gro ba'i lam du snad cing gogs pa dang rtsis byed pa'i phyir ri mor bris pa ni nyes med do ;
translated: If you draw a maá¹‡á¸ala on a path where people will step on it, it is not a fault.ğŸ”½

original: / sa ma rung bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: / sa ma rung bar byas pa'o //
translated: If one thinks, â€œI will make the ground unsuitable,â€ but on the way to the other person, one is injured or delayed by a calculation, then it is not a downfall to draw a picture.

original: sa rko ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa rko ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: Making the ground unsuitable is finished.

original: // / mgron gyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / mgron gyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of guests is explained.

original: rab tu bslang bar mi bya /
analyzed: rab tu bslang bar mi bya /
translated: Do not invite.

original: bdag kha zas 'dod pa'i phyir 'di bslang zhes mi bya /
analyzed: bdag kha zas 'dod pa'i phyir 'di bslang zhes mi bya /
translated: Do not invite, thinking, â€œI want food.â€

original: bslangs na nyes byas zos na ltung ba /
analyzed: bslangs na nyes byas zos na ltung ba /
translated: If one invites, there is an offense of wrong conduct; if one eats, there is a downfall.

original: rigs pa ni dus ma bsgo ba de mi 'gyur bar khas blangs pa'i mchod ston la grong du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni dus ma bsgo ba de mi 'gyur bar khas blangs pa'i mchod ston la grong du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The rule is that if one has not been invited, one may go to a village without changing oneâ€™s intention of not eating.

original: mchod ston la spyan drangs te shog shig par bsgo nas spyan 'dren pa med par spyan drangs pa'i gnas su song yang nyes med /
analyzed: mchod ston la spyan drangs te shog shig par bsgo nas spyan 'dren pa med par spyan drangs pa'i gnas su song yang nyes med /
translated: If one has been invited to a feast, but the invitation is not repeated, one may go to the place of the feast without being invited.

original: dus 'das nas 'dren bar bskul ba'o //
analyzed: dus 'das nas 'dren bar bskul ba'o //
translated: If one goes after the time has passed, one should remind the host.

original: mchod ston la spyan drangs pa las gdugs tshod 'das su nye na myur du rims shig ces bsgo na yang nyes med do //
analyzed: mchod ston la spyan drangs pa las gdugs tshod 'das su nye na myur du rims shig ces bsgo na yang nyes med do //
translated: If he is invited to a meal and told, â€œThe time for the meal is drawing near, so come quickly,â€ there is no offense.

original: 'bru la sogs pa la mi brten khyim pa'i khyim du spyan drangs pa las bdag cag gi phyir stan bting zhing 'dug pa la khyim pa rgyus mi shes te bzhugs zhes mi zer yang 'khod kyang nyes med /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa la mi brten khyim pa'i khyim du spyan drangs pa las bdag cag gi phyir stan bting zhing 'dug pa la khyim pa rgyus mi shes te bzhugs zhes mi zer yang 'khod kyang nyes med /
translated: If he is invited to a house where there is no grain, and so on, and the householder, not knowing the rules, does not say, â€œPlease sit on the seat prepared for you,â€ there is no offense.

original: so sor spyan drangs pa yang bdag gir bya /
analyzed: so sor spyan drangs pa yang bdag gir bya /
translated: If he is invited separately, he should accept the invitation.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gud du zin gyi phyir spyan drangs na song yang nyes med do //ğŸ”½dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu spyan drangs na yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gud du zin gyi phyir spyan drangs na song yang nyes med do // dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu spyan drangs na yang ngo //
translated: If he is invited separately for his own sake, there is no offense in going.ğŸ”½If he is invited together with the Saá¹…gha, there is no offense.

original: dge 'dun spyi spyan drangs pa'i 'og tu bdag gud du yang spyan drangs pa yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyi spyan drangs pa'i 'og tu bdag gud du yang spyan drangs pa yang nyes med do //
translated: If he is invited separately after the Saá¹…gha has been invited, there is no offense.

original: bdag la lan gnyis spyan drangs pa la @177a * //
analyzed: bdag la lan gnyis spyan drangs pa la @177a * //
translated: If he is invited twice,

original: bya'o ; / dus thams cad du yang ngo //
analyzed: bya'o ; / dus thams cad du yang ngo //
translated: he should go both times.

original: tshe gcig tu bdag gis zan sbyar ro zhes zer te spyan drangs pa la der song zhing 'dug kyang nyes med /
analyzed: tshe gcig tu bdag gis zan sbyar ro zhes zer te spyan drangs pa la der song zhing 'dug kyang nyes med /
translated: If one says, I will provide food for one day, and invites him, there is no fault in going and staying there.

original: spyan drangs pa khyad par gzhag pa med par spyan drangs kyi 'di srid cig 'dug shig ces zhag grangs bcad pa med pa dang / gzhan du spyan drangs pa /
analyzed: spyan drangs pa khyad par gzhag pa med par spyan drangs kyi 'di srid cig 'dug shig ces zhag grangs bcad pa med pa dang / gzhan du spyan drangs pa /
translated: If one is invited without any special reason being stated, Stay for so many days, or Stay until such a time, or if one is invited elsewhere,

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gud du zin gyi phyir spyan drangs pa'ang ma yin pa dang / yang yang ngam sang yang 'dir gsol cig gnangs kyang 'dir gsol cig ces zer ba la'ang bya /ğŸ”½bdag gud du 'gro ba la 'dir 'dug shig ces lan du mar zlos shing zer ba dang / shin tu lhag par spyan drangs pa ma byas par /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gud du zin gyi phyir spyan drangs pa'ang ma yin pa dang / yang yang ngam sang yang 'dir gsol cig gnangs kyang 'dir gsol cig ces zer ba la'ang bya / bdag gud du 'gro ba la 'dir 'dug shig ces lan du mar zlos shing zer ba dang / shin tu lhag par spyan drangs pa ma byas par /
translated: or if one is invited because one is alone and has no one else to invite, or if one is invited again and again, saying, Eat here today, Eat here tomorrow,ğŸ”½or if one is invited repeatedly, saying, Stay here, when one is going elsewhere, or if one is invited, saying, I will provide food for one day, but one stays longer than that,

original: tshe gcig tu ngas spyan drangs te zas rtag par spyar ro zhes ma byas par 'dug pa dang / zla ba bzhi zin pa las lhag par 'chang ba zos na'o //
analyzed: tshe gcig tu ngas spyan drangs te zas rtag par spyar ro zhes ma byas par 'dug pa dang / zla ba bzhi zin pa las lhag par 'chang ba zos na'o //
translated: or if one eats food kept more than four months,

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gag kyang rung gcig kyang mi zer bar zla ba bzhi las lhag par sbyin bdag gi khyim du 'dug cing zan zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gag kyang rung gcig kyang mi zer bar zla ba bzhi las lhag par sbyin bdag gi khyim du 'dug cing zan zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If any of these people, without being asked, stay in the house of the benefactor and eat for more than four months, there is an offense.

original: zla ba bzhi las lhag par na zan du zos pa ltung ba re re /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi las lhag par na zan du zos pa ltung ba re re /
translated: For every meal eaten for more than four months, there is an offense.

original: bslangs pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If one asks for food, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim pa la zan bslangs na slong pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i khyim pa la zan bslangs na slong pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one asks a layperson who is not a relative for food, there is an offense of wrong conduct when one asks.

original: zos na ltung ba 'drim zhing bslangs na nyes byas zos na ltung /
analyzed: zos na ltung ba 'drim zhing bslangs na nyes byas zos na ltung /
translated: If one eats, there is an offense entailing confession. If one asks while distributing the food, there is an offense of wrong conduct. If one eats, there is an offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni nad pa'i'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni nad pa'i'o //
translated: There is no offense if one is sick.

original: nad pa ni kha zas ci 'dod pa bzhin du bslangs te zos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: nad pa ni kha zas ci 'dod pa bzhin du bslangs te zos kyang nyes med /
translated: If one is sick, there is no offense if one asks for whatever food one wants and eats it.

original: gnyen kyang ngo //
analyzed: gnyen kyang ngo //
translated: If one is a relative, there is no offense.

original: gnyen la bslangs te zos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: gnyen la bslangs te zos kyang nyes med /
translated: If one eats after asking a relative, there is no offense.

original: rnam par myos na snga ma dang so sor ro //
analyzed: rnam par myos na snga ma dang so sor ro //
translated: If one is insane, there is an offense entailing confession for each action.

original: dge slong yon bdag gis zla ba bzhir dus bcad de bzhag pa las zhag grangs ma tshang par slar khrims phul ba'am /
analyzed: dge slong yon bdag gis zla ba bzhir dus bcad de bzhag pa las zhag grangs ma tshang par slar khrims phul ba'am /
translated: If a monk is invited by a benefactor to stay for four months and he returns the invitation before the end of the period,

original: myos pa las slar dran nam khrims nos te sbyin bdag gis zhag grangs bcad pa ci ma tshang ba slar zan du zos pa ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myos pa las slar dran nam khrims nos te sbyin bdag gis zhag grangs bcad pa ci ma tshang ba slar zan du zos pa ltung ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is drunk and then remembers or takes the precepts again, or if the host has set a time limit and he has not completed it, or if he eats food again, he commits a downfall for each meal.

original: des spyan drangs pa'i nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: des spyan drangs pa'i nyes byas pa'o //
translated: This is a downfall due to accepting an invitation.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar zhag grangs bcad de sngar spyan drangs pa las zhag ma tshang par khrims phul lam myos te song bas phyis spyan drangs par yon bdag la slong du song ba'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar zhag grangs bcad de sngar spyan drangs pa las zhag ma tshang par khrims phul lam myos te song bas phyis spyan drangs par yon bdag la slong du song ba'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is invited for a certain number of days and then, before the time is up, he gives back the precepts or becomes drunk and leaves, and then is invited again, he commits a downfall if he goes to beg from the host.

original: sngon logs su yang gang gis spyan ma drangs pas kyang @177b ngo ;
analyzed: sngon logs su yang gang gis spyan ma drangs pas kyang @177b ngo ;
translated: If he is invited to a place where no one has been invited before, there is no downfall.

original: / sbyin bdag na re rtag tu bzang po bzar ni med kyi nged ci za ba bzhin du sbyin no zhes zer te gzhag pa las 'di 'dod do zhes bzang po zhig bslangs te zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: / sbyin bdag na re rtag tu bzang po bzar ni med kyi nged ci za ba bzhin du sbyin no zhes zer te gzhag pa las 'di 'dod do zhes bzang po zhig bslangs te zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If the host says, â€œI cannot always give good food. I will give you what we eat ourselves,â€ and the monk leaves it at that, but then asks for good food and eats it, saying, â€œI want this,â€ he commits a downfall.

original: spyan drangs pa'i phyir rab tu bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs pa'i phyir rab tu bsnyen pa'o //
translated: This is a downfall due to accepting an invitation.

original: spyan ma drangs par zla ba bzhi las lhag par 'dug pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: spyan ma drangs par zla ba bzhi las lhag par 'dug pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of staying more than four months without inviting is complete.

original: // / slob pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / slob pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfalls of the trainee are explained as follows:

original: 'bhrid / dge slong mkhas pas bstan par shes bzhin pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / mngon par shes na'o //
analyzed: 'bhrid / dge slong mkhas pas bstan par shes bzhin pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig / mngon par shes na'o //
translated: If a monk who is skilled in teaching, while being aware, commits a downfall, it is one branch.

original: dge slong ston pa de yang mkhas shing shes pa la mi shes so //
analyzed: dge slong ston pa de yang mkhas shing shes pa la mi shes so //
translated: If the monk teacher is skilled and knows, but the student does not,

original: slar smras pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig ston na'o //
analyzed: slar smras pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig ston na'o //
translated: he commits a downfall if he does not repeat what he has said. It is one branch if he teaches one part.

original: dge slong mkhas pas bstan cing bslabs pa la mi slob po zhes bya ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig bslab pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong mkhas pas bstan cing bslabs pa la mi slob po zhes bya ba las ltung ste yan lag gcig bslab pa la'o //
translated: If a skilled monk teaches and trains, but the student does not train, he commits a downfall. It is one branch if he trains in one part.

original: slob pa 'dul ba'i tshig yin pa bstan pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig ste yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan na slob pa la slar log pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa 'dul ba'i tshig yin pa bstan pa las ltung ste yan lag gcig ste yan lag 'di rnams dang ldan na slob pa la slar log pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If he teaches the words of the Vinaya of the trainee, he commits a downfall. It is one branch. If he possesses these branches, he has the downfall of turning back from the training of the trainee.

original: khyod kyis 'di slobs shig ces bstan pa'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di slobs shig ces bstan pa'am /
translated: If he teaches, â€œYou should train in this,â€

original: nye bar bstan pa na dge slong gis mi slob po zhes mi shes par bsgo zhing bsgrags pa 'di'i phyir ngag gis brjod na'o //ğŸ”½dge slong sde snod gsum shes pa mkhas pa zhig gis 'dul ba'i tshig las slobs shig ces byas kyang rung so sor dmigs kyis phye ste 'di slobs shig ces bstan pa las khyod kyis bstan pa der mi slob kyi gzhan mkhas pa la slob po zhes zer zhingğŸ”½dge slong mkhas pa de la mi shes par smad par bya ba'i phyir khyod lta bu'i mi shes pa'i tshig nga mi nyan to zhes khas smras na ltung bar 'gyur /ğŸ”½mdo sde'i na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa na dge slong gis mi slob po zhes mi shes par bsgo zhing bsgrags pa 'di'i phyir ngag gis brjod na'o // dge slong sde snod gsum shes pa mkhas pa zhig gis 'dul ba'i tshig las slobs shig ces byas kyang rung so sor dmigs kyis phye ste 'di slobs shig ces bstan pa las khyod kyis bstan pa der mi slob kyi gzhan mkhas pa la slob po zhes zer zhing dge slong mkhas pa de la mi shes par smad par bya ba'i phyir khyod lta bu'i mi shes pa'i tshig nga mi nyan to zhes khas smras na ltung bar 'gyur / mdo sde'i na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: When the teaching is given, if the monk says, I do not know how to train in this, and he does not train in it, then he commits an offense by speaking.ğŸ”½ If a monk who is learned in the three baskets of scripture says, Train in the Vinaya, or if he points out a specific passage and says, Train in this, and the monk says, I will not train in the teaching that you have given, but in another that is learned,ğŸ”½and if he says, I will not listen to the words of an ignorant person like you, in order to disparage the learned monk, he commits an offense.ğŸ”½If he says, I will not listen to the words of an ignorant person like you, in order to disparage the learned monk, he commits an offense.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: dge slong mkhas pas mdo sde dang ma lta bu'i tshig gi nang na khrims 'dug pa dang mdo sde dang ma lta bu nyid la mi slob po zhes slar bzlog pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong mkhas pas mdo sde dang ma lta bu'i tshig gi nang na khrims 'dug pa dang mdo sde dang ma lta bu nyid la mi slob po zhes slar bzlog pa ni nyes byas /
