original: bslab pas stobs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pas stobs pa spong ba'o //
translated: The training rule on abandoning the strong.

original: dge slong gis bstan pa la mi slob po zhes zer ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong gis bstan pa la mi slob po zhes zer ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of a fully ordained monk who does not train in the teachings is now complete.

original: // /'thab ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'thab ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of quarreling is explained as follows.

original: dge slong gis rtsod par dge slong dag dang gros byed pa mnyan pa'i phyir na ste ma gtogs pa zhi bar 'dod pas mnyan na'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis rtsod par dge slong dag dang gros byed pa mnyan pa'i phyir na ste ma gtogs pa zhi bar 'dod pas mnyan na'o //
translated: If a fully ordained monk listens to the discussions of other monks in order to dispute with them, but not if he listens with the wish to pacify,

original: dge slong dag 'thab cing 'khod kyang rung @178a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'thab cing 'khod kyang rung @178a * //
translated: if he listens to the monks quarreling,

original: 'thab par gros byed 'jab cing nyan nas khong de skad zer gyis bdag kyang thabs 'di ltar sbyar zhing bya'o zhes bsams shing nyan na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thab par gros byed 'jab cing nyan nas khong de skad zer gyis bdag kyang thabs 'di ltar sbyar zhing bya'o zhes bsams shing nyan na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if he listens to the discussions of those who are quarreling, thinking, â€œI will use this method to do the same,â€ he commits a downfall.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni 'jab cing mnyan na dkrug par bya ba dang thabs shom pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi 'dum zhing rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ni nyes med do //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ni 'jab cing mnyan na dkrug par bya ba dang thabs shom pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi 'dum zhing rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ni nyes med do //
translated: If he listens in order to reconcile the quarreling monks and to pacify the dispute, he does not commit a downfall.

original: sgra tsam thos pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam thos pa ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If he hears only the sound, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'thab rtsod cing 'khod pa la tshig gi don ni ma thos kyi sgra tsam thos pa zhig tu mnyan na nyes byas so //ğŸ”½don na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab rtsod cing 'khod pa la tshig gi don ni ma thos kyi sgra tsam thos pa zhig tu mnyan na nyes byas so // don na rtsa ba'o //
translated: If he listens to the meaning of the words of those who are quarreling, but does not hear the mere sound, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.ğŸ”½If he hears the meaning of the words of those who are quarreling, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'thab pa'i tshig gi don thos par mnyan na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa'i tshig gi don thos par mnyan na ltung ba'o //
translated: If he listens to the meaning of the words of those who are quarreling, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: dkrug pa'i phyir zhugs na yang ngo //
analyzed: dkrug pa'i phyir zhugs na yang ngo //
translated: If he goes with the intention of stirring up trouble, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: 'thab mo byed pa la dkrug pa'i phyir ched kar song ste mnyan tam dkrugs na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'thab mo byed pa la dkrug pa'i phyir ched kar song ste mnyan tam dkrugs na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If he goes with the intention of listening to the quarrel, or if he goes with the intention of stirring up trouble, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: don gyi phyir gyi dbang gis thug ste /
analyzed: don gyi phyir gyi dbang gis thug ste /
translated: If he goes because of the situation,

original: tshor ba'i 'og tu rkang pa dang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra la sogs pas tshor bar ma byas sam rmongs pa'am zhi ba'i phyir ma yin na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'og tu rkang pa dang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra la sogs pas tshor bar ma byas sam rmongs pa'am zhi ba'i phyir ma yin na ltung ba'o //
translated: but does not listen because of pain, or because he is deaf, or because he is confused, or because he wants to calm them down, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: 'thab pa la ched kar mnyan pa'i phyir ni ma song gi don gzhan zhig gi phyir /
analyzed: 'thab pa la ched kar mnyan pa'i phyir ni ma song gi don gzhan zhig gi phyir /
translated: If he does not go because of the quarrel, but because of something else,ğŸ”½and

original: song song ba las 'thab cing 'khod pa zhig gi steng du bab na lud pa'i sgra'am rkang pa'i sgra dang se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa phyung ste tshor bar ma byas shing mnyan na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: song song ba las 'thab cing 'khod pa zhig gi steng du bab na lud pa'i sgra'am rkang pa'i sgra dang se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa phyung ste tshor bar ma byas shing mnyan na ltung ba'o //
translated: If you go to a place where people are fighting and you make a sound such as a cough, the sound of footsteps, or the sound of snapping your fingers, and you do not make it known that you are there, and you listen, you commit an offense.

original: smyos sam mya myor khyer te mi dran te 'thab mo skrod du 'ongs pa dang 'thab mo zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'thab pa'i steng du 'ongs pa ni nyes med de ma gtogs so //
analyzed: smyos sam mya myor khyer te mi dran te 'thab mo skrod du 'ongs pa dang 'thab mo zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'thab pa'i steng du 'ongs pa ni nyes med de ma gtogs so //
translated: If you are insane, if you are not thinking clearly, if you are trying to remember something, if you go to a place where people are fighting in order to stop the fighting, or if you go to a place where people are fighting in order to stop the fighting, and you make a sound, there is no offense.

original: 'thab mo mi gleng /
analyzed: 'thab mo mi gleng /
translated: Do not discuss a dispute.

original: dge slong gis 'thab mo gleng bslangs te 'thab tu mi gzhug 'thab tu bcug na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong gis 'thab mo gleng bslangs te 'thab tu mi gzhug 'thab tu bcug na nyes byas /
translated: If a monk discusses a dispute, stirs up a dispute, or causes a dispute, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nye bar yang mi mnyan /
analyzed: nye bar yang mi mnyan /
translated: Do not listen to a dispute.

original: 'thab mo byed pa'i drung du bsnyen cing grogs dang shug mgon mi bya byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: 'thab mo byed pa'i drung du bsnyen cing grogs dang shug mgon mi bya byas na nyes byas /
translated: If you go to a place where people are fighting, and you help them, support them, or act as their champion, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di dag byed na bskor cing mi 'dug /'thab mo 'gyed pa la bdag gan na 'dug na bdag la ston cing rgol phod pa'i phyir ched kar drung du 'dug na nyes byas /
analyzed: 'di dag byed na bskor cing mi 'dug /'thab mo 'gyed pa la bdag gan na 'dug na bdag la ston cing rgol phod pa'i phyir ched kar drung du 'dug na nyes byas /
translated: If one sits down in front of them, it is a wrong doing, because one is able to teach and to argue with them.

original: zhi ba'i phyir nan tan du mi bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyir nan tan du mi bya ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that one should not strive to pacify them.

original: dge slong 'thab pa la bdag gis bcug na gdon mi za bar dag mnyan cing zhi bar nus pa tsam gyi tshod la ma bcug na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong 'thab pa la bdag gis bcug na gdon mi za bar dag mnyan cing zhi bar nus pa tsam gyi tshod la ma bcug na nyes byas /
translated: If one causes a monk to fight, and one does not cause him to listen and to be pacified to the extent that one is able to do so, it is a wrong doing.

original: bdag gis bcug kyang mi nyan cing slar bdag la gshe ba tsam gyi @178b chod na ma bcug kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bdag gis bcug kyang mi nyan cing slar bdag la gshe ba tsam gyi @178b chod na ma bcug kyang nyes med /
translated: If one causes him to listen, but he does not listen, and he abuses one, it is not a wrong doing if one does not cause him to listen.

original: nye bar mnyan par chud pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mnyan par chud pa'o //
translated: One should listen to him.

original: dge slong 'thab pa la nyan pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong 'thab pa la nyan pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of listening to monks who are fighting is complete.

original: // / mi smra ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / mi smra ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of not speaking is explained as follows:

original: zhu ba la sogs pa las dge 'dun dang dge slong la ma byas par song na'o //
analyzed: zhu ba la sogs pa las dge 'dun dang dge slong la ma byas par song na'o //
translated: If one does not speak to the Saá¹…gha or to a monk about a request and so forth, and then goes away.

original: dge 'dun 'dus te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las shig byed na ci byed kyang rung ste dge slong lam grogs la ma zhus par gud du song na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus te gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las shig byed na ci byed kyang rung ste dge slong lam grogs la ma zhus par gud du song na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Saá¹…gha is gathered and a rite of request or proposal is being performed, it is permissible to do anything. However, if a monk goes off elsewhere without informing his companions, he commits an offense.

original: mtshams las 'das na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams las 'das na rtsa ba'o //
translated: If one goes beyond the boundary, it is a root downfall.

original: dge 'dun las byed pa'i sgra mi thos par gyur na mtshams las 'das pa ste ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun las byed pa'i sgra mi thos par gyur na mtshams las 'das pa ste ltung ba'o //
translated: If one goes beyond the boundary where the sound of the ritual is not heard, it is a downfall.

original: snga ma ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: The former is a minor infraction.

original: 'dus pa las ma zhus par song ste sgra mi thos par ma gyur gyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dus pa las ma zhus par song ste sgra mi thos par ma gyur gyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes without asking permission from the assembly, as long as the sound of the ritual is still heard, it is a minor infraction.

original: don med pa dang mi rigs par song na'o //
analyzed: don med pa dang mi rigs par song na'o //
translated: If one goes without a purpose or inappropriately.

original: 'dus shing las byed pa la gzhan du don med par 'gro'am ltad mo la sogs pa mi rigs pa zhig tu 'gro na zhus te song yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dus shing las byed pa la gzhan du don med par 'gro'am ltad mo la sogs pa mi rigs pa zhig tu 'gro na zhus te song yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes elsewhere without a purpose while the assembly is gathered and performing a rite, or if one goes to something inappropriate such as a spectacle, it is a minor infraction even if one has asked permission.

original: zhu bar byas kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhu bar byas kyang ngo //
translated: Even if one asks permission.

original: dge 'dun 'dus nas zhu ba'i las ni byas zin gyi gsol pa'i las ma byas pa'i bar du gud du song ba'i nyes byas /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus nas zhu ba'i las ni byas zin gyi gsol pa'i las ma byas pa'i bar du gud du song ba'i nyes byas /
translated: If one goes off elsewhere before the rite of proposal has been performed, it is a minor infraction.

original: chos ma yin pa'i las dge 'dun don med zhig byed par 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i las dge 'dun don med zhig byed par 'dus pa'am /
translated: The Sangha is a gathering of people who do not engage in non-Dharmic activities.ğŸ”½

original: log pa'i chos mi dge ba zhig byed pa las ma zhus par song ba ni nyes byas so ;
analyzed: log pa'i chos mi dge ba zhig byed pa las ma zhus par song ba ni nyes byas so ;
translated: It is a minor infraction to go without asking permission to a gathering of the community to do non-religious work or to do something that is not religious work but nonvirtuous.

original: / mnyan pa'i yul las 'da' bar mi 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: / mnyan pa'i yul las 'da' bar mi 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not want to go beyond the place where one can hear the teachings.

original: dge 'dun 'dus te las byed pa la mchil ma dor ba'am 'chag pa'i phyir las byed pa'i sgra thos pa tshun chad du phan tshun song ba ni nyes med do //ğŸ”½'du ba las 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus te las byed pa la mchil ma dor ba'am 'chag pa'i phyir las byed pa'i sgra thos pa tshun chad du phan tshun song ba ni nyes med do // 'du ba las 'gal ba'o //
translated: There is no offense if one goes to the place where the community is gathered to do the rite, but then spits or walks around because one cannot hear the sound of the rite.ğŸ”½This is the downfall through transgressing the rule of gathering.

original: dge 'dun las byed par 'dus pa las ma zhus par song ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge 'dun las byed par 'dus pa las ma zhus par song ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the downfall through transgressing the rule of gathering.

original: // / ma gus pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / ma gus pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall through disrespect is explained as follows.

original: 'dug song mal stan dang gtsug lag khang long smros de dag bzlog pa la sogs pas bsnyen pa'i phyir ma gus shing chos kyi zhu ba sbyin pa med par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug song mal stan dang gtsug lag khang long smros de dag bzlog pa la sogs pas bsnyen pa'i phyir ma gus shing chos kyi zhu ba sbyin pa med par 'das pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall to pass by a monk without showing respect, such as by standing up, approaching him, or speaking to him, and without asking him about his well-being, if he is not too old, sick, or busy, and if you are not in a temple, on your bed, or on your seat.

original: dge 'dun gyis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams skad du bsgo ba la slar log par byed pa dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las bzlog ste bsgo ba la'ang slar 'di ltar byed pa dang 'di rnams la ma gtogs par gzhan ci la'ang rung ste ma gus
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams skad du bsgo ba la slar log par byed pa dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las bzlog ste bsgo ba la'ang slar 'di ltar byed pa dang 'di rnams la ma gtogs par gzhan ci la'ang rung ste ma gus
translated: If one does not act in accordance with the order of the Saá¹…gha, or if one acts in opposition to it, or if one does not act in accordance with the order of those named, or if one acts in opposition to it, or if one does not act in accordance with any order, out of disrespect,

original: pa'i phyir bsgo ba bzhin du mi byed cing log par byas na @179a * //
analyzed: pa'i phyir bsgo ba bzhin du mi byed cing log par byas na @179a * //
translated: then one commits an offense.

original: ltung ba'o // dge slong gi dge 'dun na rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba'o // dge slong gi dge 'dun na rtsa ba'o //
translated: The Saá¹…gha of monks is the root.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ste ma gus pa'i phyir ma mnyan cing log par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½mkhan po dang slob dpon la ni nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ste ma gus pa'i phyir ma mnyan cing log par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro // mkhan po dang slob dpon la ni nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If one does not listen to the order of the Saá¹…gha of monks out of disrespect, or if one acts in opposition to it, one commits an offense.ğŸ”½If one does not act in accordance with the order of the preceptor or the master, out of disrespect, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bsgo ba zhig la ma gus pa'i phyir log par byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bsgo ba zhig la ma gus pa'i phyir log par byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one does not act in accordance with the order of the preceptor or the master, out of disrespect, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chos ma yin pas gsol ba'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas gsol ba'o //
translated: If one requests with something that is not Dharma,

original: dge 'dun gyis mi dge ba'i chos shig gyis shig ces bsgo ba las ma byas na'ang nyes byas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mi dge ba'i chos shig gyis shig ces bsgo ba las ma byas na'ang nyes byas /
translated: if one does not act in accordance with the order of the Saá¹…gha to do something non-virtuous, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mi dge ba'i chos shig gyis shig par bsgo ste ma mnyan na nyes byas phyed /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mi dge ba'i chos shig gyis shig par bsgo ste ma mnyan na nyes byas phyed /
translated: If a preceptor or an instructor tells a monk to do something unwholesome and he does not listen, he commits a minor offense.

original: de bzhin du smra bas gnon pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du smra bas gnon pa'o //
translated: Similarly, if he does not listen to a monk who is his superior.

original: dge 'dun 'dus te las bya ba'i gros byed pa la ma gus shing gtam gzhan zer na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus te las bya ba'i gros byed pa la ma gus shing gtam gzhan zer na nyes byas /
translated: If he is disrespectful and speaks of other topics when the Saá¹…gha is gathered and discussing a legal issue, he commits a minor offense.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bsgo zhing gtam byed pa la gtam gzhan glo bur du zer ba'ang nyes byas so //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis bsgo zhing gtam byed pa la gtam gzhan glo bur du zer ba'ang nyes byas so //
translated: If he suddenly speaks of other topics when a preceptor or an instructor is speaking to him, he commits a minor offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi sna bo der spyod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sna bo der spyod pa la yang ngo //
translated: He should also be respectful when the Saá¹…gha is discussing a legal issue.

original: dge 'dun gyis las su bskos pa gang zag bcu gnyis las gang yang rung des bsgo ba la ma gus pa'i phyir de bzhin du ma byas sam log par byas na'ang ltung ba //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis las su bskos pa gang zag bcu gnyis las gang yang rung des bsgo ba la ma gus pa'i phyir de bzhin du ma byas sam log par byas na'ang ltung ba //
translated: If he does not do what he has been told to do or does the opposite because he is disrespectful of the instructions of any of the twelve types of appointed monks, he commits an offense.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis kyis gzhan zhig la spring ba'i ngag bcag na'ang ltung ngo //
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis kyis gzhan zhig la spring ba'i ngag bcag na'ang ltung ngo //
translated: If he breaks the message of a letter sent by any of the twelve types of appointed monks to someone else, he commits an offense.

original: dge 'dun bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang ngo //
translated: He should be respectful of the Buddha as he is of the Saá¹…gha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa la ma gus pa'i phyir ma mnyan tam ma byas na'ang ltung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa la ma gus pa'i phyir ma mnyan tam ma byas na'ang ltung ba'o //
translated: If one does not listen to or does not carry out the Buddha's words, it is a downfall, out of disrespect for the Buddha's words.

original: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe zhal gyis bka' stsal pa la bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe zhal gyis bka' stsal pa la bya /
translated: When the Buddha is present, one should follow his words.

original: rgyal po dang dgra bcom pa dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi bka' mi bcag / rgyal po dang dgra bcom pa dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan dang zhang blon dbang chen pos bsko ba'i tshig la ma gus pa'i bcag na'ang nyes byas /
analyzed: rgyal po dang dgra bcom pa dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi bka' mi bcag / rgyal po dang dgra bcom pa dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan dang zhang blon dbang chen pos bsko ba'i tshig la ma gus pa'i bcag na'ang nyes byas /
translated: If one disobeys the words of a king, an arhat, or the most senior monk in the community, or if one disobeys the words of a king, an arhat, the most senior monk in the community, or a powerful minister, it is a downfall if one does so out of disrespect.

original: ma gus par chud pa'o //
analyzed: ma gus par chud pa'o //
translated: If one does so out of disrespect, it is a downfall.

original: ma gus pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: ma gus pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall for disrespect is finished.

original: // / chang 'thung ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /ğŸ”½myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba myos shing ra ro bar gyur pa chang la sogs pa 'thungs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // / chang 'thung ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de / myos par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba myos shing ra ro bar gyur pa chang la sogs pa 'thungs na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The downfall for drinking alcohol is explained as follows.ğŸ”½If one drinks alcohol that causes intoxication, one commits a downfall.

original: 'di bskol na 'phos so //
analyzed: 'di bskol na 'phos so //
translated: If one drinks alcohol that has been boiled and the intoxicating property has been removed, it is not a downfall.

original: chang dang rgun chang bskol te ra ro bar yang mi 'gyur kha dog kyang chang mi 'dra dri 'ang chang mi bro na 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: chang dang rgun chang bskol te ra ro bar yang mi 'gyur kha dog kyang chang mi 'dra dri 'ang chang mi bro na 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If it is not intoxicating, even if it is the color of beer and smells like beer, there is no fault in drinking it.

original: sbang @179b ma dang tshigs ma yod bzos na der chud do //
analyzed: sbang @179b ma dang tshigs ma yod bzos na der chud do //
translated: If it is mixed with dregs or husks, it is included in those.

original: chang gi sbang ma dang me tog la sogs pa las chang du byas pa'i tshigs ma zos na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chang gi sbang ma dang me tog la sogs pa las chang du byas pa'i tshigs ma zos na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one eats the dregs of beer or the husks of flowers and so on that have been made into beer, there is an offense.

original: phabs ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: phabs ni 'du byed do //
translated: Yeast is a compounded substance.

original: phabs zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: phabs zos na nyes byas so //
translated: If one eats yeast, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: myos par byed pa ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams so //
analyzed: myos par byed pa ni rtsa ba dang sdong po dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams so //
translated: Intoxicants are the root, trunk, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las chang du byas te 'thungs pa ni ltung ba /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las chang du byas te 'thungs pa ni ltung ba /
translated: If one drinks beer made from any of these that are mentioned by name, there is an offense.

original: 'di rnams las gag kyang rung chang du ni ma byas kyi zos na smyos pa'am mi dran par 'gyur ba zhig zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: 'di rnams las gag kyang rung chang du ni ma byas kyi zos na smyos pa'am mi dran par 'gyur ba zhig zos na nyes byas /
translated: If one eats any of these that have not been made into beer, but one becomes intoxicated or loses oneâ€™s mindfulness, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chang gi dri dang ro myos par mi byed pa dang btung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: chang gi dri dang ro myos par mi byed pa dang btung ba yang ngo //
translated: Beer is the smell and taste of alcohol that intoxicates, and also that which is drunk.

original: khu ba myos par mi 'gyur la kha dog kyang chang mi 'dra la ro chang bro ba zhig 'thungs na nyes byas /
analyzed: khu ba myos par mi 'gyur la kha dog kyang chang mi 'dra la ro chang bro ba zhig 'thungs na nyes byas /
translated: If one drinks a beverage that is not like beer in color but has the taste of beer and intoxicates, it is a minor infraction.

original: nyes med pa ni kha dog tsam chang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nyes med pa ni kha dog tsam chang 'dra ba'o //
translated: There is no offense if it is just the color of beer.

original: myos par yang mi 'gyur la ro yang chang mi bro na kha dog chang 'dra ba 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: myos par yang mi 'gyur la ro yang chang mi bro na kha dog chang 'dra ba 'thungs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If it does not intoxicate and does not taste like beer, there is no offense in drinking a beverage that is the color of beer.

original: sbyor ba bzhin du myang ba dang lus la nyug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhin du myang ba dang lus la nyug pa'o //
translated: â€œAs it is preparedâ€ means as it is drunk or as it is applied to the body.

original: chang gis lus la byugs pa dang khar blugs te myangs nas ltor ma ming par slar bor ba ni nyes byas /
analyzed: chang gis lus la byugs pa dang khar blugs te myangs nas ltor ma ming par slar bor ba ni nyes byas /
translated: If one anoints oneâ€™s body with beer, drinks it, and then spits it out without swallowing it, it is a minor infraction.

original: na ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is sick.

original: nad pa la ni phan pa'i phyir chang gis lus la byugs sam khas myangs te ltor ma mid pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: nad pa la ni phan pa'i phyir chang gis lus la byugs sam khas myangs te ltor ma mid pa ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if one anoints oneâ€™s body with beer or drinks it to cure an illness, but does not swallow it.

original: chang 'thungs pa'o //
analyzed: chang 'thungs pa'o //
translated: Drinking alcohol.

original: chang 'thung ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: chang 'thung ba'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of drinking alcohol is complete.

original: // / dus ma yin par ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / dus ma yin par ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The master Jinaputra explains that â€œat the wrong timeâ€ means

analyzed: 'bhrid / phyi dro dus ma yin par shes bzhin las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / dus ma yin pa dus ma yin par phyi dro grong du song ba las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / dge slong yod pa la ma byas na'o //

original: grong 'dir 'gro'o zhes byas pa las de nyid du song yang rung ma song yang rung grong gzhan du song na nyes byas /
analyzed: grong 'dir 'gro'o zhes byas pa las de nyid du song yang rung ma song yang rung grong gzhan du song na nyes byas /
translated: If one says, â€œI will go to this village,â€ it is a minor infraction whether or not one goes there, but if one goes to another village, it is a downfall.

original: @180a * // der dge slong med na dge slong ma'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: @180a * // der dge slong med na dge slong ma'ang de bzhin no //
translated: If there are no monks in that village, the same applies to nuns.

original: phyi dro grong du 'gro ste dge slong med na dge slong ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //ğŸ”½de na'ang dge sbyong la'o //
analyzed: phyi dro grong du 'gro ste dge slong med na dge slong ma la dris te song yang nyes med do // de na'ang dge sbyong la'o //
translated: If one goes to a village in the afternoon, it is not a downfall if one asks a monk or nun about a place to stay and then goes there.ğŸ”½If there are no monks or nuns, it is not a downfall to ask a male or female novice.ğŸ”½If there are no male or female novices, it is not a downfall to ask a male or female lay practitioner.

original: drir dge slong ma yang med na dge sbyang la dris te song yang nyes med do //ğŸ”½de na'ang dge slob ma la'o //
analyzed: drir dge slong ma yang med na dge sbyang la dris te song yang nyes med do // de na'ang dge slob ma la'o //
translated: If there are no male or female lay practitioners, it is not a downfall to ask a male or female lay practitioner who has taken one precept.

original: drir dge sbyong pha'ang med na dge slob ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //ğŸ”½de na'ang dge sbyong ma la'o //ğŸ”½dge slob ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: drir dge sbyong pha'ang med na dge slob ma la dris te song yang nyes med do // de na'ang dge sbyong ma la'o // dge slob ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //
translated: If there are no male or female lay practitioners who have taken one precept, it is not a downfall to ask a male or female lay practitioner who has taken five precepts.

original: dge sbyong ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma la dris te song yang nyes med do //
translated: If there are no male or female lay practitioners who have taken five precepts, it is not a downfall to ask a male or female lay practitioner who has taken ten precepts.

original: dge sbyong ma yang med de rkyen cig byung nas mi 'gror mi rung na ma dris par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yang med de rkyen cig byung nas mi 'gror mi rung na ma dris par song yang nyes med do //
translated: If there is no renunciate, and it is not suitable to go without asking, then there is no offense if one goes without asking.

original: mi chud na med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi chud na med pa bzhin no //
translated: If one does not understand, it is like not understanding.

original: brda mi phrad pa'am skad mi mthun pa la dris pa ni dris par mi chud de /
analyzed: brda mi phrad pa'am skad mi mthun pa la dris pa ni dris par mi chud de /
translated: If one asks someone who does not understand the language or whose language is not the same, it is not considered asking.

original: dge slong dang dge sbyong med na ma dris par song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge sbyong med na ma dris par song yang nyes med do //
translated: If there is no monk or renunciate, then there is no offense if one goes without asking.

original: gzhan yod la brda mi phrad pa la dris pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod la brda mi phrad pa la dris pa ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If, when the Pratimoksha is being explained, one says, â€œI have just now heard and understood such and such words of the scriptures, such as the four defeats,â€ then, if one has already experienced the Poá¹£adha twice, one commits an offense.

analyzed: gzhan zhig byas zin pa zhig byin pa ni blangs shing spyad kyang nyes med /
translated: There is no fault if one uses an item that someone else has made and discarded.

original: bcag gam zhes ma dris par mthol ba ma bzung shig / dge slong rus pa la sogs pa la khab ral byas pa zhig ltung bar gyur pa zhig mthol du 'ongs na khab ral de bcag gam zhes dris la bcag na mthol du chug shig ma bcag gam
analyzed: bcag gam zhes ma dris par mthol ba ma bzung shig / dge slong rus pa la sogs pa la khab ral byas pa zhig ltung bar gyur pa zhig mthol du 'ongs na khab ral de bcag gam zhes dris la bcag na mthol du chug shig ma bcag gam
translated: If a monk who has committed the downfall of making a needle or awl from bone or similar substances comes to confess this, he should be asked, â€œHave you broken the needle or awl?â€ If he has, he may confess. If he has not, he should be told, â€œDo not confess until you have broken it.â€

original: ma dris par mthol du bcug na dge slong mthol tshangs kyi spangs pa byed pa de nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma dris par mthol du bcug na dge slong mthol tshangs kyi spangs pa byed pa de nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not ask, but makes him confess, the monk who makes him confess commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ste ma bcug na ma bshags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ste ma bcug na ma bshags pa bzhin no //
translated: If he does not make him confess, it is as if he had not confessed.

original: s'u tra ltag ma ltar khab ral ma bcag gam mthol tshangs ma byas pa dang 'dra ste ltung ba yod pa tshangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: s'u tra ltag ma ltar khab ral ma bcag gam mthol tshangs ma byas pa dang 'dra ste ltung ba yod pa tshangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like the upper sutra: if the needle case is not broken or the monk has not confessed, he does not become pure, even though he has an offense.
The lower five

original: ma lnga po de yang spyad cing sbyar gnyis po ni bshus nas so //
analyzed: ma lnga po de yang spyad cing sbyar gnyis po ni bshus nas so //
translated: are also offenses if used or applied. The latter two are offenses if worn.

original: rkang pa dang g-yogs pa dang gding ba dang g-yan pa dang ral chen lnga yang ltung bar 'gyur te mthol du 'ongs na lhag pa bcad cing bshus sam zhes dris /
analyzed: rkang pa dang g-yogs pa dang gding ba dang g-yan pa dang ral chen lnga yang ltung bar 'gyur te mthol du 'ongs na lhag pa bcad cing bshus sam zhes dris /
translated: The fiveâ€”shoes, a foot wiper, a sitting mat, a blanket, and a large blanketâ€”are also offenses. If he comes to confess, he should be asked, â€œHave you cut and removed the extra part?â€

original: ma dris sam ma bshus na mthol du bcug na mthol ba'i dbang po dge slong nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: ma dris sam ma bshus na mthol du bcug na mthol ba'i dbang po dge slong nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If he has not been asked, or if he has not cut and removed it, and he is made to confess, the monk who makes him confess commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba 'byung ba'i dge slong tshangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byung ba'i dge slong tshangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The monk who has incurred the offense does not become pure.

original: khab ral sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: khab ral sbyor ba'o //
translated: The needle case is applied.

original: rva las khab ral byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rva las khab ral byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall for making a needle case from horn is finished.

original: // / khri'i rkang pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / khri'i rkang pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The offense of the legs of the bed is explained.

original: rkang pa thung ngu'i khri la mi nyal /
analyzed: rkang pa thung ngu'i khri la mi nyal /
translated: Do not sleep on a bed with short legs.

original: khri rkang pa thung ngu la mi nyal nyal na nyes byas /
analyzed: khri rkang pa thung ngu la mi nyal nyal na nyes byas /
translated: If you sleep on a bed with short legs, it is a minor infraction.

original: nyal ba'i gnas su chud pa'i khri'i drung gi phyogs su rkang pa mi bkru lha ma yod na'o //
analyzed: nyal ba'i gnas su chud pa'i khri'i drung gi phyogs su rkang pa mi bkru lha ma yod na'o //
translated: Do not wash your feet in the direction of a bed that is within the sleeping quarters, if there is a hearth.

original: nyal khri'i glor chol zangs la sogs pa snod med par sa la rkang pa mi bkru bkrus na nyes byas /
analyzed: nyal khri'i glor chol zangs la sogs pa snod med par sa la rkang pa mi bkru bkrus na nyes byas /
translated: Do not wash your feet on the ground, without a basin, such as a metal basin, at the foot of a bed. If you do, it is a minor infraction.

original: nyal khri rkang pa thung du zhig la dge slong cig gis glor rkang pa bkrus nas sa la chu ltung ba'i nang du sbrul cig nyal nas khri thog nas dge slong bsam gtan byed cing yur ba las sbrul gyis 'phral la btsugs te shi nas khri rkang pa
analyzed: nyal khri rkang pa thung du zhig la dge slong cig gis glor rkang pa bkrus nas sa la chu ltung ba'i nang du sbrul cig nyal nas khri thog nas dge slong bsam gtan byed cing yur ba las sbrul gyis 'phral la btsugs te shi nas khri rkang pa
translated: A monk washed his feet at the foot of a bed with short legs. Water fell on the ground and a snake that was sleeping there bit the monk who was meditating on the bed and he died. The Buddha prohibited beds with short legs and washing oneâ€™s feet at the foot of a bed.

original: thung du ma byed cig mal gyi glor rkang pa ma 'khru cig ces bcas /
analyzed: thung du ma byed cig mal gyi glor rkang pa ma 'khru cig ces bcas /
translated: Do not make the legs of the bed short. Do not wash your feet at the foot of the bed.

original: lham yod na phyi rol tam gzhan du rkang pa bkrus la lham gyon te mal du 'gro //ğŸ”½mgo mjug gi mtha' ma gtogs te gzhan du'o //
analyzed: lham yod na phyi rol tam gzhan du rkang pa bkrus la lham gyon te mal du 'gro // mgo mjug gi mtha' ma gtogs te gzhan du'o //
translated: If you have shoes, wash your feet outside or elsewhere and then put on your shoes before going to bed.ğŸ”½Do not wash your feet on the bed, except in the case of an emergency.

original: lham med na mal khri'i glor rkang pa mi bkru bar sngas sam 'phongs shig tu bkru'o //
analyzed: lham med na mal khri'i glor rkang pa mi bkru bar sngas sam 'phongs shig tu bkru'o //
translated: If you do not have shoes, wash your feet on the edge of the bed, not on the bed itself, but on a pillow or a cushion.

original: mal stan chen po'am mthon por 'dug pa la nyal bar mi bya /
analyzed: mal stan chen po'am mthon por 'dug pa la nyal bar mi bya /
translated: Do not sleep on a large or high bed.

original: rin po che dang gser dang dngul las byas pa'i khri chen po dang khri rkang pa ring po mthon po la mi 'dug 'dug na nyes byas /
analyzed: rin po che dang gser dang dngul las byas pa'i khri chen po dang khri rkang pa ring po mthon po la mi 'dug 'dug na nyes byas /
translated: If you sit on a high, precious throne made of gold or silver, or on a high, long-legged throne, you commit an offense.

original: med na grong bar du snga ma bya /
analyzed: med na grong bar du snga ma bya /
translated: If you do not have any other choice, you may sit on such a throne in a village, but not in the wilderness.

original: khyim pas grong bar du rin po che la sogs pa'i khri steng du bzhag na khri gzhan med dam zhes dris te med na 'dug kyang nyes med de 'phres shing nyal du mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: khyim pas grong bar du rin po che la sogs pa'i khri steng du bzhag na khri gzhan med dam zhes dris te med na 'dug kyang nyes med de 'phres shing nyal du mi gnang ngo //
translated: If a layperson has placed a precious object on a throne in his house, you should ask him whether there is another seat. If he says there is not, you may sit on the throne, but you should not sit with your legs stretched out or lie down on it.

original: brtags pa ni rkang pa bzhi dang bcas pa la nyal ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni rkang pa bzhi dang bcas pa la nyal ba'o //
translated: â€œTo inspectâ€ means to sleep on a bed with four legs.

original: khri rkang pa thung ngu la rkang pa'i tshad du bya ba'i phyir rkang pa bzhi'i 'og tu rten pas btod de nyal ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: khri rkang pa thung ngu la rkang pa'i tshad du bya ba'i phyir rkang pa bzhi'i 'og tu rten pas btod de nyal ba ni nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault to sleep on a bed with four legs, which are the size of a cubit, and which are placed under the bed to make the legs shorter.ğŸ”½Do not sit on a bench on top of a bed.

original: khri'i steng gi khri'u la mi 'dug / khri gcig gi steng du gcig bzhag pa'i steng du mi 'dug 'dug na nyes byas /
analyzed: khri'i steng gi khri'u la mi 'dug / khri gcig gi steng du gcig bzhag pa'i steng du mi 'dug 'dug na nyes byas /
translated: Do not sit on a bed on top of another bed.

original: tshad las 'das pa byas @182b sam byed du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: tshad las 'das pa byas @182b sam byed du bcug pa'o //
translated: If you do, you commit an offense.ğŸ”½If you make a bed with legs that are more than a cubit long, or if you have it made, you commit an offense.

original: khri rkang ba thung ngu la ma nyal cig ces khrims bcas pa dang drug sdes khru bcu gnyis kyi srid kyi rkang pa yod pa'i khri byas pa las bcas te rkang pa tshad las 'das par bdag gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug pa las ltung bar 'gyurğŸ”½te yan lag gcig tshun chad pa gnyis ma yin pa gsum mo //
analyzed: khri rkang ba thung ngu la ma nyal cig ces khrims bcas pa dang drug sdes khru bcu gnyis kyi srid kyi rkang pa yod pa'i khri byas pa las bcas te rkang pa tshad las 'das par bdag gis byas sam gzhan byed du bcug pa las ltung bar 'gyurğŸ”½te yan lag gcig tshun chad pa gnyis ma yin pa gsum mo //
translated: You commit an offense if you make the legs more than a cubit long, but not if you make them less than a cubit long.

original: khri rkang pa ring po dang khri shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba gnyis ma gtogs par gding ba dang g-yan pa dgab pa dang ras chen gsum yang tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khri rkang pa ring po dang khri shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba gnyis ma gtogs par gding ba dang g-yan pa dgab pa dang ras chen gsum yang tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for the two downfalls of a long-legged bed and a bed stuffed with cotton wool, the three downfalls of a mat, a blanket, and a large piece of cloth also become downfalls if they are made larger than the prescribed size.

original: khri dang khri'u'o //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u'o //
translated: Beds and benches.

original: khri dang khri'u rkang pa ring du byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / dge 'dun gyi'o //ğŸ”½khri dang khri'u byas pa dge 'dun gyi yang yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / mdo bzhin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u rkang pa ring du byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / dge 'dun gyi'o // khri dang khri'u byas pa dge 'dun gyi yang yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / mdo bzhin pa yang ngo //
translated: A downfall is accrued by making the legs of a bed or bench longer than the prescribed size.ğŸ”½A downfall is accrued by making a bed or bench for the saá¹…gha longer than the prescribed size.

original: khri'u la shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba yang dge 'dun gyi yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro rkang pa dag go //
analyzed: khri'u la shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba yang dge 'dun gyi yin pa las ltung bar 'gyur ro rkang pa dag go //
translated: A downfall is accrued by making a bed stuffed with cotton wool for the saá¹…gha.ğŸ”½A downfall is accrued by making the legs of a bench longer than the prescribed size.

original: khri'u rkang pa tshad las 'das pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag thor bu smos pa 'di rnams dang ldan par 'gyur na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: khri'u rkang pa tshad las 'das pa las ltung bar 'gyur te yan lag gcig / yan lag thor bu smos pa 'di rnams dang ldan par 'gyur na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one possesses these individual downfalls, one has accrued a downfall.

original: 'di dag gi khri'i tshad de mu'i phyogs ma gtogs te'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi khri'i tshad de mu'i phyogs ma gtogs te'o //
translated: The measure of the height of these is the cubit of the Buddha, except for the side of the foot.

original: khri'i rkang pa'i tshad ni grva'i mtha' ma'i gru bzhir 'dug pa'i rngams ma gtogs par rkang pa nyi tshe la 'khru gang brtsi zhing gcal lo //
analyzed: khri'i rkang pa'i tshad ni grva'i mtha' ma'i gru bzhir 'dug pa'i rngams ma gtogs par rkang pa nyi tshe la 'khru gang brtsi zhing gcal lo //
translated: The measure of the foot is the cubit of the Buddha, except for the four corners of the foot, which are one cubit of the Buddha.

original: de las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one does it exceeding that, there is an offense.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsum gyis so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsum gyis so //
translated: The cubit of the Buddha is three cubits of a human.

original: khru gang gi tshad du brtsi ba ni mi 'bring po'i khru gsum la bde bar gshegs pa'i khru gang yod par brtsis la mi 'bring po'i khru gang du khri'i rkang pa bya'o //
analyzed: khru gang gi tshad du brtsi ba ni mi 'bring po'i khru gsum la bde bar gshegs pa'i khru gang yod par brtsis la mi 'bring po'i khru gang du khri'i rkang pa bya'o //
translated: The measure of the cubit of the Buddha is calculated as one cubit of the Buddha for every three cubits of a human. The foot of the bed should be made one cubit of a human.

original: de ma thag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ma thag pa yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to the mattress.

original: gding ba dang g-yan pa dang ras chen gsum yang khru tshad 'di ltar brtsis pa'i thang du bcal te bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba dang g-yan pa dang ras chen gsum yang khru tshad 'di ltar brtsis pa'i thang du bcal te bya'o //
translated: The three, the mattress, the woolen blanket, and the large blanket, are calculated in cubits and made.

original: rkang pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: The foot is established.

original: khri rkang pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: khri rkang pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall for exceeding the measure of the bedâ€™s foot is finished.

original: // / g-yogs pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / g-yogs pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall for the covering is explained.

original: shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'o //
translated: It is cotton.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri shing bal gyi bar tshangs can du 'dug pa las bar nas shing bal byung ste khri'i steng du g-yogs shing gtor na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri shing bal gyi bar tshangs can du 'dug pa las bar nas shing bal byung ste khri'i steng du g-yogs shing gtor na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sits on a sangha-owned bed that is covered with cotton, and cotton comes out from the middle and covers the bed, one commits an offense.

original: bdag gis sam bcug na'o //ğŸ”½bdag gis shing bal phyung ste g-yogs sam gzhan la g-yogs su @183a * //
analyzed: bdag gis sam bcug na'o // bdag gis shing bal phyung ste g-yogs sam gzhan la g-yogs su @183a * //
translated: If one does it oneself or has someone else do it.

original: bcug kyang rung ste ltung par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcug kyang rung ste ltung par 'gyur /
translated: If one removes the cotton and covers it oneself, or has someone else do it, one commits an offense.

original: shing bal la lnga ste shal mal dang aa ka dang ka sha dang bo ka dang me ra ka na gyi'o //
analyzed: shing bal la lnga ste shal mal dang aa ka dang ka sha dang bo ka dang me ra ka na gyi'o //
translated: There are five kinds of cotton: cotton from the salmali tree, cotton from the aaka tree, cotton from the kasha tree, cotton from the boka tree, and cotton from the merakana tree.

original: shing bal ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las gang gis g-yogs kyang rung ste phyung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing bal ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las gang gis g-yogs kyang rung ste phyung na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one covers with any of these cottons, and removes it, one commits an offense.

original: g-yogs pa'o // dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: g-yogs pa'o // dge 'dun gyi khri la shing bal gyis g-yogs pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The offense regarding covering a sangha-owned bed with cotton is finished.

original: // / gding ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / gding ba'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The offense regarding sitting mats is explained.

original: gding ba'o // gding ba byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gding ba'o // gding ba byas pa las ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: It is a sitting mat. One commits an offense by making a sitting mat.

original: tshad 'di lta ste srid du khru gsum /
analyzed: tshad 'di lta ste srid du khru gsum /
translated: The measure is as follows: three cubits in length.

original: gding ba'i tshad ni chur mi 'bring po'i khru gsum du bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba'i tshad ni chur mi 'bring po'i khru gsum du bya'o //
translated: The measure of the sitting mat is to be made three cubits of the central Indian measure.

original: mi byed na phyed dang do bsnan /
analyzed: mi byed na phyed dang do bsnan /
translated: If one does not make it, one adds half and one-third.

original: gding ba khru gsum du byas te spyad pa la au da'i lus ring ste gding ba ma chog nas tha ma lo ma dag gis mthud pa las gnang ste khru phyed dang dos bsnan te khru phyed dang ldar byas kyang ma nyes /
analyzed: gding ba khru gsum du byas te spyad pa la au da'i lus ring ste gding ba ma chog nas tha ma lo ma dag gis mthud pa las gnang ste khru phyed dang dos bsnan te khru phyed dang ldar byas kyang ma nyes /
translated: When one uses a sitting mat made three cubits, if one's body is tall like Udayana and the sitting mat is not sufficient, one is permitted to add the end with leaves. Adding half a cubit and one-third, it is made half a cubit and one-third. If one does not add, there is no fault.

original: khru gsum du byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: khru gsum du byas kyang nyes med /
translated: If one makes it three cubits, there is no fault.

original: de'i zheng ni khru do dang sor drug go //
analyzed: de'i zheng ni khru do dang sor drug go //
translated: Its width is two cubits and six finger breadths.

original: gding ba'i zhing ni khru do dang sor drug gi thad du bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba'i zhing ni khru do dang sor drug gi thad du bya'o //
translated: The sitting mat is to be made two cubits and six finger breadths wide.

original: zheng dang chu'i tshad ni 'di las lhag par byas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zheng dang chu'i tshad ni 'di las lhag par byas na ltung ba'o //
translated: If one makes it wider or longer than this measure, there is an offense.

original: nyes byas pa ni 'di nas bri ba la bsngos na'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni 'di nas bri ba la bsngos na'o //
translated: If one reduces it from this, there is an offense if one dedicates it.

original: lus ring po khru phyed dang lnga dgos pa las de bas na chung du byas sam lus chung ngu khru gsum dgos pa las de las chung du byas kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: lus ring po khru phyed dang lnga dgos pa las de bas na chung du byas sam lus chung ngu khru gsum dgos pa las de las chung du byas kyang nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes it less than the required length of one cubit and five finger-widths, or if one makes it less than the required length of three cubits, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mdo bzhin gnyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: mdo bzhin gnyis kyang ngo //
translated: Also, two robes.

original: g-yan ba dang ras chen gnyis kyang tshad las chung ngu byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: g-yan ba dang ras chen gnyis kyang tshad las chung ngu byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one makes the itch-covering cloth and the large rain cloak less than the required size, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gding bar chud pa'o //
analyzed: gding bar chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in the sitting mat.

original: gding pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gding pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of exceeding the size for the sitting mat is finished.

original: // / g-yan pa dgab pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / g-yan pa dgab pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall on the itch-covering cloth is explained.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes the itch-covering cloth exceeding the size, one commits a downfall.

original: khru drug dang gsum mo //
analyzed: khru drug dang gsum mo //
translated: Six cubits and three.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni zheng du khru gsum chur khru drug tu bya'o //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni zheng du khru gsum chur khru drug tu bya'o //
translated: The size of the itch-covering cloth is three cubits in width and six cubits in length.

original: g-yan ba dgab par chud pa'o //
analyzed: g-yan ba dgab par chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in the itch-covering cloth.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The downfall of exceeding the size for the itch-covering cloth is finished.

original: // / ras chen kyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / ras chen kyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall on the large rain cloak is explained.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen /
translated: The large rain cloak for the rainy season.

original: ras chen tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ras chen tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one makes a large rain cloak exceeding the measure, one commits an infraction.

original: dgu dang gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
analyzed: dgu dang gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
translated: Nine, three, and eighteen finger breadths.

original: ras chen gyi tshad ni zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad chur dgu ste de las tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ras chen gyi tshad ni zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad chur dgu ste de las tshad las 'das par byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The measure of a large rain cloak is three cubits and eighteen finger breadths in width, and nine cubits in length. If one makes it exceeding the measure, one commits an infraction.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen du chud pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen du chud pa'o //
translated: It is included in the large rain cloak for the rainy season.

original: ras chen tshad las 'das par byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: ras chen tshad las 'das par byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The infraction of making a large rain cloak exceeding the measure is finished.

original: // / bde @183b bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bde @183b bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The infraction of the Sugata's Dharma robe is explained.

original: lnga dang gsum ste ston pa bdag gi khru dang chos gos so //
analyzed: lnga dang gsum ste ston pa bdag gi khru dang chos gos so //
translated: Five and three, the Teacher's cubit, and the Dharma robe.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru chur lnga zheng du gsum mo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi khru chur lnga zheng du gsum mo //
translated: The measure of the Sugata's Dharma robe is five cubits of the Sugata himself in length, and three in width.

original: dge slong gis chos gos 'di'i tshad du byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos 'di'i tshad du byas na ltung bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If a monk makes a Dharma robe to this measure, he commits an infraction.

original: de lta bu ma yin na //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na //
translated: If it is not like that,

original: dge slong la zhig lus bde bar gshegs pa tsam phod pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong la zhig lus bde bar gshegs pa tsam phod pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a monk makes a robe the size of the Tathagata's robe, he is not guilty.

original: de'i tshad dam de las lhag pa'i chos gos byas sam byed du bcug na'o //ğŸ”½dge slong gzhan bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas sam de las lhag par byas na bdag gis byas kyang rung /
analyzed: de'i tshad dam de las lhag pa'i chos gos byas sam byed du bcug na'o // dge slong gzhan bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas sam de las lhag par byas na bdag gis byas kyang rung /
translated: If he makes a robe the size of the Tathagata's robe or larger, or if he has one made.

original: gzhan byed du bcug kyang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug kyang rung ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk makes a robe the size of the Tathagata's robe or larger, whether he makes it himself or has it made for him, he becomes guilty.

original: de mi bcang /
analyzed: de mi bcang /
translated: He must not keep it.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas pa mi bcang bcangs bzhin du mthol tshangs byas kyang tshangs par mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos su chud pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas pa mi bcang bcangs bzhin du mthol tshangs byas kyang tshangs par mi 'gyur ro // bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos su chud pa'o //
translated: If he keeps a robe the size of the Tathagata's robe, he becomes guilty. If he confesses it, he is purified.ğŸ”½The Tathagata's robe is the size of the Tathagata's robe.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
translated: The precept concerning the Tathagata's robe is finished.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba rdzogs so //
translated: The precept concerning the single robe is finished.

original: dgu bcu'i ltung ba gtsang ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: dgu bcu'i ltung ba gtsang ma rdzogs so /
translated: The precept concerning the ninety pure precepts is finished.

original: // / gtsang ma ni sum cu spang ba'i ltung ba ni rdzas spang dgos pas btsog pa zhes byas ba 'di ni ltung bar chad pas gtsang ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // / gtsang ma ni sum cu spang ba'i ltung ba ni rdzas spang dgos pas btsog pa zhes byas ba 'di ni ltung bar chad pas gtsang ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the pure because of the interruption of the downfall.

original: grong so sor mthol pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: grong so sor mthol pa la 'chad de /
translated: It is explained that confession is to be made individually in the village.

original: 'bhrid / gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong mas bsham par shes bzhin pa las mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bhrid / gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong mas bsham par shes bzhin pa las mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä« who is not a relative sets out food, knowing that it is so, there is a downfall.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma las so //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma las so //
translated: From a bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä« who is not a relative.

original: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma grong bar na zan slong zhing 'dug pa las dge slong gis zan blangs te zos na mthol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma grong bar na zan slong zhing 'dug pa las dge slong gis zan blangs te zos na mthol bar 'gyur //
translated: If a bhiká¹£u takes food and eats it from a bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä« who is not a relative and who is staying in the village, there is a downfall.

original: bdag gis byin te 'dris pa la ma yin bdag kyang grong na 'dug la bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs te zos pa las so //
analyzed: bdag gis byin te 'dris pa la ma yin bdag kyang grong na 'dug la bza' ba dang bca' ba blangs te zos pa las so //
translated: If one gives to oneself, not to an acquaintance, and if one stays in the village and takes food and eats it.

original: dge slong ma nyid kyis lag nas kyang byin dge 'dun phal mo che mchod ston gsol pa la dge slong mas brims pa yang ma yin par dge slong ma grong bar na slong zhing 'dug pa las bza' ba dang bca' ba gang yang rung ste dge slong ma'iğŸ”½lag nas blangs te zos na mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma nyid kyis lag nas kyang byin dge 'dun phal mo che mchod ston gsol pa la dge slong mas brims pa yang ma yin par dge slong ma grong bar na slong zhing 'dug pa las bza' ba dang bca' ba gang yang rung ste dge slong ma'i lag nas blangs te zos na mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a nun herself gives food to a monk, and if the monk does not distribute the food to the majority of the community, and if the nun is not staying in a village, and if the monk eats food that he has taken with his own hand from the hand of a nun, then he must acknowledge the infraction.

original: dge slong mas drung na 'dug pa'i mi gzhan zhig gi lag tu byin te mi des dge slong gi lag tu byin yang mthol bar 'gyur @184a * //
analyzed: dge slong mas drung na 'dug pa'i mi gzhan zhig gi lag tu byin te mi des dge slong gi lag tu byin yang mthol bar 'gyur @184a * //
translated: If a nun gives food to a man who is sitting nearby, and if that man gives it to the monk, then the monk must acknowledge the infraction.

original: ro ; / dbyar mo thang gi grong ma yin no //
analyzed: ro ; / dbyar mo thang gi grong ma yin no //
translated: It is not a village if it is a summer pasture.

original: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang du dge slong phas zas zos sam zan blangs pa ni grong bar du mi brtsi ste nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang du dge slong phas zas zos sam zan blangs pa ni grong bar du mi brtsi ste nyes med do //
translated: If a monk eats food or takes food in a nunnery, it is not considered a village, and there is no fault.

original: dge slong gi gnas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a monkâ€™s residence.

original: dge slong gis gtsug lag khang ngam dge slong gi gnas su dge slong mas zan bskyal te byin pa yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis gtsug lag khang ngam dge slong gi gnas su dge slong mas zan bskyal te byin pa yang nyes med do //
translated: It is also not a fault if a monk gives food to a nun in a temple or in the dwelling of a monk.

original: nam mkha' ni phyed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni phyed do //
translated: The sky is neutral.

original: nam mkha' la dge slong ma 'dug ste dge slong pas zan blangs pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la dge slong ma 'dug ste dge slong pas zan blangs pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If a nun sits in the sky and a monk receives food, it is a fault.

original: mi nye bar bzhag pa las blangs na bzhag pa de las ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nye bar bzhag pa las blangs na bzhag pa de las ma yin no //
translated: If it is received from what is not set out, it is not from that which is set out.

original: dge slong mas dge slong pha la sbyin pa'i phyir khyim pa'am mi gzhan zhig khyim du gtams te bzhag na gtams pa'i mi des dge slong la byin te zos pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong pha la sbyin pa'i phyir khyim pa'am mi gzhan zhig khyim du gtams te bzhag na gtams pa'i mi des dge slong la byin te zos pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If a nun has a householder or another person set out food in a house for the sake of giving it to a monk, and the person who has set it out gives it to the monk and he eats it, there is no fault.

original: dge slong ma las zas blangs zhes bya ba so sor mthol ba dang po'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma las zas blangs zhes bya ba so sor mthol ba dang po'o //
translated: Receiving food from a nun is the first individual confession.

original: dge slong ma las grong bar du zan blangs te za ba'i mthol ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge slong ma las grong bar du zan blangs te za ba'i mthol ba rdzogs so /
translated: The confession for receiving food from a nun up to the village is finished.

original: // / khyim gyi so sor mthol ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / khyim gyi so sor mthol ba la 'chad de /
translated: The individual confessions for the household are explained.

original: de la bca' ba byin sgom dang tshod ma dang mchod ston dang yang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa des sam dge slong gzhan gyis bstan par 'jug cing dge slong ma 'dug pa las byed do //
analyzed: de la bca' ba byin sgom dang tshod ma dang mchod ston dang yang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa des sam dge slong gzhan gyis bstan par 'jug cing dge slong ma 'dug pa las byed do //
translated: In this case, the food is prepared by the nuns, and the monks are invited by the donor or by other monks.

original: sbyin bdag khyim pas rgyu sbyar te mchod ston byas pa las dge slong mas bshams te dge slong gcig la yang rung zad par yang rung 'bras dang tshod ma la sogs pa gsol zhes lhag par bdar na dge slong gag kyang rung gcig gis re zhig 'drim par

original: de ste de'i ngo bo dang gnyen yang ma yin pas spyan drangs na'o //
analyzed: de ste de'i ngo bo dang gnyen yang ma yin pas spyan drangs na'o //
translated: If it is not the essence of that, and it is not a relative, then it is invited.

original: sbyin bdag khyim pas spyan drangs pa la khyim pas dge slong ma zhal ta dang tho ngan byed du bcug pa dang khyim pa de'i gnyen du 'ongs pa'i dge slong ma zhig gis bshams shing bdar ba ni mthol bar mi 'gyur te nyes med do //

translated: If a householder invites a monk, and the householder makes a nun serve and do menial tasks, and a nun who is a relative of that householder sets it out and serves it, there is no offense.

original: ma gtogs pa ni rims ston pa dang ma thob pa la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ni rims ston pa dang ma thob pa la sbyin pa'o //
translated: Except for the one who shows the order of eating and the one who gives to those who have not received.

translated: If one does not know the order of eating and distributes it, and if one says, â€œEat here,â€ to monks who have not received food, there is no offense.

original: bar du ma shom shig ces dge slong gag kyang rung cig gis bsgo shig / ma bsgo na dge slong gsum yan chad dge 'dun du langs pa ni zos pa dang ma zos pa'i dge slong kun mthol bar 'gyur ro //
